title: HOUSE UNIT PLANS HEARINGS BY MAY 1
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 Members of the House Judiciary Committee ere considering a timetable that envisions beginning hearings on impeachment evidence by May 1 and completing committee action by midJune.

title: QE 2 Interrupts Cruise With Trouble in Boilers
description: The Queen Elizabeth 2 was reported last night to have suffered boiler trouble in heavy seas 280 miles southwest of Bermuda. She interrupted a Carribean cruise to head for the nearest port in Bermuda.

title: Business Briefs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 1 (Reuters)The price Saudi Arabian crude being supplied to French oil companies under a governmenttogovernment threeyear supply contract has been reduced from its initial agreed level of the posted price plus 5 cents a barrel to 93 per cent of the posted price, the Middle East Economic Survey, a weekly review of news on Middle East oil, reported today.

title: Loeb, Rhodes Tokyo Branch
description: TOKYO, April 1 (AP)  Japan's Ministry licensed today local branch for Loeb, Rhodes & Co. allowing the United States securities firm to engage in the securities business here. Loeb, Rhodes and Co, is the second foreign securities firm that has opened a branch in Japan, following Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc.

title: U.S. FINDS RIGHTS VIOLATED BYLINES OF DISTRICTS HERE
description: WASHINGTON, April 1The Justice Department announced today that the composition of a number of state legislative districts in Manhattan and Brooklyn and one Brooklyn Congressional district violated the Voting Rights Act of 1970. The district lines will have to be redrawn to eliminate racial discrimination before elections can be held there, the department said.

title: Mets, Yanks Back Girls in Little League
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 1Girls should be allowed to play Little League baseball With boys, a majority of Yankees and Mets concluded today.

title: No Easy Answers
description: Responsible opponents of the, campaign reform bill now pending in the. Senate have not only concentrated their fire on the bill's public financing provisions but have also offered answers of their own. Senator Weicker, Connecticut Republican, urges a drastic shortening campaigns, arguing that Federal financing only acknowledges the size of the problem but doesn't reform it.

title: $100,000 Given to M.I.T.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., April 1 (AP)The Massachusetts Institute of Technology will be able to study the possible use of methanol as a gasoline additive to improve fuel economy with a $100,000 grant from a Minnesota industrialist. John B. Hawley, president of the Northern Pump Company of Minneapolis, donated the funds to MIT's Energy Laboratory to establish a methanol study center.

title: HIGH COURT RULES BANKS MUST GIVE DATA ON DEPOSITS
description: WASHINGTON, April 1The Supreme Court upheld today the constitutionality of the corn. troversial Bank Secrecy Act,, overriding charges that the privacy of depositors is invaded by reports required by the act.

title: Emergency Aid to Aged Offered by Albany G.O.P.
description: ALBANY, April 1Republican legislative members today announced a proposal to authorize emergency assistance payments to the aged, blind and disabled who are eligible for benefits under the Federal Supplemental Security Income program.

title: U.S. Sets a 5.6% Rise In Food Stamps July 1
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 (AP)  Millions of needy Americans will get additional food stamps beginning July 1 to help meet soaring grocery costs, the Agriculture Department announced today.

title: Dolphins' Fans Voice Irritation
description: MIAMI, April 1Like the run on the banks in the nineteenthirties, Miami football fans were concerned today that the defection of three of their favorite players to the World Football League would trigger a run on the Dolphins.

title: Dolphins Go After Unsigned
description: The fallout from the signing of the Miami Dolphin stars, Larry Csonka, Paul Warfield and Jim Kiick, by the World Football League was considerable yesterday.

title: Supplemental Insecurity
description: Social Security benefits jumped 7 per cent yesterday, but the muchvaunted increase turned out to be only an April Fools Day mirage for 1.9 million of the nation's elderly  108,000 in New York State who participate in the allied Supplemental Security Income program which the Federal Government started last January. Under existing laws, their supplemental payments will be reduced in the amount of the new Social Security increase.

title: Japanese Auto Exports Rose 19.7% in February
description: TOKYO, April 1 (AP)Japanese auto exports totaled 199,815 units in February, up 18.2 per cent from January and up 19.7 per cent from a year earlier, the Japan Automobile Manufacturers Association announced today.

title: 5 Sports Cut Back at Oregon State
description: CORVALLIS, Ore., April 1 (AP)Oregon State University will discontinue national competition in baseball, golf, tennis, swimming and crew and will reduce funding for them, President Robert MacVicar announced today. Regional competition in the sports will continue. The budget for football, basketball, wrestling and track will be maintained or increased.

title: Oscar Night Also Big One For a Factory in Illinois
description: CRYSTAL LAKE, IllTonight when some Hollywood lovely accepts her Oscar award and gushes thanks into the microphone, Paul Rathke may very well toss a battered slipper at his television screen here.

title: Baseball Balk Line Rejected for 1974
description: Baseball's official playing rules committee has rejected adoption of balk lines for pitchers, Johnny Johnston, chairman of the committee, said yesterday.

title: Campus Under Fire
description: The International Council on the Future of the University is composed of distinguished American and European scholars concerned about political pressures and outright coercion that threaten to debase higher education. Such apprehension is clearly justified by the shocking experience of some European campuses where radical extremists have virtually banished academic as well as political freedom. In American universities, too, subtle and overt pressures have often limited free debate.

title: Ironic Happenings at Clyne Maxon
description: Ironically, yesterday, the very, day that the merger of Clyne Maxon, Inc., and Dusenbetry Ruriani Kornhauser became official, it was announced that the former agency had lost one of Its major clients, the General Electric Housewares Business Division, with billings in the neighborhood of $7millirm.

title: Britain Presses Market; Warns of Vote on Quitting
description: LUXEMBOURG, April 1Fifteen months after her entry into the Common Market, Britsain met today with her European partners to tell them that unless major changes were made she would put the question of withdrawal to a popular vote.

title: BACHE SHIFTS FEES ON SMALL TRADE
description: Bache & Co., Inc., yesterday became the third leading stock brokerage house to revamp its price schedule for small investors.

title: S.E.C. Official Cites Pressures To Avoid Embarrassing Nixon
description: A Securities and Exchange Commission official testified yesterday at the. MitchellStans trial that he had been under considerable pressure from his superiors around the time of the 1972 election to avoid doing anything that would be politically embarrassing to President Nixon.

title: Chapin Case Jury Chosen; Segretti to Testily Today
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 A jury was selected and sequestered today for the trial of Dwight L. Chapin, President Nixon's former appointments secretary, who is charged with having lied to a grand jury that was investigating dirty tricks in the last Presidential election campaign.

title: Aim of Bank Act Was to Make Reporting Uniform
description: Banks in the United States have been photocopying checks at the rate of 20 billion to 30 billion a year in compliance with regulations of the Treasury Department under the Bank Secrecy Act of 1970. The regulations wilds after some delay became effective Jan. 17, 1973, require photocopying of all checks for $100 or more.

title: Monticello Reopens Thursday With Offtrack Betting Available
description: Leon Greenberg, president and general manager of the Monticello Raceway, announced yesterday that his organization would have New York City offtrack betting for its 26week meeting that begings Thursday night. Addressing a meeting, of the Hudson Valley Sports Writers Association in Monticello, Greenberg said that recent legislation signed by Governor Wilson would permit the return of remote wagering at Monticello.

title: Missing Boy Scout Found
description: STRATTON, Vt., April 1 (AP) An 11yearold Boy Scout from Delmar, N.Y., was rescued by searchers on snowcovered Stratton Mountain yesterday. The boy, Lawrence Carroll, had been missing since Saturday when he apparently became separated from a group of scouts on a field trip on the mountain.

title: HELLER TESTIFIES 0N ROTHKO WORKS
description: Ben Heller, a New York art collector and private dealer, testified yesterday that executors and lawyers for the Mark Rothko estate should have retained control of the 800 paintings the artist owned at his death instead of selling them all to one gallery shortly after the artist's suicide in 1970.

title: GasolineSaving Parts Arrive on Market
description: DETROIT, April 1  Because of gasoline shortages, the automobile companies are going all out to get better mileage from their cars and will bring an array of new fuelsaving accessories and parts to the market within the next few months.

title: Mets, Yanks Back Girls in Little League
Getting It All Together
description: WASHINGTON, April 1English is a getteral language. To live it successfully, we must first get a good night's sleep, then get up, get a bath, get shaved, get downstairs, get the papers, get breakfast and get the children off to school.

title: Republicans Debate Value of Nixon Visit to Michigan in House Race
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 For the first time since the Watergate scandals became a dominant political factor, Republicans are squabbling openly over whether they can afford to be identified with President Nixon.

title: Local SchoolBoard Pacts With Members Are Barred
description: An unpaid member of a district school board cannot enter into a contract with another school board to evaluate Federal and state programs within a community school district, the city's Board of Ethics ruled yesterday.

title: Times Nominates 3 New Directors
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday the nomination of three new directors for election at the annual stockholders' meeting.

title: Prices Are Mixed in Credit Markets
description: Corporate and taxexempt bond prices were mostly steady in quiet trading yesterday in advance of this week's round of new offerings, which starts in earnest today. In the Government market, something of a start of a new upturn in the quarter appeared to be in the making during the morning hours. It turned out to be something of a disappointment, however, before the day closed.

title: A Sour Political Mood in Germany Poses Problems for Brandt's Party
description: BONN, April 1  ThoughChancellor Willy Brandt's Government has been at the heart of recent efforts to smooth over the dispute between Secretary of State Kissinger and the Europeans about consultations, the West German leader himself has been preoccupied for week with serious domestic political problems.

title: Chenier 1up on Frazier; 3d Playoff Game Tonight
description: Not only does Phil Chenier bear an uncanny physical resemblande, to Walt Fraziere, but he is emulating the basketball skills of the New York Knick guard so successfully that there may soon be a Phil Chenier Enterprises Inc., to rival the offcourt financial ventures of Walt Frazler Enterprises, Inc., at 101 Park Avenue.

title: Justice Department Move Peril to Some Incumbents
description: One of the state's morepowerful Congressmen, Representative John J. Rooney of Brooklyn, and two State Senators and four Assemblymenall whites face the loss of their Congressional and legislative seats to blacks and Puerto Ricans. This could come as a result of a Justice Department report yesterday that said that Congressional and legislative district lines in Brooklyn and Manhattan, in effect, discriminated against minorities.

title: CliffClimber Dies in Fall
description: CLAYTON, Ga., April 1 (UPI) Samuel L. Couch, 28 years old, slipped from a rope, and plunged 400 feet to his death last night while scaling a cliff at Tallulah Gor??e.

title: SITE IN AUSTRALIA SOUGH BY SOVIET
description: SYDNEY, Australia, April 1 The Soviet Union has asked permission to establish a satellitetracking station in Aus tralia, and the United States has expressed deep concern over the proposal to the Australian Government.

title: 7 Private Bus Concerns Ask for Fare Increase From 35 to 50 Cents
description: Seven private bus companies applied to the city yesterday for authority to raise their basic fare to 50 cents from 35 cents, and the fare for their interborough express runs to and from midtown Manhattan to $1.75 from $1.25.

title: Nyquist Assails Mt. Vernon on Schools
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y. April 1  The State Commissioner of Education, Ewald B. Nyquist, told the Mount Vernon Board of Education today that it could no longer delay implementation of a plan to integrate its schools.

title: Massachusetts Food Costs
description: BOSTON, April 1 (AP)Food costs in Massachusetts are the second highest in the country behind the New York Citynortheastern NewJersey area, state food commission reported today.

title: Clarence Allen, Headmaster Of Bay State Rivers School
description: CAMDEN, Me., April 1 Clarence E. Allen, retired headmaster of the Rivers Country Day School of Weston, Mass., near Boston, died Saturday in his home here. He was 86 years old.

title: Pittsburgh Papers Struck
description: PITTSBURGH, April 1 (AP) Pittsburgh is without its two daily newspapers because of a strike by 700 drivers and circulation employes of the Pittsburgh Press Company. The members of Teamsters' Local 211 struck Saturday evening after a breakdown in contract talks with the Press Company, which prints and distributes the afternoon Press and the morning PostGazette.

title: $22 Million Runway Is Begun in Florida For Landings of Space Shuttle Vehicles
description: The first spadeful of earth was turned in a ceremony in Florida yesterdaf for a $22million runway on which American space shuttle craft are to land after journeys into orbit scheduled to begin in 1979.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS A COMMUNES CURB
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 The Supreme Court upheld today the authority of a Long Island village to bar six unrelated college students from sharing a rented onefamily house, rejecting the contention that their constitutional rights of privacy and freedom of association were being violated.

title: ...Better Way
description: The jubilation expressed by Mayor Beame at the transit negotiators' success in climbing off their cliff two hours before midnight, instead of keeping New Yorkers hanging until the 5 A.M. strike deadline, hardly makes the whole procedure a model of civilized labor relations.

title: Rapid Transit System On Coast Out of Money
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 1There is a Christmas morning quality to itlike that Christmas when some of the parts were missig from your electric train.

title: Rolf Steiner to Germany
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, April 1 (Agence FrancePresse) The former mercenary Rolf Steiner went to West Germany yesterday after being released from prison, it was announced today. Mr. Steiner, who went for medical treatment, was sentenced in 1971 for his part in the Southern Sudan rebellion.

title: Nadjari Begins Drive in Albany To Win Back $650,000 in Cuts
description: ALBANY, April 1  Apparently convinced that politicans are attempting to shrink his budget to the point of ineffectiveness, Maurice H. Nadjari, the state's special anticorruption prosecutor, has opened a campaign to restore the $650,000 cut made by the Legislature last week.

title: Mercury's Mysterious Moon Turns Out to Be a Star
description: The mysterious object described on Sunday as a possible moon of the planet Mercury as declared yesterday by the let Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, Calif., to be a rather dim, but very hot star, known as 31 Crater, in the constellation Corvus.

title: Anglers Fare Well as Trout Season Opens
description: ROSCOE, N.Y., April 1A bitter wind swept up the snowcovered valley of the Beaverkill at dawn, numbing the faces and fingers of two dozen opening day trout fishermen who stood in silent, hopeful ranks at Junction Pool today.

title: I.B.M. Files Witness List For. TrustSuit Defense
description: The International Business Machines Corporation filed yesterday in the United States Court for the Southern District of New York the preliminary list of witnesses that it may call in its defense against the antitrust charges brought by the Justice Department. The case is scheduled to come to trial in October.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The March 23 letter of Arthur Reef of American Metal Climax, Inc., on strip mining typified lack of cander of spokesme for energy companies which is angering so many Americans today.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS A COMMUNES CURB
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 The Supreme Court upheld today the authority of a Long Island village to bar six unrelated college students from sharing a rented onefamily house, rejecting the contention that their constitutional rights of privacy and freedom of association were being violated.

title: Florentines Fight New Airport As Damaging to City and Its Art
description: FLORENCE, ItalyThis city, the cultural jewel of Italy, is in the midst of a battle over a proposed new airport.

title: NTERAMERICAN BANK OPENS CHILE PARLEY
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 1 (UPD  Amid strict security measures, the 15th annual assembly of governors of the Interamerican Development Bank opened here today.

title: News Summary and Index TUESDAY, APRIL 2, 1974
description: Fifteen months after her entry into the Common Market, Britain met in Luxembourg with her European partners to tell them that unless major changes were made she might put the question of withdrawal :to a popular vote. The warning, which derived from the new Labor Government's election promise to renegotiate the terms of entry into the European Economic Community, was made by her Foreign Secretary, James Callaghan, in an address uncompromising in tone. [1:56.]

title: NEW U.S. PLEDGES TO SAIGON DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, April 1An allegation by Senator Edward M. Kennedy that the Nixon Administration had made new commitments of support to South Vietnam was denied today by the State Department.

title: Whalers Lose, 41, In Boston Finale
description: BOSTON, April 1 (AP)Houston's Don Grierson scored secondperiod goals 55 seconds apart tonight as the Aeros ruined the New England Whalers farewell to Boston with a 41 World Hockey Association victory. The largest crowd in Whalers' history, 14,711, looked on.

title: ROCKEFELLER DROPS BID FOR U.S. FUNDS.
description: AUSTIN, Texas, April 1Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller of New York said today that the work of his Commission on Critical Choices for Americans would be financed by contributions from foundstions and individuals and that no money would be sought from Congress or the executive branch of the Federal Government.

title: SAVINGS FORESEEN IN PART OF PACT
description: The Transit Authority hopes to save millions of dollars by an agreement in the newly negotiated contract to extend la pilot productivityimprovement program to the entire subway and bus system.

title: Libya Places Former King On Trial With 55 Others
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, April 1 (Reuters)Former King Idris of Libya, ousted in a military coup d'tat in 1969 and now living in Egypt, was put on trial in absentia here today on corruption charges.

title: Pacers on Top as Keller Hits Nine 3Point Goals
description: INDIANAPOLIS, April 1 (AP)Billy Keller scored 39 points, including a record nine 3point goals, tonight as the Indiana Pacers walloped the San Antonio Spurs, 12101, to tie their A.B.A. Western semifinal playoff at one game apiece.

title: Utah Stars Sold
description: SALT LAKE CITY, April 1 (AP)The Utah Stars of the American Basketball Association were sold today to a Salt Lake City corporationthat says it will soon offer 80 per cent of Stars stock for public ownership. The owner, Bill Daniels of Denver, announced the sale to Westam Corporation at a new conference attended by Westsm's president, Keith Howick vice president, Lyle. Smith; Mayor E. J. (Jake) Garn of Salt Lake City the Utah Senate president, Warren Pugh, and Mike Miller, assistant to Gov. Calvin Rampton, all of whom expressed strong desires to keep the Stars in Utah.

title: Minority Hiring Plan Given Approval by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 (AP)The Labor Department approved today a program by the elevator construction industry to hire and train additional minority workers.

title: CITY OFFICIAL FAILED CIVIL SERVICE TEST
description: Luis E. Cadiz, who Was appointed a deputy commissioner in the Department of Correction last Saturday by Mayor Beame, confirmed last night that he had failed a civil service test last June for a job as a senior quantitative analyst in the Housing and Development Administration.

title: Quake Hits Indonesian Isle
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, April 1 (Reuters)  An earthquake demolished 90 per cent of the buildings on the island of Siau, north of Celebes, on Wednesday, killing three persons, it was reported here today. The Jakarta daily, Kompas, said dozens of people had been injured and about 16,000 evacuated.

title: Yanks Hear Owner Talk, Beat Mets
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 1For the first time since his group purchased the Yankees, their principal owner, George Steinbretlner, held a meeting with all, his players, tonight and prompted applause from them with 15minute talk.

title: Goldstein Is Nominated For U.S. Attorney's Post
description: NEWARK, April 1Jonathan L. Goldstein wag nominated as United States Attorney for New Jersey today by president Nixon only three days after he successfully prosecuted Nelson G. Gross; a former New Jersey Republican committee chairman and Nixon Administration official, for tax fraud and perjury.

title: Dayan Says Soviet Jets In Syria May Be MIG23's
description: Israeli intelligence reported over the weekend that two Soviet merchant ships were unloading aircraft, apparently MIG23's, in Syria, according to Defense Minister Moshe Dayan.

title: VOW TO TENANTS IS KEPT BY BYRNE
description: TRENTON, April 1  Governor Byrne sent to the State Assembly today a package of tenantprotection bills that are considered to be the most consumeroriented measures of their kind in the country.

title: Notes on People
description: Taking to the letters to the editor column in the current issue of Time magazine, Clare Boothe Luce, widow of the magazine's cofounder, Henry R. Luce, lambastes Time for its overinvestment in the destruction of the President and for its phobic Watergate reporting.

title: People and Business
description: Major changes in the toplevel management of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company, the nation's largest rubber fabricator, were announced yesterday following a meeting of the company's board of directors.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: General Motors has canceled the layoff of 300 workers at its plant in Linden that was scheduled for next week. Citing improving car sales and a brightening outlook for the spring selling season, General Motors said it would not be necessary to lay the men off on April 8. Earl Stutztrian, president of Local 595 of the United Auto Workers, said he was very happy and optimistic about the future.

title: ExHead of Shubert's Is Defended on Estate
description: Counsel for Lawrence Shubert Lawrence, former head of the Shubert theatrical and real estate empire, denied yesterday the allegations made by state Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz that Mr. Lawrence had spent money from the Shubert estate in a manner that was excessive, unwarranted and unjustified.

title: 50 Pickets at Dow Held
description: MIDLAND, Mich., April (AP)Fifty persons were arrested today for mass picketing and destruction of property at the Dow Chemical Company plant as a strike by 5,300 hourly workers entered its third week. Sheriff's deputies said those arrested were among, an estimated 300 persons who blocked all entrances to the Dow complex.

title: Municipal Unions Seeking CostofLiving Raises Too
description: Municipal Unions Seeking CostofLiving Raises Too

title: PATHET LAO CHIEF DUE IN VIENTIANE
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 1 (AP)Prince Souphanouvong, who heads the Communistoriented Pathet Lao forces, will return to Vientiane Wednesday after a 10year absence, diplomatic sources reported today.

title: Boston School Election Put Off As Part of a Law Disappears
description: BOSTON, April 1  The Mysterious disappearance of apiece Of paper today threw this city's racially charged school situation into confusion.

title: $329,603 Net Assets Are Listed By Mrs. Grasso and Husband
description: HARTFORD. April 1 Representative Ella Grasso, a leadling contender for the Democratic nomination, for Governor. of Corinecticut, made public today a personal financial statement showing that she and her husband had net assets worth 8329,603and very little income beyond her Congressional salary of $42,500 a year and his retirement checks as a former teacher.

title: 7 Private Bus Concerns Ask for Fare Increase From 35 to 50 Cents
description: Seven private bus companies applied to the city yesterday for authority to raise their basic fare to 50 cents from 35 cents, and the fare for their interorough express runs to and from midtown Manhattan to $1.75 from $1.25.

title: State Criticized on Rising Hospital Costs
description: The state's costofliving commission asserted yesterday that the State Health Department had failed to control rising hospital costs despite a 1969 law on the subject, and urged legislation to strengthen its power to require efficiencies.

title: Chess: Yesterday's Frog Is Today's Prince Is Tomorrow's
description: Dr. Max Euwe, the world champion from 1935 to 1937, remarks in his introduction to Both Sides of the Chessboard by R. Byrne and I. Nei, Chess is not mathematics. It has often happened in chess history that long and deep analyses of important positions have been rejected or refuted only for later examination to show the incorrectness of the refutations, which has led to a kind of rehabilitation of the original points of view.

title: The Park May Be Outside But There's a Jungle Inside
description: Kerry FitzGerald doesn't talk to plants. He doesn't sing or pray to them, either. However, he does play recorded bird calls for the greenery in his shop, in between a bit of Bach or Mozart. And he thinks that plants respond to love, and, like pets, have individual needs.

title: STOCK OFFERING SET AT GENERAL PUBLIC
description: Directors of the General Public Utilities Corporation approved yesterday a proposed offering of 4.34 million shares of common stock on a 1for10 basis. William G. Kuhns, president, told about 300 stockholders at the company's an nual meeting that the offering would begin on June 6 and end on June 28 with the price to be set by directors on the June 6 record date at a discount from the previous day's closing market price.

title: BRITAIN DISCUSSES ULSTER VIOLENCE
description: LONDON, April 1The new Labor party Government is growing increasingly worried about the upsurge in violence in Northern Ireland and is considering new measures to counter it.

title: Pop Music: The Airplane Comes Back First Class
description: Jefferson Airplane, one of the first San Francisco rock bands to gain nationwide prominence in 1967has flown an erratic course since then. But this week, partly reformed as Jefferson Starship, the group has triumphantly returned to the business of playing rock at the Academy of Music on 14th Street, with shows tonight and tomorrow.

title: Assembly Votes a New Bill for State Aid for Parochial Schools
description: ALBANY, April 1A bill to aid parochial schools that critics charge is just as unconstitutional as one struck down by the United States Supreme Court last year passed the Assembly today without debate and with only nine negative votes.

title: Music:N.A.A.C.P. at 65
description: Paul Freeman, who was a winner seven years ago in the Dimitri Mitropoulos International Conductors Competition, has since been mounting the career ladder faster than black conductors were once allowed to do in this country. His current appointment is with the Detroit Symphony, where he is conductor in residence.

title: Herman of Jets Quits
description: Dave Herman announced his retirement from professional football yesterday and then issued a bleak series of views on the currant state of affairs in the sport.

title: Bulls Down Pistons and Tie Series
description: DETROIT, April 1 (AP)Bob Love scored 38 points and Chet Walker added 20 in helping the Chicago Bulls defeat the Detroit Pistons, 108103, tonight and tie their National Basketball Associadon Western Conference playoff series at one game apiece.

title: NEWS INDEX
STOCKS DECLINE IN SLOW TRADING
description: Growing investor concern over rising interest rates caused the stock market to finish lower yesterday for the fourth consecutive session as volume remained in the doldrums.

title: Goldstein Nominated as U.S. Attorney
description: NEWARK, April 1Jonathan L. Goldstein was nominated as United States Attorney for New Jeriey today by President Nixon only three days after ?? successfully prosecuted Nelson G. Gross, a former New Jersey Republican committee chair man and Nixon Administration official, for tax fraud and perjury.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: French Jousting With a New Breed of AmateurThugs
description: PARIS, April 1  New kinds of crime perpetrated by a new kind of criminal are jolting France.

title: PRINTERS BARRED FROM STOPPAGES
description: A preliminary injunction was granted in Federal District Court here yesterday to bar the New York Typographical Union No. 6 from conducting any work stoppages at The Daily News.

title: LAWRENCE TOWER OF FLAG GROUP, 70
description: Lawrence Phelps Tower, president of the United States Flag Foundation since 1946, died yesterday at St. Barnabas Medical Center, Livingston, N.J. His age was 70 and he lived at 115 East 86th Street.

title: A MothertoBe Finds Her Plans Premature
description: A pregnant Greek woman flying to New York so her baby could be born American was thwarted yesterday when she went into labor over the Atlantic and her flight was diverted to Montreal.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Moon Really a Star
description: A mysterious object described on. Sunday as possibly a moon of the planet Mercury was declared by scientists yesterday to be really a distant and very hot star. Details on Page 19.

title: SAIGON REPORTS FOE OPENS NEW ATTACKS,
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, April 2 (AP)Communist forces poured shells into Government positions, clashed with infantrymen and shot at helicopters trying to evacuate wounded near the Cambodian border, the South Vietnamese command said today.

title: Wendy Hilton's Elan In Baroque Dances Reflected in Music
description: The New York Consort of Viols offered the second in a series of three programs at the Cubiculo on Sunday evening. This one was devoted to Renaissance and Baroque music and dance with Wendy Hilton, an energetic scholar, teacher and performer of 17th and 18thcentury court dance, as guest artist. The evening was characterized by a quiet devotion to craft and material that made one wish to spend Sunday evenings with the Consort in the suddenly intimateseeming basement theater.

title: House Security Unit Gets $475,000 for Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON, April 1 The House Internal Security Committee won its annual fight for survival today as the House granted it $475,000 to investigate suspected subversives.

title: OMEGAALPHA SETS SALE OF SUBSIDIARY
description: OmegaAlpha, Inc., announced yesterday it had agreed to dispose of its General Felt Industries subsidiary through a merger of that company with the MC Corporation, a privately owned concern. General Felt will be the surviving company. Under the agreement, OmegaAlpha, owner of 2.5 million of General Felt's 3.4 million shares outstanding, will receive about $29million in a combination of cash, notes and the assumption of liabilities.

title: Belle Terre Hails Ruling As Triumph for Privacy
description: BELLE TERRE, L. I., April 1 James Philbin, the Mayor of this tiny, tranquil village overlooking Long Island Sound, had just finished lunch today when someone phoned him with the good news.

title: OILMEN SET BACK BY TAX COMMITTEE
description: WASHINGTON, April 1The House Ways and Means Committee, reversing a series of decisions it made over the last several weeks, voted today to bring an end to the controversial oil depletion allowance, at least where major oil producers are concerned.

title: Sohio and BP Cut Some Fuel Prices; Gasoline Unchanged
description: The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) and its East Coast marketing subsidiary, BP Oil, Inc., announced yesterday that they had reduced, their prices on homeheating oil and diesel fuels.

title: Baskey, Pitcher, Voted Yankees' Best Rookie
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., April 1Tom Buskey, an unheralded relief pitcher, was named today, winner of the James P. Dawson Award as the best rookie in the Yankees' spring training camp. The award is named for the late sports writer of The New York Times.

title: Another Truck Strike Set
description: LOS ANGELES, April 1 (AP) Another nationwide shutdown by independent truckers in protest of fuel prices is planned for May 13, Mike Parkhurst, president of Overdrive Roadmasters, said today.

title: PARLEY ON ADDICTS EXAMINES GOALS
description: CHICAGO, April 1  More than 2,000 drug treatment specialists ended a threeday meeting here today with much greater accord on the changing pattern of drug abuse than on what to do about it.

title: Man Falls to Death In Effort to Escape Police in the Bronx
description: A 20yearold man fell four stories to his death yesterday afternoon when a Bronx window ledge collapsed while he was engaged in an unexplained scramble to elude the police.

title: Con Ed to Cut $40Million From Construction Plans
description: ALBANY, April 2The Consolidated Edison Company disclosed today that its problems in raising capital funds were forcing it to cut $40million of its construction program this year and requiring it to delay completion of an 800,000kilowatt generator in Astoria, Queens.

title: Integration of Mark Twain Junior High Postponed Until 1975 by Federal Court
description: Federal Judge Jack B. Weinstein postponed until next year the integration of Mark Twain Junior High School in Coney Island, and he named an urbanaffairs specialist yesterday to formulate a comprehensive plan on the problem.

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Knicks vs. Capital

title: Hogan, District Attorney 32 Years, Dies
description: Frank S. Hogan, the shy, courteous lawyer who became a legend in 32 years as Manhattan's District Attorney, died yesterday at St. Luke's Hospital. Mr. Hogan was 72 years old and lived at 404 Riverside Drive.

title: 5 Die in Auto Crash
description: WICHITA, Kan., April 2 (UPI) An auto ran through a flashfrig red light and stop sign and plowed into another vehicle at an intersection last night. Five persons were killed. A deputy said investigators were not certain which vehicle ran the red He said two persons appeared to be in one car and three in the other.

title: Captors' Message Hints Miss Hearst Is Near Freedom
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 2 An underground newspaper said here today it had received a message from the kidnappers of Patricia Hearst saying that the exact time and place for her release would be announced within 72 hours.

title: Disabled Queen Elizabeth 2 Prepares To Put 1,630 Onto Liner for Bermuda
description: Crewmen of the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth 2, which is crippled and adrift off Bermuda, poised for transfer of the vessel's 1,630 passengers today to a Norwegian cruise ship racing to a midocean rendezvous.

title: MSGR. F. X. BROCHART
description: Msgr. Francis X. Brochart, pastor emeritus of Sacred Heart Roman Catholic Church in East Glendale, Queens, died on Saturday at Ozanam Hall, Bayside, Queens. His age was 87.

title: Moscow Has Formula for a Good Subway
description: MOSCOW, March 31  A subway ride costs less than 7 cents. Rushhour trains click by 80 seconds apart. In the scrubbed cars seats, are set aside for invalids and passengers with children.

title: Nixon Names Two
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (Reunated today Richard Feltner to be Assistant Secretary of Agriculture. The President also nominated James Mitchell, general counsel of the Department of Housing and Urban Development, to become Under Secretary of the agency.

title: Thieu, at Historic, Rite, Says Hanoi Betrays Heritage
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 2 (Reuters)President Nguyen Van Thieu, speaking at a colorful ceremony to mark the legendary founding of Vietnam more than 4,000 years ago, denounced North Vietnam's leaders today as being bent on war and on betraying the national heritage.

title: Venezuela Oil Prices Unchanged for Month
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 2 (AP)  Venezuela's oiltax reference price will remain unchanged this month, but we cannot guarantee this decision for the following months, the Mines and Hydrocarbons Minister, Valentine Hernandez, said today.

title: Cardinal Shehan Of Baltimore, 76, To Leave in June
description: BALTIMORE, April 2Lawrence Joseph Cardinal Shehan resigned today as Archbishop of Baltimore.

title: SCHOLARS DEFER FEDERALIST PLAN
description: AUSTIN, Texas, April 2 Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller's dream of producing the new Federalist papers to guide the country into its third century proved too ambitious today for the hours available to members of the Commission on Crucial Choices for Americans.

title: Books of The Times
description: DADDY PIG. By Mel Arright. 218 pages. BobbsMerrill. $7.50.

title: BEAME PREDICTS INCREASED TAXES
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that increased taxes were inevitable to balance his projected $12.9billion 197475 expense budget.

title: 2 AUDITORS DIFFER ON NIXON TAX GAIN
description: LOS. ANGELES, April 2  An upcoming decision by a joint Congressional committee on whether President Nixon should have declared a capital gain on the sale of part of his San Clemente estate will also resolve a dispute between the two firms of auditors that have studied the question for Mr. Nixon.

title: BERME PREDICTS INCREASED TAXES
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that increased taxes were inevitable to balance his projected $12.9billion 197475 expense budget.

title: At Yonkers Marshal Who Calls Trotters is a Lady
description: YONKERS, April 2Sherry Lane is on view every night at Yonkers Raceway, attractive in her tailored English riding boots and breeches. Her prominence in the harness  race activity cannot be avoided, for she is the marshal who calls for pacers (or trotters, as the case may be), before each of the nine races on the nightly programs.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Power Struggle Reported On Simon Treasury Role
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 With the White House moving toward early announcement of the appointment of William E. Simon as Secretary of the Treasury, a fierce backstairs struggle has developed for the broad economicpolicymaking role exercised by George P. Shultz, the retiring Secretary.

title: In Detroit Auto Slump No Longer Means Hard Times
description: DETROIT, March 31The Chrysler Corporation's huge old Jefferson Avenue assembly plant, a longtime symbol of industrial Detroit, closed down last Week for the fourth time since the gasoline shortage sent car sales plummeting late last year. On Monday morning its vast parking lot was deserted, a frigid urban plain.

title: Ottinger Selected as Democrat To Run for Reid's House Seat
description: WHITE PLAINS, April 2Former Representative Richard L. Ottinger, was selected tonight as the Democratic candidate for the Westchester County Congressional seat being vacated by Ogden R. Reid.

title: Schools English Electives: From Sublime to Ridiculous
description: O.K., Renee Kelvin said, facing her students from a corner of the classroom, at Eastern District High School in Brooklyn, what are some symptoms of measles?

title: Pan Am's Fuel Plan Hits Antitrust Snag
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP)  The Justice Department objected today to a proposal from Pan American World Airways that it be allowed to discuss with Trans World Airlines ways to pool service and revenues on North Atlantic routes.

title: I.B.M. Realigns Structure Of Subsidiaries Overseas
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday a major restructuring of its worldwide business.

title: Bruckner Played In Tonal Splendor By Philadelphians
description: However else Bruckner's musle might affect the listener, its tonal splendor is practically irresistible, particularly when it is realized by an ensemble of the caliber of the Philadelphia Orchestra. On Monday night in Avery Fisher Hall, Bruckner's Seventh Symphony was the concluding work in its program under the direction of Eugene Ormandy.

title: Pompidou Rose in Classic French Manner and Became de Gaulle's Successor
description: Although Georges Pompidou, his, admirers and his detractors often asserted that he wet Charles de Gaulle's chosen sue. cessor as President of France, in fact he was not.

title: Jets Sign No. 1 Pick, Foil W.F.L.
description: Say it slowly now, Carl Barzilauskas, just the way it looks. If that's too tough on the tongue, try Barzo, or Number 77, because the New York Jets already have settled on a number, nickname and starting positiondefensive left tackle  for their No. 1 draft choice.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saying Time

title: Market Place: Advisory Notes Of Stock Bears
description: Bulls, as usual, outnumber the bears in Wall Street. But of those professionals who happen, to be bearish, who would advise investors what?

title: U.S. IS CHALLENGED ON OCEAN DUMPING
description: At a hearing held by the Environmental Protection Agency here yesterday, E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc. made the sharpest challenge so far to the Federal Government's attempt to control the dumping of waste in the ocean.

title: Publicker Shifts Drinks To J.W.T. From Brace
description: All those advertising types who have been concerned over the dry throats at J. Walter Thompson since it resigned its Seagram's business in January will be pleased that Thompson Is jumping off the wagon courtesy of Publicker Industries, Philadelphia.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: FORD URGES NIXON TO JOIN CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 Vice President Ford said today that be had urged President Nixon to take the risk and campaign for a Republican candidate in an upcoming special Congressional election in Michigan.

title: CHINA SEEN RAISING OILPRODUCTS SALES
description: Christopher Phillips, president of the U.S.China Trade Council, predicted yesterday that China could be selling $1billion in oil products annuallp in five years, $2billion annually in 10 years.

title: Awards Contract for Doctors to Check on Colleagues' Medical Quality
description: The first steps to implement a national program for doctors to control the quality of medicine their colleagues practice in treating Medicare an Medicaid patients were announced by Federal health official here yesterday.

title: Foreman Back After Paying Tax
description: the world heavyweight boxing champion, George Foreman, arrived here last night after being detained five days in Caracas by Venezuelan tax officials.

title: To Cure Slumpflation
description: Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer, Denis Healey, faced what he rightly called an appallingly difficult task in drawing up the new Labor Government's first budget. Inflation is grave; consumer prices are climbing at an annual rate of 13 per cent. Britain's economic growth record remains the worst in Europe, with industry hesitant to investand short of investible capital. And the fabric of British society has been strained by class antagonisms intensified by the coal miners' long strike and the impact of inflation on the working class.

title: Argentine's Art Collection Sold At Sotheby's for $4.7Million
description: LONDON, April 2  Thirtyfour French 19thcentury and 20thcentury paintings and drawings, owned by Antonio Santamarina of Argentina were auctioned here tonight for a total of 1,973;000 ($4,725,000). The bidding generally was high, and a Daumier, a Delacroicx, a Sisley and a ToulouseLautrec fetched record prices.

title: Toros Take Finale
description: TORONTO, April 2 (UPI) Wayne Carleton's second goal with 2:49 of the game remaining provided the winner tonight as the Toronto Toros defeated the Edmonton Oilers, 32, in a World Hockey Association game.

title: Kuh Elevates Friedman To Head Appeals Bureau
description: Lewis R. Friedman was named yesterday by District Attorney Richard H. Kuh as chief of his appeals bureau, He had been deputy chief of the bureau for the last two years.

title: Braves Announce Earlier Ticket Sale
description: ATLANTA, April 2 (AP)Atlanta Braves' fans can begin buying general admission tickets to the team's first home game two days early. Tickets for the Monday contest will go on sale at the stadium Saturday morning.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Colorado Regional Transportation District announced yesterday selection of TRW, Inc., as systems mangement director for a new $1.5billion rapid transit system to serve a six county transit district around Denver. TRW's potential share of the project is $100million over a 10year period.

title: Scripps Medical Complex
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Agril 2 (AP)Scripps Clinic and Research Foundation, which treats some of the world's most famous people, says work will soon begin on a $30million medical complex. The new facility will deal mainly with imunology, inflammation and infection, cancer growth, maturation and aging and nutrition, a spokesman said.

title: A DEATH PENALTY GAINING IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, April 2  A bill that would restore the death penalty in the state was reported to the floor of the Assembly today by the Codes Committee after heated debate.

title: FUTURES PRICES IN LIVESTOCK OFF
EXP.B.A. ATTORNEY GUILTY IN ROBBERY
description: TRENTON, April 2 (AP)  A former attorney for the Trenton Patrolmen's Benevolent Association was found guilty on a charge of having plotted the armed robbery of a neighbor's home in a fashionable section of Trenton.

title: EXGEOTEX EMPLOYE INDICTED BY U.S. JURY
description: SAN FRANCISCO. April 3A Federal grand jury here today returned a twocount perjury indictment against Mrs. Jacqueline Chambers, a former GeoTek employee in connection with its criminal investigation of the GeoTek oil drilling fund scandal.

title: Gorman Defeats Estap by 76, 60
description: MUNICH, West Germany, April 2 (UPI)Tom Gorman of Seattle played superlative tennis in the second set today and defeated Mike Estap of Dallas, 76, 60, in the first round of a World Championship Tennis Circuit tournament, Ilie Nastase of Rumania. overcame Alan Stone of Australia, 76, 61.

title: Center Doing HorseFever Research Is Forced to Leave Doris Duke Farm
description: HILLSBOROUGH, April 2A bitter controversy h??s developed here because Doris Duke has terminated a lease under which 55 infected horses were being treated on her estate in Somerville by a medical research group conducting studies on a horse disease known as swamp fever.

title: 5 SAID TO ATTEMPT TO RUN ARMS TO I.R.A.
description: BALTIMORE, April 2A Federal grand jury here indicted five men today on charges of conspiring to smuggle arms and ammunition to the Irish Republican Army.

title: Flyers Rout Worsley
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., April 2 (AP)Bill Fleet, Ross Lonsherry and Dave Schultz knocked in thirdperiod goals to give the Philadelphia Flyers a 63 National Hockey League victory over the Minnesota North Stars tonight.

title: 14Year Strike Settled
description: PEORIA; Ill., April 2 ((JPI) Labor and management at the Palace Buffet have finally reached an agreement to end their strikeafter 14 years and four months, Settlement was announced yesterday by Local 327 of the Hotel, Motel, Cafeterla and Restaurant employes Union.

title: French Again Block Plan or Consulting
description: LUXEMBOURG, April 2Objections by France today blocked the nine Common Market countries from agreeing on irnproved procedures of consulation with the United States.

title: People in Sports Pappas Released by Cubs
description: Milt Pappas, only one victory away front joining Cy Young and Jim Bunning, as the only men to win 100 games in both the American and National Leagues, was given his unconditional release by the Chicago Cub yesterday. Pappas, with 16 years in the major leagues, became the ninth seasoned player let go by the Cubs this year, but the first one released outright.

title: Queens Lawyer to Be Judge
description: The appointment of Max H. Galfunt, a 63YEAROLD lawyer from Queens, to a 10year term on the Criminal Court was announced yesterday by Mayor Beame.

title: Availability of Gasoline Up Around U.S., Survey Finds
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) The American Automobile Association said today that the availability of gasoline at serve ice stations throughout the nation was continuing to improve.

title: Pompidou And the Old Alliance
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Men pass but nations and the problems of nations go on. Twentyfive years ago this week, the North Atlantic Treaty was signed in this capital, and since all the governments concerned seem to be fussing with each other these days, maybe somebody should celebrate the original idea.

title: Armstrong Cork Unit Close
description: The Armstrong Cork Company said yesterday that it would end manufacturing operations at its plant in Pittsburgh by about July, The plant, which makes fabricated gasket products, employs about 250 workers.

title: Gulf Oil Corporation Buys ForeignProduced Gasoline
description: HOUSTON, April 2 (UPI)

title: TV Fred Freed's Impact on Documentary Field
description: Fred Freed died last weekend, At the age of 53, he was the victim of a heart attack.

title: Power Struggle Reported On Simon Treasury Role
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 With the White House moving toward early announcement of the appointment of William E. Simon as Secretary of the Treasury, a fierce backstairs struggle has developed for the broad economicpolicymaking role exercised by George P. Shultz, the retiring Secretary.

title: Seals Stay in Slump
description: ST. LOUIS, April 2 (UPI) Ace Bailey, Wayne Merrick and Gary Unger scored in the second period and Floyd Thomson and Dave Gardner in the third as the St. Louis Blues held off the California Golden Seals for a 53 triumph tonight. It was the 10th straight game without a victory for the Seals. They have lost nine games and tied one.

title: At Paris Shows, the Fabric Is Flowing
description: PARIS, April 2There already is one collection that will change the look of clothes over the next few yearsand the week of fall readytowear openings is just half over. Not too bad a track record as fashion goes these days.

title: World CarDesign Pact Urged by Fiat Chairman
description: Automobile design changes that will meet the problems of the energy crisis and cleaning up the environment can best be accomplished by cooperation between governments and international corporations, Giovanni Agnelli, chairman of Fiat, S.p.A., said yesterday.

title: New Paltz Students End SitIn, Saying They Gained Voice
description: Students at the State University of New York College in New Peitz ended a weeklong occupation of the administration building yesterday after being told they would haler a stronger voice in determining how the school should be run.

title: People and Business
description: A mandatory rollback of interest rates, a reduction in personal income taxes and restrictions on imports and foreign investments were proposed yesterday by Senator Vance Hartke as part of a program to stimulate more employment.

title: Wanted in Kidnapping
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Investigation added today Larry Gene Cole, accused of kidnapping, to its 10 mostwanted list. He is wanted in connection with the abduction of Mrs. Betty Balen, wife of a Virginia Businessman, for ransom.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Waldrop May Run in Penn Relays

title: New Jersey Sports
HOUSE UNIT PLANS NEW BID TO NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, April 2The House Judiciary Committee prepared today to issue a new request to the White House for evidence for its impeachment inquiry amid indications that President Nixon would comply with an earlier demand for Watergate tape recordings.

title: About New York
description: The man had a beard like Lincoln's, only it was shot though with gray. I was with Great Day, Vincent Youman's show, playing the piano, he said. That was 44 years ago, Do I look that old?

title: Legislative Expert Sees Hurdle to Redistricting
description: ALBANY, April 2The reapportionment expert of the State Legislature said today that there appeared to be a constitutional bar to redrawing legislative lines to satisfy a finding by the United States Department of Justice of racial unfairness in Brooklyn and Manhattan districts.

title: CHIEF OF MILITARY RESIGNS IN ISRAEL; BLAMED IN INQUIRY
description: TEL AVIV, April 2  Lieut. Gen. David Elazar resigned tonight as Israel's chief of staff shortly after an official commission investigating Israeli setbacks at the start of the October war recommended that he and other senior army officers be removed.

title: Andretti, 34, Is Fighting Time In Bid to Fulfill Racing Goals
description: Jackie Stewart, retired at 34; Mark Donohue at 36 and Peter Revson died at 35. Mario Andretti, 34 years old, knocked himself out in a testing accident last January but is no closer to retirement than Queen Elizabeth. When I was a youngster I always thought a driver wasn't complete until his middle 30's, said Andretti by telephone from Indianapolis, where he has been testing the new Parnelli. Besides having the experience, you still have a lot of the fighter left in you.

title: Spalding Bids $15,000 for Aaron's 715th
description: Spalding, which has made every baseball ever used in the major leagues, is willing to take a $14,998 loss on one ball in particular  Hank Aaron's 715th home run.

title: Sweden Lifts Discount Rate
description: STOCKHOLM, April 2 (UPI) The Swedish central bank raised today the discount rate by 1 percentage point to 6 per cent to offset the outflow of foreign currencies.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY GAINS IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, April 2  Legislation to establish a consumer protection agency, moving ahead in Congress after years of delay, could produce important changes in the way things get done in Washington.

title: Unhappy Birthday To NATO
description: BRUSSELSWhen the North Atlantic Treaty Organization observes its 25th birthday Thursday, it can congratulate itself on the mere fact of existence after a quarter of a century during which the threat of Soviet takeover in Western Europe has receded enormously. There is no doubt that the alliance played an Important role in producing what is now accepted as a territorial status quo.

title: BURMAH OIL MAKES BIG NORTHSEA FIND
description: LONDON, April 2A major oil discovery in the North Sea was reported today by a group led by Burmah Oil. It appears to be the biggest oil find in British waters, an estimate confirmed in the House of Commons by a Government spokesman.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Mr. District Attorney
description: Former Gov. Thomas E. Dewey, who first recruited him for the Manhattan District Attorney's office, once called him the most sweetly honorable man I've ever known.

title: Nixon Data Request
description: The House Judiciary Committee prepared yesterday to issue a new request to the White House for evidence for its impeachment inquiry, and there were indications that President Nixon would comply with an earlier request. Details on Page 20.

title: U.S. Envoy Urged Withholding of Data Sought by Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, April 2  Graham A. Martin, the United States Ambassador to South Vietnam, suggested in a confidential cablegram to the State Department last month that Senator Edward M. Kennedy not be given an honest and detailed answer to questions he had raised about American policy in Indochina.

title: Prated, March Planned
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) Dr. Carl McIntire announced pland today for a First Amendment March on Saturday down Pennsylvania Avenue to protest what he calls censorship of radio and TV stations by the Federal Communications Commission. This will be the seventh march to be led here by the Fundamentalist radio preachers since April 1970. His other six were Marches for Victory in Vietnam.

title: Nixon Data Request
description: The House Judiciary Committee prepared yesterday to issue a new request to the White House for evidence for its impeachment inquiry, and there were indications that President Nixon would comply with an earlier request. Details on Page 20.

title: 2 SHOWS AND 4 STARS TO GET SPECIAL TONYS
description: Additional Tony awards for theater achievement not eligible in the regular competition will go to two shows, A Moon for the Misbegotten and Candide, and to Peter Cook and Dudley Moore, Liza Minnelli and Bette Midler.

title: PRICES ON AMEX AGE COMEBACK
description: After 12 consecutive sessions, in which the American Stock Exchange's market value index fell, the index rose yesterday end thus failed to set a record for consecutive sessions showing declines. The record, set in January of last year, was tied with the decline on Monday.

title: Latins Accuse U. S. Of Hindering Loans By Regional Bank
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 2Peru and Venezuela today criticized the continued power of the United States to veto loans granted by the InterAmerican Development Bank and complained that the American Congress had failed to approve further funds for that institution.

title: ASTOR'S ACCOUNT Or JEWELS UPHELD
description: NEWARK, April 2A former attorney employed by John Jacob Astor 3d, heir to the fur fortune, testified today that he and two other Astor aides transported $500,000 worth of diamonds from a Manhattan bank to a Jersey City bank 20 years ago via the Hudson tubes during a divorce proceeding. The testimony was given in a civil suit in Federal Court here where Mr. Astor is suing the bank for $500,000 because of his contention that some of the jewels were missing when he went to claim them.

title: PRESIDE: N POMPIDOU DEAD AFTER ALMOST FIVE YEARS AS DE GAULLES'S SUCCESSOR
description: PARIS, April 2  Georges Jean Raymond Pompidou, the 18th President of the modern French Republic, died tonight at the age of 62.

title: Archbishop Boland to Retire; Newark Newark Post Going to Gerety
description: The Most Rev. Thomas A. Boland, Archbishop of Newark, is retiring after 21 years as head of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese, it was announced yesterday.

title: House Votes Doctor Bonus
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) Bonuses of up to $15,900 a year if needed to attract doctors, dentists, veterinarians and optometrists into the allvolunteer military were voted today by the House. The bill was sent to a SenateHouse conference. The Senate bill authorizes bonuses of up to $12,000 for doc tors only.

title: Dignitaries Pay Tribute To Late French Leader
description: Among the tributes to President Georges Pompidou were the following:

title: Insurers Resist Reduction Of Rates in Energy Crisis
description: TRENTON, April 2  The State Department of Insurance and the New Jersey insurance industry clashed today over the state's plan to cut back motorists' automobile insurance premiums for the duration of the travelinhibiting energy crisis, and the industry's lastminute counterclaims for stillhigher rates in the future.

title: Data Bank Urged in Bond Rating Study
description: Formation of a nonprofit national data bank to compile and analyze fiscal information about state and local governments has been recommended by a Twentieth Century Fund task force study on municipal bond credit ratings.

title: Advertising: Views of Chidren
description: Although advertising to children is one of the hotter topics swirling around an industry rife with hot topics, how much is really known about the attitudes of the kids or their mothers?

title: Average LILCO Bill To Drop 25c in April
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 2 The Long Island Lighting Company announced today that its 836,000 customers will have their electric bills cut an average of 25 cents this month.

title: Notes on People
description: The nation's only living General of the Army, Omar N. Bradley, returned to the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., yesterday for the dedication of a library, to be named for him and which will be the repository of his personal papers. The 81yearold soldier, class of '15, is the first West Point graduate to be honored by having a library created there for his papers in the 172year history of the academy.

title: NIXON EXHORTED TO OUST V.A. HEAD
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Two major veterans organizationa and two leading Democratic spokesmen on veterans affairs called on President Nixon today to dismiss Donald E. Johnson, the administrator of the Veterans Administration.

title: Webster Wilson Is Dead at 60; Former Chairman of Hazeltine
description: Webster Hill Wilson, who retired in 1963 as board chairman and president of the Hazeltine Corporation, collapsed near his home at 130 East 67th Street yesterday afternoon and was pronounced dead at Lenox Hill Hospital. Death was attribbuted to cardiac arrest.

title: Israel Builds Up Golan Heights Units
description: TEL AVIV, April 2 (Reuters) Irael massed troops and equipment on the Golan Heights front lines today.

title: CLARENCE COTTAM OF TEXAS REFUGE
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., April 2 (AP)Dr. Clarence Cottam, the first director of the Welder Wildlife Refuge at Sinton and a wellknown conservationalist, died Saturday in a hospital here. He was 75 Years old.

title: Environmental Agency Yields; Will Explain Impact of Its Rules
description: WASHINGTON, April 2In a reversal of policy, the Nixon Administration has capitulated to Representative Jamie L. Whitten and has agreed that the Environmental Protection Agency must prepare statements on the environmental impact of most of its pollution standards and regulations.

title: School Integration Planner
description: On a routine day, Curtis Jay Berger jogs a good halfmile or mile around his apartment building at 1 Lincoln Plaza in Manhattan, indulging in a regimen that allows him to arrive at Columbia Law School by 8 A.M., well before just about everyone else  with one exception.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Bullets Win, 8879
School Integration Planner
description: On a routine day, Curtis Jay. Berger jogs a good halfmile or mile around his apartment building at 1 Lincoln Plaza in Manhattan, indulging in a regimen that allows him to arrive at Columbia Law School by 8 A.M., well before just about everyone else  with one exception.

title: MILLS, KENNEDY BACK HEALTH PLAN SIMILAR TO NIXON'S
description: WASHINGTON, April 2Enactment of a national health insurance program took a giant step forward today through the Introduction by two major Congressional leaders of a proposal similar to one presented by President Nixon two months ago.

title: Animals' Psychotic Acts Called Uncertain Guide
description: To what extent can psychotic behavior induced or occurring naturally in animals be used to understand better such behavfor in human beings? This question, applicable to much current research in psychology, was the theme of a conference last week that exposed a wide range of recent findings in the field.

title: Two Meatpackers to Unite into Third
description: Two large meatpackers that have been talking about a merger for some weeks, Missouri Beef Packers, Inc., of Plainview, Tex., and Kansas City Beef, Industries, Inc., of Wichita, Kan., have finally agreed to a joint reorganization that would unite the two Into a third company to be incorporated in Delaware. Previously the compitnies, had been discussing a merger that would have resulted in Missouri Beers being the Surviving comPany.

title: PRINTERS REACH NEWSDAY ACCORD
description: Long Island Typographical Union No. 915 and Newsday, published in Garden Citym have reached agreement on a new contract, providing $53 a week in wage increases aver three years and leaving the publisher free to introduce and operate new equipment and processes.

title: GOVERNOR SCORES NIXON TRANSIT AID
description: Governor Wilson, who me President Nixon last December in the Oval Office to discuss mass transit; and has since re turned to the White House fo continued talks with Presidential aides, today assailed the President's proposed masstrap sit legislation.

title: Bridge: An Unusual Race Develops For the MottSmith Trophy
description: In each spring National Championship, the player with the best performance, measured in master points, receives the Geoffrey Mott Smith trophy. In Vancouver, British Columbia, last week, an unusual race developed for this honor.

title: U.S. CLEARS RISE FOR GAS PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) The Federal Energy Office approved small increases today in the wholesale price of gasoline and the retail price of other petroleum products.

title: New Paltz Students End SitIn, Saying They Gained Voice
description: Students at the State University of New York College in New Peitz ended a weeklong occupation of the administration building yesterday after being told they would haler a stronger voice in determining how the school should be run.

title: New Outlook for France
description: For over a year, President Georges Pompidou faced and agonizing personal and political choice. He knew he was gravely ill, although he forbade any official confirmation of the fact with its implication that he would not serve out his full term, which would have ended in 1976. That gave him the upper hand over politicians jockeying for position in the contest for succession. But it also deprived him of the influence he was determined to wield over the Government coalition's choice of a candidate to follow him.

title: Reading and Math Scores To Be Disclosed May 28
description: TRENTON, April 2The first statistical measurement of how effective New Jersey's school districts have been in teaching the basic skills of reading and mathematics will be made public on May 28, the State Department of Education announced today.

title: CHARLES G. SHAW, 81, ABSTRACT PAINTER
description: Charles Green Shaw, whose abstract and semiabstract paintings have been widely exhibited, died yesterday at his home, 340 East 57th Street. His age was 81.

title: Javelin Aide's Case Put Off
description: ST. JOHN'S Newfoundland, April 2 (AP)The case of John C. Doyle, chairman of the executive committee of Canadian Javelin, Ltd., has been postponed to Aug. 1. He was charged here Dec. 8 with fraud and breach of trust.

title: Anker Returns Control to District 26
description: Irving Anker, the city's School Chancellor, returned full control of School District 26 in northeast Queens to the local school board yesterday after settlement of a dispute with the board over finances.

title: Dog Racing Bill Gains
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., April 2 (AP)The Vermont Senate passed and sent to the Governor today a bill to allow greyhound dog racing in the state.

title: DOLLAR OFF AS GOLD ADVANCES IN EUROPE
description: LONDON. April 2 (UPI)  Selling pressure in the late afternoon pushed the value of the dollar marginally lower on most European money markets today. Gold prices gained across the board.

title: Treasury Bills Mixed At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, April 2  The yields on threemonth United States Treasury bills rose slightly and the yields on sixmonth bills fell slightly in the Government's weekly competitve sale Monday, of these shortterm securities.

title: McKinney Considered
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 2 (AP)  Jack McKinney, who was dismissed last month as basketball coach at St. Joseph's College, will be proposed as commissioner of the new National Lacrosse League at a league meeting in Washington next Monday. David Natale, president of the Philadelphia Wings of the league. said today he would submit McKinney's name.

title: Hockey Scoring Leaders
Price Rises Overwhelm India's Poor
description: NEW DELHI, April 2 Ganga Rain visits the money lender often now. His wife yearns for a secondhand sari and his children complain that their tea is bitter without milk or sugar.

title: Vietnamese, 24, Longs for Battle
description: PLEI KEP, South Vietnam, March 26In this simple, montagnard village, there is a young man with a boyish, grin who wishes the Americans had never left Vietnam.

title: LOCKHEED REJECTS BID BY HUGHES UNIT
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation, which is openly looking for an acquisition partner to help it through financial difficulties, has apparently rejected one wellheeled candidate  Howard Hughes In it annual report now in the mails, Lockheed disclosed that a plan that would have allowed Hughes's wholly owned Summa Corporation of Encino, Calif., to acquire nearly 10 per cent of Lockheed's stock, making it Lockheed's largest stockholder, has all but lapsed.

title: Mandate to Redistrict
description: The Justice Department's finding that the composition of a number of legislative districts in Brooklyn and Manhattan violates the Voting Rights Act of 1970 should surprise no one. It leaves the State Legislature with the obligation to do what it should have done long ago without Federal prodding; that is, to redraw outrageously gerrymandered district lines to provide the kind of racial equality envisaged under the law.

title: C.B.S. Gives News Taping Right To National Archives Service
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System, which has gone to court to restrain Vanderbilt University from video taping the C.B.S. evening; newscasts for its Television News Archive, announced yesterday that it has granted a nonexclusive, royaltyfree license to the National Archives and Records Service of the United States to record and Collect the network's news and public affairs programs.

title: INSIDER TRADING CHARGED ON GEON
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 The Securities and Exchange Commission today accused Geon Industries, Inc., and two of its top officers of fraudulent insider trading in the company's stock and attempting to conceal the transactions Tom the American Stock Exchange.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (Reuters)The Cost of Living Council today exempted wages paid to employes of the newspaper industry from Phase 4 controls.

title: A Phone, for Some of Elderly, Is Their Link With the World
description: Dozens of Bronx residents, many of them old and some infirm, made it clear yesterday that the telephone and unlimited use of it had become for many of them their principal link with the outside world.

title: 21 Senators Move To Cut Off Debate On Campaign Bill
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (AP) The Senate majority leader, Mike Mansfield, Democrat of Montana, filed a petition today to close out Senate debate on a campaign reform bill.

title: Jazz Festival Open Hune 28 With More Compact Schedule
description: This year's edition of the Newport Jazz Festival New York, which opens a 10day run here June 28, will be half the size of last year's extravaganza but, according to its producer, will be better organized for listening and profit.

title: Porter, Little Man, Hurts Knicks Most With His Aggressive Style
description: The fastest of the speeding Bullets was on target last night.

title: U.S. AGENCY ACTS ON CRASH OF DC10
description: Reacting to evidence in the investigation of the crash of a DC10 near Paris on March 3, the Federal Aviation Administration said yesterday that all future design changes to correct an unsafe condition would be dealt with by compulsory decrees.

title: Cutting the Cord
description: According to Public Citizen, the researchandissue group headed by Ralph Nader, most of the money that was raised for Representative Wilbur Mills' unsuccessful campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination in 1972 came from individuals and economic interests that were looking for favorable treatment from the powerful Ways and Means Committee that he heads.

title: Mansfield to Seek Lower Trade Tariffs for China
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 (Reuters)The Senate Democratic leader, Mike Mansfield said today that he would introduce legislation soon to provide most  favored nation treatment  lowered tariffs for Peking.

title: Monday's Fight
description: New York (At Felt Forum)Angel Oquendo, 176 pounds, Puerto Rico, outpointed Willie Taylor, 171, Brooklyn, 10 rounds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On March 25, The Times carried a news article outlining Dr. Julian Perry Robinson's position against the production of binary weapons by the Army. A binary munition differs from previous chemical munitions in one important respect: Instead of containing actual nerve gas, these munitions are designed to produce nerve gas by combining two nontoxic elements only after the weapon is on its way to a target. The technical advantages of these weapons in terms of safety during transport and storage are obvious. In addition, problems of maintenance and disposal would be lessened, since prior to use they consist of nontoxic materials.

title: Court Upholds Company's Gift To Transit Bond Vote Drive
description: An appeals court decided yesterday that the New York Telephone Company had not violated any, laws by contributing $50,000 to a campaign for the transportation bond issue in the state's 1971 election.

title: Coastal States Gas Shows Drop in Net
Court Delays Stella Wright Shutdown 30 Days for a Hearing for the Tenants
description: NEWARK, April 2  The planned shutdown of the Stella Wright housing project on Sunday was postponed today for at least 30 days by Federal Judge Frederick B. Lacey, who ruled that the tenants of the project were being denied due process.

title: Brazil, Amid Construction Boom Finds Even Unskilled Labor in Short Supply
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, April 2 Wanted: Hod Carriers.

title: Yankee Box Score
description: ESudakis. DPMots 2. LOBMels 7, Yankees 2. 3BMaddox. HRMilner. SBMartinez and Harrelson.

title: AGNEW'S ATTORNEYS OPPOSE DISBARMENT
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., April 2 (AP)Attorneys for Spiro T. Agnew told the Maryland Court of Appeals today that the former Vice President's high position and the public outcry surrounding him should not affect a decision on whether Mr. Agnew should be disbarred.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, April 2, 1974

title: Loans to Russians Defended
description: WASHINGTON, April 2 The ExportImport Bank rejected today an appeal from a key Senator to suspend further export credits to the Soviet Union pending Congressional resolution of the whole controversial issue.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Employes at Macy's six stores in the metropolitan area have voted by an 8 to 1 margin to accept a twoyear contract providing an average increase of 15 per cent, according to Sam Kovenetsky, president of Local 1S of the Department Store Workers Union. Under terms of the settlement, a spokesman said, fulltime workers will get a $12aweek increase retroactive to Feb. 1 and an $8aweek increase effective Feb. 1, 1975. Hourly workers will get an increase of 32 cents an hour retroactive to Feb. and 21 cents an hour additional on Feb. 1, 1975. The old pay range was $120 to $150 a week, a union official said.

title: The Screen: Days of 36
description: When political trauma spreads like cholera, it's sometimes hard to root out causes and effects, or chains of consequence. Days of 36, written and directed by Theo Angelopoulos, evokes, the atmosphere of terror and repression that preceded the dictatorship of General Metexas in Greece in 1936. But the movie remains deliberately vague about the politics of the period and most of the individuals involved. (The film can be seen on Friday in the New Directors series at the Museum of Modern Art.) Mr. Angelopoulos has said that he was making a montage of events. Since his narrative has many parallels in Greece today, he keeps his political references oblique. The result is a very moving metaphor, rather slice of history.

title: Fee for Rothko Art Criticized by Heller As Being Too High
description: The contract consigning 700 paintings by the late. Mark Rothko to be sold over a period of 12 years at 50 per cent commission contained a lot of negligent aspects, Ben Heller, a New York art collector and private dealer, testified yesterday in Surrogate's Court.

title: Escalator Clause Is Backed
description: Milton Friedman is at it again The renowned economist from the University of Chicago has proposed a policy for beating inflation that has stirred his profession. What's more the Spunky conservative says his idea will eventually triumph despite the profession's initial resistance.It's only a question of whennot if, he predicted in a recent interview, with a selfassurance almost unmatched these days among economists.

title: Poe Devotees Are Gloomy Over Losses and Vandalism at His Cottage in the Bronx
description: The Bronx Society, of Arts and Sciences has called on the Parks Department to bar the public from visiting the Edgar Allan Poe cottage, which has been looted of a portrait and a statue of the raven that figures in Poe's famous poem. The raven vanished in 1971, the portrait, in 1972.

title: 10 Free in Drug Raids
description: A Federal District Court jury in Alton; Ill., acquitted 10 agents who invaded six households in southeastern Illinois by mistake a year ago. Page 46.

title: S.U.N.Y. Chief Asks Tenure Analysis
description: State University Chancellor Ernest L. Boyer directed the 29 staterun campuses yesterday to clarify their standards for awarding tenure and to analyze their projected rate of granting such lifelong fecalty job security in the next six years.

title: Stage: Sketches About Rich Blacks
description: The Negro Ensemble Company's season withinaseason, a series of four expertmental plays being given in its upstairs theater for a week apiece, reached Number Three at the St. Marks Playhouse last night.
