First of all, you realize that $2million is not a hell of a lot in the staggering context of TV economics, The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman cost over $1million to get on the air. QB VII, coming up later this month, reportedly ran up a production tab of $2.5million.

title: REINECKE IS FIRM ON PRIMARY RACE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 6While Lieut. Gov. Ed Reineck might appear to be a fatally wounded candidate for the Republican nomination fop Governor of California, he has not given up nor has his chief opponent written him off.

description: HOUSTON, April 6 (UPI) Gov. Reubin Askew of Florida called today for Americans and their government to get more involved in efforts to improve he public school system.. He addressed the National School Boards Association here.

title: CAMBODIA REBELS OVERRUN 3 POSTS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 6 (AP) Communistled rebel forces overran three government outposts southeast of Phnom Penh yesterday and ??day, and more than 400 soldiers and civilians were either killed, wounded or missing, survivors said.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated.

title: His crime caused a war
description: Hans Koning's novel about the schoolboy assassin whose shot was heard round the world on June 28, 1914, is more than a historical tale. It is an essay on the anatomy of tyrannicide, and a powerful evocation of the mind of a teenage revolutionary. Written in a seemingly artless style, it reflects on contemporary order and disorders. In its fablelike form, it projects a believable image of the activist hero  even if it does not answer all the questions it raises.

title: New Interest Seen In Sports Cars
description: Almost 30 years after a rakish roadster with spoked wheels arrived from Britain and introduced Americans to a new way of motoring, the American automobile market is still waiting for a modestpriced, massproduced sports car to fulfill a postwar dream.

title: Miss Sarah Williams Bride of George Olson
description: liama, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew M. Williams and a great granddaughter of President Theodore Roosevelt, was married Yesterday afternoon to George Edward Olson; son of Mr. and Mrs. George Olson of Arlington, Wash.

title: Sue me, said Mr. Kass to Mrs. Blustein
description: Imagine how Edith Blustein felt the day her new couch was delivered; complete with an ugly scratch along the wooden frame. She marched straight to the phone and called Kass Upholstery, where she had bought the couch. William Kass, the proprietor, was apologetic. He would be glad to send someone out to repair the damage. Mrs. Blustein didn't think a scratch that deep could be eradicated. After all, a couch that cost $561.75 should be perfect. Eventually, Mr. Kass agreed to pick up the damaged goods and return her money, except for $60 to pay for trucking the couch from his store in Manhattan to Mrs. Blustein's home in Brooklyn and back.

title: Peter J. Schieffelin Will Marry Alexis B. Tollefson on June 29
description: Mr. and Mrs. Leslie Warren Tollefson of Northridge, Calif., have announced here the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alexis Belinda Tollefson, to Peter Jay Schieffelln of Van Nuys, Calif., son of Mr. and Mrs. William Jay Schieffelin 3d of Mount Kisco, N. Y.

title: Dolphins Earn More
description: CHICAGO (UPI)Prosperi?? is evident in pro football's ?? book. The Miami Dol?? earned $15,000 each ?? winning the 1974 Super ?? game but in 1933 the ?? Bears earned only ?? each for winning the ?? Super Bowl of that era?? National Football League ?? game.

title: KARL HARPUDER, PHYSICIAN, DEAD
description: Dr. Karl Harpuder, consultant and former physican it charge of the department of physical medicine and rehabilitation at Montefiore Hospital and Medical Center in the Bronx, died there Friday. He was 80 years old and lived at 3390 Wayne Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Fuel Economy Kills Big Safety Vehicles
description: WASHINGTONRemember the Department of Transportation's experimental safety vehicle project that turned out tanklike behemoths with batteringram bumpers?

title: What's a TV star? Someone who is beautiful and sexy, but not threatening
description: HOLLYWOOD. What's a TV star? It's someone who has the acceptance of a mass audience, says Perry Lafferty, vice president of programing for C.B.S. in Hollywood. It's as simple as that. Mary has what we call star quality.

title: Three troubled lives
description: Barry Unsworth has said in an interview that his main concern as a novelist is in moral complexities and ambiguities, and every character in this novel, including the walkon ones, is riddled with them. In a modernday Istanbul, which refracts their turgid longings and exotic melancholies, three English people who knew one an other one longago summer at a country estate must now keep their appointments with the consequences of that summer.

title: The Appraiser's Art
description: The value President Nixon placed on his Vice Presidential papers (minus some choice items concerning J. Edgar Hoover, Jacqueline Kennedy and the Vietnam war) was $576,000. That figure is now painfully academic for the President, but his experience raises some interesting questions about the monetary value of such documents.

title: Laotian Cabinet Takes Oath at Pagoda
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, April 6Premier Souvanna Phouma and his new coalition Cabinet took a formal oath of allegiance at a solemn Buddhist ceremony in Vientiane's most sacred pagoda today.

title: Steadily, Tourists Take to the Road

title: Westcott Art Collection Is on View

title: Stage: National Health
description: NEW HAVEN, April 5It is one of Peter Nichols's most unusual attributes as a playwright that he makes jokes where other people would cry. We saw this first in his remarkable A Day in the Death of Joe Egg, a comedy about a spastic child that was a Broadway hit some six years ago. We see it again in The National Health, which had its American premiere tonight at the Long Wharf, New Haven.

title: Whalers Top Cougars for Series Lead
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 6 (AP) Tom Webster and Larry Pleau each scored two goals and the New England Whalers twice made up twogoal deficits tonight to open defense of their World Hockey Association championship with a 64 playoff victory over the Chicago Cougars.

description: Should Thomas Hoving deaccession himself?

title: Dave Anderson
description: CINCINNATI, April 6On the sidewalk next to the shiny black Cadillac limousine the red carpet had been unTolled. On it in gold were the words Fantastic Aaron, and when Henry appeared outside the Netherland Hilton Hotel shortly before noon today he was approached by a 72yearold man with a mustache who calls himself Fabulous Howard. His full name is Howard Risner and he is America's most celebrated chauffeur, at least in his opinion. On his card is the phrase, Have Cadillac, Will Travel and he had driven over from Chicago to transport Henry Aaron to Riverfront Stadium in anticipation of the 40yearold slugger's 715th home run.

title: General Electric Analyst Goes to Washington ...
description: WASHINGTON  George Tappert did not feel like the new boy in school when he arrived at the Department of Housing and Urban Developmetn last summer.

title: Ian Shrank Fianc of Lexa Logue

title: Photography
Victims of Tornado Fear It Ruined a Way of Life
description: BRANDENBURG, Ky., April 6Ellis Blake is a crusty country lawyer not easily given to crying. The last time he wept, he says, was when his wife died six years ago.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A total of 42, 896 applicants passed the written Civil Service examinations for 8,000 police officers jobs that are, expected to become available in the Police Department in the next two years. The city's Personnel Department said 53,474 applicants took the test last December. Those who passed will undergo physical exams beginning April 23. Background checks, including reviews of military records and screening of families, will than be made. The remaining candidates will then undergo further medical tests and certification before admission to the Police Academy. The first recruits are expected to start training by late summer or early fall.

title: 202 Gives Shot Lead To Charles
Miss Samuels Plans Bridal
Architecture
description: For Louis Kahn, there were ten years of great buildings, and a lifetime of preparation. Which makess his sudden death harder to takek because it was hot a promising talent that was cut off, but one that flowered late, and manificently, to create works of architecture of such enormous fullness and richness that they stand not only as masterworks of this age, but with the agelessness of great art, for all time.

title: Daughter to the Kelners
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Paul Kelner of Charlotte, N. C., on March 14 in Charlotte. Mrs. Kelner is the former Miss fudith Ward, daughter of Mrs. William C. Ward of North Stamford, Conn.

description: TodayAt Philadelphia.

title: Bones of a Mastodon Are Dug Up in Jersey
description: The bones of a mastodon, a prehistoric elephant, have been unearthed near the Hackensack Water Company's reservoir in Closter, N.J., by a team of paleontologists and about 30 volunteers who were working over the weekend.

title: MINE SAFETY AIDE POUNDED TABLE

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Gardeners have not been able to follow the standard rules on timing this year, With a late March snowstorm, frigid temperatures and little sun to warm and dry the soil, things have bogged down a bit.

description: For the past two months, The bend market has been in a slump, one made doubly bad by the tact that it was almost completely unexpected.

title: Losing the War
description: At the moment the country appears to be winning the gasoline battle and losing the environmental war. There has been a tragic turnabout in values. The temporary price and availability of a gallon of gasoline have become more important than the permanent cost of destroying the country's resources and heritage. And the greater tragedy is that so much of a oncearoused public has apparently ceased to care.

title: Bill to Protect Land Buyers
description: TRENTON  Democratic leaders in the State Senate are predicting swift approval of a tough, new consumer law that would protect prospective buyers purchasing distant retirement or vacation property.

title: A PAPER IN CAIRO ATTACKS MOSCOW

The oratorio, which celebrates man's universal search for freedom, is being presented by the East Orange congregation as a community service and as a special salute to Israel.

description: Dr. Patricia McCaffrey Yarvote, senior physician in the medical department of the Exxon Corporation, was married here yesterday to William Hull Hagendorn, an associate with the New York law firm of Shearman & Sterling. The Rev. Mark Bauer performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola and concelebrated the nuptial mass with the Rev. Edward Hogan.

description: WESTBURYRichard Ornauer, president of the Nassau Board of Cooperative Educational Services, was reelected to a fiveyear term on the ninemember board last week by a narrow margin.

description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., April 6 (AP)Hurrian out distanced the competition by six lengths today in an easy triumph in Finger Lakes Race Track. Hurrian returned $8.60, $4.40 and $3.60 for $2 across the board. Denres finished second, followed by At Laffs.

title: U.S. Attorneys Ask to Run Joint Crime Strike Forces

description: The City University of New York's faculty and Staff members yesterday challenged the university's recent report on the sueeess of the openadmissions program.

description: Imperial House, that elegant mass of white brick on the Upper East Side, is, at age 14 an oddity among apartment housesa cooperative in which the majority of, residents are renters.

title: Record for Free Programs Is Set by State Arts Center
description: WOODBRIDGEThe Garden State Arts Center reported last week that it had sponsored 106 free programs for 530,000 people in 1973, a greater number than ever before in its history.

title: ... An Bureaucrat Looks at G.E.
description: When Bert Lewis was first introduced around his office in the General Electric building on Lexington Avenue last summer, one of his new coworkers looked him over and commented, Well, you don't look like a Fed.

description: TEL AVIV, April 6  Israeli warplanes went into action twice today to hit a Syrian force that crossed the ceasefire line in the Golan Heights, a military spokesman said here.

title: A natural feminist
description: Evelyn Eaton is a natural feminist, one of a long line going back, if not to Lilith, at least to Vashti, who refused to come at the King's command. From her father, a major in the Royal Canadian Horse Artillery, she gained complicity, rebellion and Independencehell was altogether a fine place to be . . . where he was going and he hoped it was where I would wind up too. He disappeared effectively from her life when she was 12, when his regiment was called into service in World War I, and completely at 15, when he was killed in the Battle of Vimy Ridge.

title: You Can't Take the Country Out of Chet
description: THE recent wellpublicized move of the Grand Ole Opry from its longtime home in musty old Ryman Auditorium in downtown Nashville to dazzingly modern quarters in Opryland on the outskirts of the city must have convinced even those who still think of country music in terms of hillbillies that something has happened to what was essentially backwoods folk music only a little more than 25 years ago. There have beento quote a song that lives on the borderlines of Nashville musicsome changes made.

title: The failure of reform politics
description: In Choosing Our King, Michael Novak's concern with ethnicity becomes an attack upon the arrogant romantics of the New Politics. The failure of reformers to understand the significant symbols that mark American existence, he holds, has demonstrated their political impotence and has helped to condition workers toward the reluctant acceptance of George Wallace. Undoubtedly, Novak's views will be linked with the postMcGovern debacle. They will be cited as evidence of the growing backlash as exemplified by the Democratic party's current series of strategic retreats  revamping guidelines for delegate selection, renewing the search for ethnically balanced tickets; regeneration for the Richard Daleys, hard hats and the sanctification of Wallace. current series of strategic retreats  revamping guidelines for delegate selection, renewing the search for ethnically balanced tickets; regeneration for the Richard Daleys, hard hats and the sanctification of Wallace.

title: Hight Prices Force Gas' Sales Down
description: TEANECK  Gasoline is plentiful again in North Jersey, but it costs about 10 cents more a gallon and service stations throughout the area, report that their sales volume is off by 20 to 25 per cent.

description: WYCKOFF  All that Josep Villano wanted for the new location of Aquarius Design, Ltd., his interiordesign business in New News York City, was a conveniently situated building of some architectural Interest, one that would have space for shop and be away from snarling commercial traffic. He found it here.

description: MUNICH, West Germany, April 6 (AP)Frew MacMillan of South Africa beat Tony Roche of Australia, 64, 76, today to earn the first final berth in the $50,000 Red Group World Championship Tennis tournament.

title: Toros Finding Place In the Sum in Miami
description: Slowly but methodically, the Miami Toros are working toward becoming a strong franchise in the North American Soccer League. In fact, on the basis of advance ticket sales and advertising revenue, the Miami team has surpassed last year's income at this time by 2 times.

title: Talks, Resume as Guild Strike At U. P.l. Is Completing 3d Week
description: A strike of editorial employes against United Press Internetional is completing its third week, with the two sides divided not only over contract terms but also over the walkout's impact on news coverage.

title: DecisionMaking Changed By Beame Administration
description: In three short month, Mayor Beame has drastically changed the decisionmaking apparatus of city goverment, abandoning the cabinet as a policysetting body, granting new autonomy to city agencies, and opening his door to scores of commissioners whose predecessors over the last eight years rarely set foot inside the Mayor's, office.

title: OPINNION: Why Csonka Jumped to the New League
description: I'm like most people. Any time I do something that's wrong, I feel empty. It's my conscience bothering me, I guess. But at no time since signed last Sunday with the Toronto Northmen of the new World Football League have I felt any moral or ethical guilt about leaving the Miami Dolphins after next season.

title: UNORTHODOX FILM STIRS MUSCOVITES
description: Moscow, April 6The current sensation on the Moscow screen is a highly unorthodox film about a former convict who emerges from prison to encounter taunts and discrimhiation and then teeters between gobs straight and lapsing into his evil ways, only to be killed by his old gang.

title: The Interlock System: A Devilish Contraption
description: DETROITIt's a devilish contraption to get into, and I've had to call a service truck three times to get the car started, said Mrs. Henrietta Mason of San Diego, who owns a 1974 Buick LeSabre. I get all dressed up to go some place and, after trussing myself up in all those belts  perhaps to go only six blocks  I get out of the car looking like I've been in a wresting match.

title: State to Ask Higher Con Ed Bulk Rates
description: The State Public Service commission intends to shift more of the burden of the Consolidated Edison Company's electric rates to the bulk user, particularly the commercial and industrial consumer, and, away from the residential customer.

description: SUMMITThe New Jersey Association of Indepelident Schools will hold its annual conference at Peddle School, Hightstown, on April 26.

title: Psychiatry Students Get Rx From Ann Landers
description: What was Ann Landers, the grande dame of advice columnists, doing lecturing to a psychiatry class at Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn? That was the muttered question on the lips Of several medical students, and one nearly dropped his pipe as the forthright lady exclaimed, I have no credentials to address medical groups. I'm probably the least educated person in this room.

title: HOW TO: Jack Kramer Tells Average Tennis Players How They Can Develop a Winning Forehand
description: How many times have you heard a coach or instructor say, never copy anybody else's style? You hear it in almost any sportifootball, baseball, tennis or whateverand I think it's too bad.

title: David/Stewart, Nancy Floreen Are Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Gustav J. Floreen of Arlington, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Nancy Marie Floreen, to David O. Stewart, legislative correspondent for The Staten Island Advance. A June wedding is planned.

title: A Gallery of Heavenly Portraits
description: The first closeup pictures of Mercury, radioed back by the robot spacecraft Mariner 10, show the solar system's smallest, innermost planet to be bleak and forbidding. Its surface, torn by space debris, is marked by flat craters and thin valleys, and resembles those of the moon and Mars. The Mariner probe revealed that Mercury has a weak magnetic field, a thin atmosphere and possibly a dense core and less dense outer layers.

title: Monmouth Helping Alcoholics
description: LONG BRANCHTo the doctors, social workers and therapists affiliated with the Alcoholism Treatment, Center at Monmouth, Medical Center here, the MonmouthOcean County resort area is a battleground littered with sick, dead or dying alcoholics.

title: The Travel Bookshelf
description: THERE are only two ways to get from the United States to Europe (by plane or by ship), but once the traveler reaches the Continent his transportation options are wide open: automobile, train, bus, plane, ferry, bicycle, thumbing or bumming. These six books cover various aspects getting around Europe; some will appeal to the young and adventurous, others to the more conventional traveler, all contain considerable practical information to merit the attention at least of the firsttime Atlantic crosser.

title: . . and Detroit Responds With BigCar Prices

Instead, automobile Manufacturers in Detroit have concluded that they can get bigcar prices for their smaller modelsand the key is to make them luxury models.

title: Teaching Assistants Vote For Union at. Michigan U.
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., April 6  The University of Michigan teaching assistants have voted by nearly 2 to 1 to unionize.

title: Once an Irishman, Always ...

This is an extremely interesting show, which is what counts, but the chief interest is only indirectly related to such Irishness as it has. Even the catalogue essays are refreshing in their understatement of theses that could have been aggressively chauvinistic.

title: Incarnadine once
description: Marvin Spevack's Complete and Systematic Concordance to the Works of Shakespeare was published in six voluines in 196870, driving poor John Bartlett's Concordance (1894) to the dusty corner of the library. Bartlett was a good man in his time but no match now for Spevack armed with a computer which delights in its omnipotence. Spevack's volumes listed every use of every word in Shakespeare's plays and poems, arranged alphabetically, with context, for the works as a whole (Vols. IV, V. and VI) and individually without context, for each work (Vols. I, II and III.) Volumes IV, V and VI are the basis of the Harvard Concordance in one mighty volume, a splendid.

title: A Son for the Wadlers
description: A son was born March 24 at the North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, L. I. to Dr. and Mrs. Gary Wadler of Dix Hills, L. I. The child has been named David Jeremy. Mrs. Wadler is the former Miss. Nancy Royce Riseman, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Jacob Riseman of Poughkeepsie, N. Y. Dr. Wadler, director of ambulatory services at North Shore University Hospital, is an assistant professor of medicine and assistant professor of public health at Cornell University Medical College.

title: Beyond Man's Reach
description: In early April man should take a good look at himself and the world and make a few concessions to universal truth. March is too early, with spring still hovering beyond the next hill, and May is too late, with spring in possession of all the hills and valleys. But in early April a man can admit that he has nothing to do with the opening of a bud or the sprouting of a seed. Spring is as independent of human management as sunrise the phases of the moon.

title: Music
description: TWO fine singers are giving recitals this week Dietrich FischerDieskeen on Friday, Shirley Verrett on Saturday. Both, it will be noted, double in opera, There used to be a saying that no opera singer ever was a good recitalist, and that is of course nonsense. It is equally true that there are certain opera singers who get onstage put many arias on their programs, bawl their way through thern, and then, as a gesture toward musicianship sing Schubert Serenade or Ave Maria with appalling style But nobody takes them very seriously.

title: 2 Zoning Plans in Brooklyn Provoke Community Debates
description: Heated controversies involving two Brooklyn neighborhoods  Carroll Gardens and Coney Island  drew partisan groups to City Hall last week as the City Planning Commission considered zoning designations that had provoked passionate debate within the respective communities.

title: New & Nover
description: You might think that there is nothing left to be said in fiction about the advertising business. How wrong you ere! Isabel Glass finds enough minutiae in the feverish world of fashion retail advertising to make up a busy, yeasty novel. The sturdy framework of the book is its realistic detail. This includes trade exotica like a fringe fashion magazine that pays its debts with due bills, and an inside view of a department store's advertising bullpen. Here Greta Barringer, a nice girl from St. Louis, fights off competitors for her job, and is eventually in line for her boss's. In the love and sex sector, Greta goes from an arid encounter with a sadist to some very, intricate relationships. At one point, she is paired with a school classmates exhusband who wants to marry the daughter of a dress manufacturer that Greta is really crazy about. The author integrates these complications into a rich slice of what makes up Women's Wear Daily.

title: What's Doing in OCHO RIOS
description: OCHO RIOSThe Caribbean island of Jamaica, once a British colony, has been an independent country since 1962. And Ocho Rios, once a fishing village of a few hundred inhabitants, is now a thriving re sort area 67 miles east of Montego Bay and 40 miles north of King ston, the capital. In recent years the village has grown into a town of about 8,000 permanent inhabi tants and the Ocho Rios resort area has come to mean all the hotels, villas and inns, along the north coast; between Discovery Bay, 20 miles to the west of Ocho Rios, and Port Maria, 14 miles to the east. The 34 miles of golden beaches from Discovery Bay to Port Maria are caressed by water, that seems as clear as a pane of glass; The resort area is not at all like Miami Beach. The hotels and inns are generally small and very understated and have a pleasant continental flavor.

title: NEW LAMHUT DANCE IS APPEALING WORK
description: Medium Coeli, the long new work that Phyllis Lamhut created and showed for the first time at the Space Friday night, is in the middle ground between sadness and joy. It has much appealing dance in it, but does not completely sustain its mood.The dance begins with a wonderful solo, Ascendant, which Miss Lamhut performs to the hilt. It combines technical control, understated humor and the lovely image of her tapping her head and rotating her hips like a knowing amusementpark figurine. The six remaining sections of the piece go through a cycle of activity with the 10 members of the company, ending with all drumming their palms on the floor, then standing with arms overhead.

title: Bench's Homer Brings Cheer to Ailing Boy, 4
description: CINCINATI, April 6 (AP) While Henry Aaron rested, Johnny Bench pulled an old Babe Ruth trick today. The Cincinnati Reds' catcher promised homer to a gravely ill youngster and delivered.

title: And the king lived happily ever after
description: Most modern fairy tales (and probably most ancient fairy tales now happily forgotten) are either arch, pretentious, tendentious or tediouior some combination of them Colos's THE STUDENT WHO BECAME KING IN SPITE OF HIMSELF (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, $5.95), a retelling of an old Hungarian folk tale, is, in the language of the multipleanswer quiz, none of the above. Instead it is exciting, suitably spare, moving and witty. Colos's illustrations are, if possible, even more delightfully surprising and wittier than his text.

title: New Course Teaches Motorcycle Safety

title: News of the Camera World
description: CLAIMED by the manufacturer to be the first autothyristor electronic flash unit priced at under $100 ($99.95 list price), the new Vivitar Model 352 is a hand held model that comes complete with a camera mounting bracket that holds the flash off to one side and helps provides a comfortable band grip when shooting. Full automatic, the flash unit not only computes and regulates the amount of light required (depending on the distance from the light to the subject), it also has thryristor circuitry that conserves the power not used in each flash to shorten recycling time for the next flash. Thus, the number of flashes from a set of batteries, as well as the recycling time, will vary with this distance. For example, at six feet it Will deliver over 400 flashes per set of battries, and will recycle in about one second.

title: Teahouse to Be Restored
description: The 100yearold teahouse in Prospect Park that was severely damaged by fire on March 9, will be restored to its original grandeur, the Parks Department has announced.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
PLIGHT OF INDIANS IN SCHOOL DEPLORED
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP)American Indian students score lower at every grade level than the average pupil, a top government official in charge of Indian education says.

title: Movies
At an Old Style English Resort, Everything Stops for Tea
description: HERE in Totland, I.O.W.  it stands for the Isle of Wight, which is a couple of miles off the south cast of Englandwe're all right, Jack. You can have your Cannes, your Algarve, your Greek isles, your Tangier, I'll take Tolland. You'll never bump into a group of Club Mediterrane swingers here, and I'm swill Playboy Tours /gives the place a wide berthif they've ever heard about it. this is more your typical English seaside resortnot on the scale of Brigptort or Blackpool or Bognor Regis but a modest, somnolent little spot where mums and pops and the kiddies can splash in the sea and drink their tea on the sand. It's the kind of place evoked by that old musichall song:

title: Rise in Black Students Brings Disputes on Law School Recruiting
description: Ten years ago, there were about 700 black law school students in the United States; today, following intensive efforts by previously allwhite schools to increase their num ber, there are about 4,800. Similar multiple increases in minority enrollments have occurred in nearly all graduate and undergraduate schools.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodayAuto Club of America Trentonian 22 at Trenton (N. J.) International Speedway, 2 P.M.

title: L.I. College Head Fight Oust Effort
description: The president of the State University, College at Old Westbury, L.I., embroiled in a Controversy with his faculty involving the future ethnic composition of the institution, said last week that he had no intention of resigning.

title: Nicholas Ault Fiance Of Anne S. McConnell
description: Mr. and Mrs. William R. McConnell have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss. Anne Stephens McConnell, to Nicholas Burchenal Ault, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Burchenal Ault. Both families are of Santa, Fe, N. M.

title: Book Ends
description: Slush. A recent Guest Word column prophesying more publishers will refuse to read unsolicited manuscripts no doubt caused a tremor among the Great Unpublished Out There, the struggling writers still hungrily gulping the Asnericpn Dream of discovery. That they are out there is attested to by the response to the article reported by at least one house, Little, Brown (where, the Guest Word reported, they still read slush): the pile went up several inches. To throw a little fuel on the dream, we'll tell you a slushpile success story. The book is Six Days of the Condor, by James Grady, which Norton will publish June 3, and it was discovered, yes, in the slush pile by editor Star Lawrence. Now, it's been sold to the movies and is a Literary Guild alternate. Mr. Grady's novel seems to breed an affinity with firstreaders, because it is about a man who reads spy stories for the C.I.A., looking for parallels with reallife operations and for tips for C.I.A. spies. Over at Guild, where they have readers going through their slush piles, the readers had an instant empathy with Mr. Grady's hero and urged the book on their boss. So let's hear it for the first readers, whether in the publishing houses, the C.I.A. or wherever.

title: Six Said to Die in Protest Staged by Ethiopian Police
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, April 6 (UPI)Gunfire broke out when police staged a protest in the district capital of Gondar and initial reports said six persons had been killed and one wounded, Government sources said today.

title: Dance: Juilliard Troupe
description: The Juilliard Dance Ensemble's annual spring concert is always a major event of the dance season, not only because it reveals still another new generation of dancers, but also because it frequently gives major modemdance choreographers an opportunity to show new work.

title: Ban on Group Living Is Speading
description: BELLE TERRE  In the wake of a United States Supreme Court ruling last week upholding a village ban on group living by unrelated tenants, officials in Nassau and Suffolk Counties are preparing tougher ordinances on group living and planning stricter enforcement of laws already on the books.

title: New Policy Will Give Coast Guard District Chiefs More Authority to Stop Unsafe Transocean Voyages
description: While Thor Heyerdahl and his Kon Tiki crew made it to land safely and got a best seller for their trouble, countless other sea voyagers who dream of a hero's reception on the other side of the Pacific have had to settle for a notsoheroic rescue by the Coast Guard. To save the sea voyager from himself, beginning April 17 any United States Coast Guard district commander will have the authority to terminate an intended voyage if he determines that the vessel is unsuited for the trip.

title: United Air Lines Wage Pact Is Reached by Machinists
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 (AP) A tentative agreement beween United Air Lines and the Wachinists Union averted threatened strike today and is expected to set the wage patem for six other major airlines.

title: T. F. Clauss Jr. Fiance Of Sidonie A. Miskimin
description: Miss Sidonie Ann Miskimin and Thomas Fadden Clauss Jr., members of the junior class at Yale College, plan to be married Aug. 3 in the Marquand Memorial. Chapel of the Yale Divinity School in New Haven. Prof. and Mrs. Harry A. Miskimin Jr. of Woodbridge, Conn. have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Dr. and Mrs. Thomas F. Clauss of Olyphant, Pa.

title: Bridge
description: Bridge is essentially a social game, but unfortunately it attracts a substantial percentage of antisocial people. The nuisance is prevalent at every level  in major tournaments, in small clubs and in private homes. The menace is perhaps worst in a domestic game, since there is no escape, short of breaking up the game, from the selfappointed expert who moans about his luck, screams at his partner, jeers at his opponents and offers them unsolicited advice.

title: Laymen Asked to Name Archbishop Candidate
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., April 6A joint committee composed of priests and laymen in the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Santa Fe announced here this week that it was requesting, its lay members to recommend names for a successor to the Most Rev. James Peter Davis, retiring Archbishop.

title: Troupe Seeks to Retain Church Home
description: This gives us ways to perform classics fax from the pressures of Broadway, said Walt Witcover, gazing at the rafters of the Spencer Memorial Church, Remsen and Clinton Streets, Brooklyn Heights, which is now the home of the Masterworks Laboratory Theater.

title: Using a really public utility
description: On the Connecticut coast of Long Island Sound, workmen are putting the finishing touches on a new house of contemporary design sandwiched between other resort cottages. From the street, the house looks no different from its neighbors. Viewing it from the south, along the shore, however, one observes three long slanted rows of glasscovered panels mounted on the roof. The panels contain blackened copper plates which absorb sunlight and transfer heat to blackened copper pipes carrying water for use in the home's spaceheating and waterheating systems.

title: Islanders Win, 42
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., April 6 (AP) Billy Harris scored three gbals and Denis Potvin set a oneseason scoring record for rookie defensemen as the New York Islanders posted a 42 National Hockey League victory over the Minnesota North Stars tonight.

title: Braves Top Celtics in Last Second
description: BUFFALO, April 6  The Buffalo Braves stormed back from a 10point deficit early in the final period today and defeated the Boston Celtics, 104102, before 18,119 delirous fans in the. Memorial Auditorium. Jim McMillian tipped in the deciding basket just before the final buzzer sounded.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Stone & Webster Engineering Corporation has leased approximately 300,000 square feet of space at One Penn Plaza.

title: Avoiding Double Digit
description: WASHINGTONIs the United States, with consumer prices now increasing at an annual rate of 10 per cent, headed for an indefinite period of doubledigit inflation? The question itself, as Herbert Stein, Chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, said the other day, is terrifying. Such a world would be new to Americans, and it would undoubtedly lead to new ways of saving, investing, writing labor contracts and many other things.

title: City Council Committees Plan to Meet This Week
description: The following sessions of City Council committees will take place this week:

title: Mandatory Jail Term Bill Signed by Maine Governor
description: AUGUSTA, Me., April 6Gov. Kenneth M. Curtis has signed into law bills that provide mandatory jail terms for persons convicted more than once of breaking, entering and larceny and burglary and that increase truck weight limits on. Maine highways from 73,280 pounds to 100,000 pounds.

title: Recreational Vehicle Industry Struggles Diversify as Sales Slump
description: While most of the automobile industry is thinking small these days, the nation's troubled recreational vehicle industry is thinking: Stall.

title: Field Trial Journal Marks Centennial
description: The American Field Publishing Company is celebrating its centennial. Since 1874, it has been publishing the weekly, American Field, the bible of the fieldtrial and hunting set. On the walls of the company's headquarters in Chicago are oil paintings of national birddog champions.

title: Albany Student Troupe Is Cheered in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, April 6 (UPI)A student theater troupe from the State University of New York at Albany opened here today with The Wizard of Oz, the first American university company to perform on the Soviet professional stage, according to a student spokesman.

title: Parent and Mid
description: The thought that their child might develop cancer is literally unthinkable for most parents. Yet the fact is that cancer kills more children between the ages of 1 and 4 than any other disease (it Strikes more than 7,000 children each year), and that no period in childhood is immune (some infants are born with malignant tumors; many cancers appear before the age of 5).

title: National Guard Sergeants Learn Art of Management in New Class
description: SEA GIRT  A new training program is being conducted here, to improve the efficiency of the state's senior sergeants, the men who have daytoday control of the 17,000 members of the New Jersey National Guard and the state's $50million defense budget.

title: Carly Aulicino Is Bride
description: Miss Carly Aulicino, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Armand D. Aulicino of Pelham, N. Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Christopher List, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard List, also of Pelham. Chaplain Melvin Hawthorne, minister of the Chapel of the Church Center for the United Nations performed the nondenominational ceremony.

title: New Pumps Will Prevent Fish Kills at Two Nuclear Plants
description: SALEMFish kills, a wintertime problem at New Jersey's only nuclearpowered generating plant, will not occur at a $500million plus facility now under construction in Salem County or at a floating generating plant proposed for a site off Brigantine, in Atlantic County.

title: Guttenber: Little Piece of Americana
description: GUTTENBERGWhere is Guttenberg? a driver asked a man on Bergenline Avenue. The man, pointed a finger in a southerly direction. Just go, down until you come to 70th Street, he said, and you're in Guttenberg. Its only a few blocks wide and a few blocks long. If you're looking for something, you have to be careful, or you'll go right by it. The town isn't very big, but everyone knows everyone else. They seem to hire been living there together for a time.

title: Vietnamese Clashes End in Stalemate
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 6Recent fighting west of Saigon and northeast of Kontum has now subsided with the same kind of inconclusive results that have marked most of the ceasefire war since the Paris agreement was signed 14 months ago.

title: Motorman Is Slain When He Interrpts Holdup in a Brothel
description: A Transit Authority motorman was shot and fatally wounded early yesterday when he Inadvertently interrupted holdup by four armed men in a Queens brothel, according to the police.

title: HERBERT T. MAGRUDER
description: Herbert T. Magruder, a retired vice president of the Central Hanover Bank and Trust Company, died yesterday in Staten Island Hospital. He was 92 years old and lived at 407 Henderson Avenue in West New Brighton.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Mrs. Hodgson to Head Ox Ridge Show Alone
description: Mrs. Richard Hodgson of New Canaan, Conn., has been elected chairman of the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show, a position she shared with Bonnie Wright last year. Miss Wright was forced to resign as cochairman because of the press of business. She works for the M.J. Knoud saddlery, which is owned by her father, David.

title: Braves Bench Aaron but Kuhn Orders They Play Him Today
description: CINCINNATI, April 6 Henry Aaron was benched today so that he might resume his assault on Babe Ruth's home run record Monday before his home public in Atlanta. But tonight the commissioner of baseball ordered the Atlanta Braves to start Aaron tomorrow or face serious penalties, and they yielded.

title: Headliners
description: Bill Bradley has decided to pass, at least for now, and shoot for a seat in Congress some other time. The New York Knick forward had been expected to seek the Democratic nomination in New Jersey's 13th Congressional District, where Mr. Bradley lives in Morris County. But, citing the short time between the end of the basketball season and the June primary, Mr. Bradley said he would not have had sufficient time to wage an adequate campaign. Others speculated that he may have decided against a race now because there are two other Democratic contenders.

title: Penn Wins in Lacrosse
description: NEW HAVEN, April 6Jon Bock scored three goals and Reid Howard added two as Pennsylvania's lacrosse team defeated Yale, 83, in the Ivy League opener for both schools. The victory was Penn's second in a row, and evened its wonlost record at 22, the same as Yale's. Paul Sferrazza scored twice for Yale, which trailed, 51, at the halftime.

title: A Grand Old Bipartisan Trick, the Gerrymander
description: In the surgical syntax of one Watergate era memo, politicians tend to maximize their incumbency.

title: Roadside Markets Surveyed on Sales
description: TRENTONA survey made recently by the New Jersey Crop Reporting Service shows that the state has total of 623 roadside farm markets whose annual sales total more than $1,000. An additional 189 markets had sales of less than $1,000.

title: Sunday Observer
description: A powerful case exists against American television and the press, but Richard Nixon and his men are forever getting it wrong. It is not that the media are hostile to Presidents, and to Nixon more than most, but that they are such abject tools so eager to be of. Presidential use that they have distorted all our perceptions of what news is and what government is about.

title: 12 Die in Venezuela Crash
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, April 6 (Reuters)Twelve people died and 25 were injured when a bus loaded with vacationers collided with a truck in western Venezuela early today, the Interior Ministry said. The accident near Ciudad Bolivar, on the Orinoco River, was the first major tragedy of the Holy Week holiday period, when Venezuelans customarily flee to Caribbean beaches and inland resort towns. To reduce accidents Caracas had announced last night a ban on the sale of alcoholic drinks during the holidays.

title: The Nation In Summary
description: The prosecution has rested its case in the trial of John N. Mitchell andMaurice H. Stans, and the defense now begins its attempt to disprove the charges against the two former Cabinet officersthat they sought to impede a Securities and Exchange Commission investigation of financier Robert Vesco in exchange for a secret $200,000 cash contribution to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: Peron's Return To Argentina Has Failed to Bring Unity
description: BUENOS AIRESFor 18 years, Juan Domingo Peron lived In exile after he was overthrown in a military coup, and while he was gone his nation was contentiously divided between Peronists and nonPeronists.

title: Mass Honors Pompidou Amid Sunlit Pageantry
description: PARIS, April 6More than 50 chiefs of state and government gathered in the soaring, sunlit splendor of Notre Dame Cathedral today to honor the memory of Georges Pompidou, President of France for four years and nine months.

title: NIXON EXTENDING HIS STAY IN PARIS; MEETS 4 LEADERS
description: PARIS, April 6  President Nixon conferred here today With four European leaders, reportedly on recent difficulties between the United States and Western Europe.

title: Its Britain's Greatest Boon Since the Grand Coal Discoveries
description: LONDONLyness is a small village on the island of Hoy, the second largest in the Orkney Archipelago that lies off the northern coast of Scotland. During two world wars, Lyness was the center of Britain's main naval base, Scapa Flow, whose deep water and sheltered approaches made it one of the finest natural harbors in the world, But over the past 25 years Britain's naval power has evaporated and with is the importance of Lyness; all that now remains is the shell of a concrete cinema for the troops, a small naval cemetery in which are buried the victims of German Uboat attacks, a number of decrepit huts and a barnacled jetty at which large battleships once tied up. The population of the island has dwindled from its temporary wartime peaks of more than a million to a mere 500. Yet Lyness is now set for a new invasion of men, those that go down to the sea not in ships but in rigs, to bring back oil.

title: Governor's Pay Rise Urged
description: BOSTON, April 6 (AP)The salary of the Governor of Massachusetts should be increased from $40,000 to $50,000 over a fouryear period, the Advisory Board on Legislative and Constitutional Officers' Compensation said yesterday.

title: WELFARE FRAUD UP, LEVITT SAYS
description: Despite decreasing relief rolls, State Controller Arthur Levitt reported yesterday that client claims of lost or stolen welfare checks had risen sharply and contended that the city's antifraud program had become hopelessly backlogged and effective.

title: Weicker Says I.R.S. Gave Nixon Tax Data to Aid Political Moves
description: WASHINGTON, April 6 Senator Lowell P. Weicher Jr. charged today that the Internal Revenue Service had acted as a lending library for the White House in supplying sensitive tax data on political friends and foes of President Nixon.

title: GREEK BASE SHIFT IS TERMED A PLOY
description: ATHENS, April 6Diplomatic and military sources say that the United States decision to suspend plans for basing an aircraft carrier near here was partly a negotiating ploy. They also describe the decision as partly a response to Congressional criticism of American relations with the military Government of Greece.

title: Lawyer PracticesPiano
description: CHAMPIONS of contemporary American piano music are not out to dazzle the ordinary concertgoing public, and they generally hold forth in the smaller, outoftheway auditoriums. Next season, however, one of the best practitioners in this field will present three programs in Alice Tully Hall. He is Robert Miller, who back in 1970 gave just such a recital at the 92d Street YMYWHA and has otherwise for the past 10 years been devoting his talents to first performances. Composers are happy to entrust their new works to him.

title: Criminals At Large
description: If nothing else, David Westheimer knows how to tell a story. Remember Von Ryan's Express? And, only last year, the deliriously funny, straightfaced Going Public? Now this superb storyteller has cane up with THE OLMEC HEAD (Little, Brown, $7.95), and it contains all the expertise, deftness, smooth flow and complete professionalism of its predecessors.

title: Ideas & Trends Education, Law, Medicine
description: The bank accounts of millions of Americans have been, unknown to most of them, open, to government inspection for past 15 months. And despite protests that there is a potential major invasion of privacy in the situation, it has been declared both legal and necessary by the Supreme Court.

title: When Taking a Vacation From a Vacation, Try Yugoslavia's Hvar
description: YUGOSLAVIA, the Communist country, with the capitalist convaniences, has long been a, favorite of budgetminded Westerners. But as the popularity of, its coastal has Brown, so drama crowds and pollution. During peak season, Dubrovnik's beaches now have walltowall peole, and the thriving heavy industry of Split is beginning to turn some of its bathing waters oily. As a result, savvy Yugoslav's and foreign vacationers alike are heading for the Yugoslav islands in the Adriatic, and when it comes to beauty, serenity, interest and climate, the island of Hvar liver wins hands down.

title: Mrs. Rennert Has Child
description: A daughter was born March 29 to Dr. and Mrs. Morton C. Rennert of New York in the Mount Sinai Hospital. Mrs. Rennert is the former Miss Susan Sider.

title: Navajos Seek More Jobs
description: WINDOW ROCK, Ariz., April 6The Navajo Tribal Council has announced that it has contracted with Brigham Young University to undertake an economic development survey designed to increase tribal, employment by 5,000 and to make the Navajo nation more selfsufficient.

title: Cecile Doelger, Marymont '74, Plans Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank G. Doelger of New Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cecile Marie Doelger, to John Howard Pinto Jr., who is with the law firm of Whitman & Ransom here. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Pinto of Los Angeles.

title: Trouble for Muffin, Shelley, Brenda and Adam
description: Momma needs to go out and get drunk because her husband got murdered.

title: Show Reflects Era of Change
description: THE International Imported Automobile Show, which opened yesterday and continues through ??xt Sunday at the Coliseum here, is a ??n of the automobile's temporarily minished horizon and the uncertainty the market that guides the tends of ilders and exporters. Except for the ssible arrival of a brilliant new carappearance was kept, appropriately, suspenseful doubt until the last minmost of this year's cars will be niliar to visitors to the show last ??ing.

title: Hagon and Belger Are Relay Stars
description: NANUET, N. Y., April 6Mike Hagon and Mark Belger posted top running performances today despite rain and 35degree weather in the Nanuet Relays. Hagan, from from Suffern High, and Belger, a Mepham senior from North Bellmore, L. I., ran as though the sun were shining.

title: Australia, With No Fuel Crisis, Remains an Auto Oriented Society
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The international energy crisis as weekend drivers take to the roads by the hundreds and thousands, with personal funds the only limit on their destinations. Neither gasoline rationing nor driving restrictions have been introduced in Australia.

title: New Hearing Is Set on Mall
description: The controversial proposal for a 15store shopping mall in Douglaston will face its next major appraisal May 9 when the New York City Board of Standardsnd Appeals reconvenes hearings that began last week.

description: Nets vs. Virginia

title: Cortright Wetherill Jr. Marries Janice Nestle
description: Miss Janice Sue Nestle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold E. Nestle of Lancaster, Pa., was married at noon yesterday to Cortright Wetherill Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Wetherill of Newtown Square, Pa.

title: Candace Brown Fiancee of George Lapin
description: Mr. and Mrs. B. Robert Brown of Fairfield, Conn., have announced the engagement of Mr. Brown's daughter, Miss Candace Marie Brown, to George Louis Lapin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Lapin of Hackensack, N. J. Miss Brown is also a daughter of the late Mrs. Alyse Graham Brown of Westport.

title: Try A Few Offbeat Annuals
description: TO my way of thinking, there are two kinds of annual flowers: the flashy ones planted ingreat quantity and the unusual ones that are intriguing rather than sensitional.

title: ExposCubs Put Off
description: MONTREAL, April 6 (AP) The Montreal Expos' National, League baseball seaon opener against the Chiago Cubs today was postoned because of cold and et grounds. It will be made ??p as part of a doubleheader tomorrow.

title: Cornfeld Resumes Style At a Posh London Club
description: LONDON, April 6Bernard Cornfeld, former head of the collapsed Investors Overseas Services mutual fund empire resumed his flamboyant style in London today, brushing aside the rigors of nearly 11 months in a Swiss jail.

title: INVESTING
description: Serious longterm investors, including managers of mutual funds, know only too well that buying growth stocks in the hope of large capital appreciations can be a very rough ride indeed.

title: Moore Takes Lead In Larchmont Sail
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., April 6James B. Moore of Manhasset Bay (L.I.) Yacht Club sailed into a 13point lead in the Interclub Class today in the opening of the annual spring regatta of Frostbite dinghies at Larchmont Y. C.

title: Cannibals & Christians
description: ON October 12, 1972, a Fairchild F227 of the Uruguayan Mr Force, chartered by an amateur rugby team, set off from Montevideo in Uruguay for Santiago. in Chile. Reports of bad weather in the Andes brought the plane dawn in Mendoza, a small town on the Argentinian side of the range. The next day the weather had improved. The Fairchild set off again, flying south to the Planchon Pass. At 3:21 P.M. the pilot reported to Mr Traffic Control in S tiago that he was over the Pass of Planchon, and at 3:24 that he was over the town of C ic in Chile. He was authorized to turn north and begin his descent to the airport of Pudahuel. At 3:30 he reported his height as 15,000 feet, but when the Santiago control tower spoke to the Fairchild a minute later there was no reply.

title: More Than 100 Million Americans Could Benefit
description: WASHINGTONAs national health insurance moved closer to enactment last week the key questions being raised were these: What kind of program is likely to emerge and how it help to ease the medical expenses of the American family?

title: Wood, Field and Stream: ShadFishing Time Near
description: Now that the trout season is under way in New York State, it is time to speak of another spirited game fish, the Anierican shad.

title: Ranger TuneUp Backfires in 83 Rout
description: DETROIT, April 6  The idea for the Rangers tonight was to stay healthy, perfect their forechecking and let Gilles Villemure regain his eye and stature as the No. 2 goalie.

title: Restoring a Lost Magnificence
description: ONE sometimes looks back with a certain envy on those earlier generations of critics and connoisseurs for whom the entire history of artoften, indeed, the history of everythingassumed a fixed shape and an unquestioned scale of values. Tradition, was a word (and a concept) that tended to be used in the singular, and deviationa from it were judged accordingly (which is to say, unfavdrably). There was no nonsense about every artistic aspiration having its own legitimacy. Artistic production was blithely separated into high and low periods of achievement, and only the 'highs really counted. It was all so simple.

title: News of the Screen
description: George C. Scott is ready to start shooting The Savage Is Loose, a project he has kept secret for the eight months it has taken him to prepare it for the cameras lie will also star In and direct the drama, which is being made as his first personal production under the aegis of his company, Campbell Devon Productions, with Robert E. Relyea serving as executive Producer. Filming will be done entirely oh tropical locations in Mexico near Puerto Vallarta.

title: Majestic Jerry, $5, First at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N.J. April 6Majestic Jerry, owned by Neil J. Helfrich of Washington Court Huoes Ohio, won the 7,500 Smiths Pace at Freehold Raceway today. Herve Filion handled Majestic Jerry to win the mile event by threequarters of a length in 2:04 1/5.

title: Small Cars Called Threat to Safety
description: The shift to small automobiles may help save gasoline, but it iS causing an increasing concern among automotive safety experts, who say small cars offer too little protection in collisions.

title: Foyt's Racer Damaged in Trenton Run
description: TRENTON, April 6The winner of the Trentonian 200 tomorrow will have driven 200 miles and be no farther from Trenton than when he started. But he'll be a lot closer to Indianapolis.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Solution to Last Week' Puzzles
description: ERNEST K. GANN: BAND OF BROTHERSAviation news, regardless of its reliability, can travel around the word in less than twentyfour hours. What happened in Bangkok at midnight may be recounted by a crew member in Tokyo the following morning, or in Athens, or Cairo.

title: Women Discuss Roles in Life
description: PARAMUS  More than 500 middleincome suburban women crowded into the ballroom of The Imperial Manor here to listen to other women who have made it in the world outside the home.

title: Title Play Slated For Table Tennis
description: WESTFIELD  The 1974 New Jersey tabletennis championships, which are open to all state residents, will be played April 2728 at the New Jersey TableTennis Club, 226 North Avenue.

title: Lenox Hill Hospital Names Ophthalmology Unit Head
description: Lenox Hill Hospital has announced the appointment of Jr. Robert S. Coleti, a resident of New York, as director of qtri. Department of Ophttalmology. Dr. Coles previously served as associate attending surgeon at Manhattan Eye, Ear and Throat Hospital. A native of New York, Dr. Coles received his M.D at New York University In 1945and has written extensively on uveitis, Cataract complications and pediatric ophthalmology.

title: The Number One World Problem Today
description: What used to be called the Palestine Problem and then the ArabIsraeli Conflict has become the number one world problem today.

title: Russran Orthodox Easter Is a Busy Time for Baker
description: PASSAIC  Because next Sunday is also Easter for those of the Russian Orthodox faith, this week will be an exceptionally busy one for Jan Kaczmarek owner of the Polonia Bakery at 204 Monroe Street. He will be standing over hot ovens in order to meet the heavy weekend demands of his large Russian, Ukrajnian and Polish clientele.

title: Flood: The cooks' choice
description: Easterin America at leastisa holiday curiously lacking in ritual foods. Even the traditional hardcooked eggs are more of a decorative artifice than a meaningful addition to Easter dinner. Our choice for the principal dish of an Easter feast is baked fresh ham.

title: HEAD OF POLICE UNIT MOVED TO THE BRONX
description: Deputy Chief Inspector Paul F. Delise, chief of the Police Department's public morals division, has been transferred to a position as deputy to the commander of the Bronx, a department spokesman said yesterday.

title: Trenton to Pour Water on Troubled Oil
description: This will revolutionize the whole world, said George A. Hamid Jr., the president of Trenton International Speedway. This is what the world has been malting for. Hamid sounded as if he had just invented the wheel. And if he is correct, Vared 43 might be almost as important to the automobile as the wheel.

title: I Would Like to See a Revival of...
description: It has often been said that revivals don't have chance, in the New York theater. Yet this season has been given distinction by the appearance of a spate of fine revivals, one of which, Eugene O'Neill's A Moan for the Misbegotten, has brought to the drama on Broadway the kind of excitement it has seldom had in recent years. Others have ranged from Philip Barry's Holiday,to Michael Weller's Moonshildren. (Even the Tony Awards committee hit a snag over whether Candide and Lorelei are new productions or revivals.)

title: On the Open Road, Happiness Is a Full Tank of Gasoline
description: DEVILS ELBOW, Mo.In America, Mobilityboth the physical and social kindhas long been a treasured trait of life, if only because it was next to impossibie in the stratified society of Europe, from which most of America's settlers had fled.

title: Mary Jane Rearick Wed
description: Miss Mary Jane Rearick, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Rearick of Rockville Centre, L. I., was married there yesterday to James Warren. Cappell, son of Mrs. James Cappell of Riverdale, the Bronx, and the late Mr. Cappell. The Rev. Gerard Sheridan, uncle of the bride, performed the ceremony in St. Agnes Roman Catholic Cathedral. The bride teaches in North Babylon, L. I. Her husband is an indexer with The New York Times Information Bank and Editorial Index.

title: In Summary
description: A Federal law designed primarily to eliminate political discrimination against Southern blacks is, for the first time, being applied in the North, to end inequities in New York City.

title: The Scores Is The tot 7, Movies 1
description: THERE is a sudden, viciously impatient gesture made by Jessica Tandy in Butley, the American Film Theatre's local offering for the month of April, that nearly brought me to my feet with a whoop of encouragement. Miss Tandy, a teacher being tormented by the sadomasochist Alan Bates, was seated across the desk from her smirking, falsely deferential opponent. Between them, in the camera's eye, stood a gooseneck lamp.

title: Dear Lucy, If You're Really Going, Take Efrem With You
description: THE anxiety is insupportable. Even my parakeet, John Dean, has stopped singing; and the zodiac sulks in the broom closet, refusing to eat anything but higher  priced spreads. We are accustomed by this time of the year to have heard from the webs (as Variety calls the networks) about their fall schedules  which old programs will be axed, which new ones are aborning. Fall schedules are thrilling to contemplate: Imagine, a whole 15 minutes of Dick Cavett every evennumbered Ash Wednesday! A sitcom about singing transvestites! Four hundred and thirty  seyen made  for TV movies about emotionally disturbed young women trapped at night in a high school gym with seven rapist dwarfs!

title: Carol Swenson Bride of David Hoover

title: Hearst Ransom Appears Deductible
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 6Randolph A. Hearst, publisher of The Sari Francisco Examiner, will apparently be able to take a tax deduction on the $500,000 he gave to the People In Need food distribution program set up in response to demands by the abductors of his daughter Patricia.

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTONNo session of the Assembly or State Senate ever begins Without the traditional opening prayer or invocation, by a clergyman invited by the legislative leaders.

title: Notes: Si, New Mexico  Does Accept Dollars
description: MANY Americans still think there are only 49 states, It's not that they forget Alaska or Hawaii or little Rhode Island. It's just that they can't believe there's a New Mexico, even though the Land of Enchantment, as it calls itself, covers more than 121,000 square miles and has a population of more than one million. The first time someone wrote and asked about a passport and the rate of exchange, I thought it was a joke, says Scottie King, information officer of the state's Department of Development. I was here only a few days then, but I soon learned that such questions are all too real.

title: Israeli Establishment Responds to Its Critics Largely by Ignoring Them
description: TEL AVIV, April 4The Israeli Establishment, challenged as it has not been since the creation of the country 25 years ego, is respending to its critics largely by ignoring there.

title: W.F.L. Needs Television Contract to Survive
description: The World Football League is the biggest sports gamble yet. Its ability to survive, let alone grow, is dependent upon a successful courtship of an eventual national network television contract that must generate at least $200,000 of income for each of the 12 teams. Can the W.F.L., which established some credibility last week by signing four prominent National Football League players, win such a contract? No way, said a highplaced network official, who requested anonymity.

title: Music in Review
description: Andrew Bolotowsky, a flutist who made his New York recital debut last season, returned to Carnegie Hall on Friday night for a second appearance. With Frances Heilbut at the piano, Mr. Bolotowsky played sonatas by J. C. Bach and Donizetti and Schubert's Introduction and Variations on Trockne Blumen for the first portion of the program. The second consisted of works for unaccompanied flute or flute with electronic tape composed within the last six years by Paul Horn, Jennifer Post, Elias Tanenbaum and Randall McClellan.

Some 50 men and women are now participating in this program, which is called the President's Commission on Personnel Interchange.

title: The story of an island
description: Once there was no television to drop the War of the Philippine Insurrection into our laps. No magazines to take us into Khartoum or Buckingham Palace. And no radio to catch the groans of buildings collapsing in San Francisco. It was only a century ago in fact but millenniums ago in technology. Nicholas Monsarrat's The Kappillan of Malta is a handsome literary brontosaur from that era. It does what a novel almost always used to do. It transmits information. It tells us about real places, real events and composite people so that we might know history through its imaginative reconstruction. All of which may no longer be enough from a novel.

description: ALBANYLong Island may have its best tourist season ever this simmer, Assembly Speaker Perry. B. Duryea of Montauk said he had been assured by the State Comcoerce Department.

title: FieldTesting the New FreezeDried Foods for Outdoorsmen
description: No cooking required. Drain and serve. Eat dryjust as it comes out of the package. The directions may vary from product to product, but the principle behind the freezedried foods now popular with outdoorsmen remains the same it's precooked food with about 98 per cent of the water removed. The process has been adapted to beef stew, chicken chop suet, spaghetti and meatballs, peaches, ice cream and about 200 Other dishes. The end product is a boon to backpackers and campers, again heading for the hills by the hundreds of thousands with the advent of spring, for food with 98 per cent of its water content removed weighs only about onethird as much as food in its original state. But there are some drawbacks, as we shall see.

title: Nikolaas Tinbergen Seagull
description: OXFORD. He has been in love with seagulls since he was a boy and made frequent visits to the. North Sea coast from his home at The Hague. Nikolaas Tinbergen, the ethologist and Nobel Prize winner, wrote, long after, that the white birds flying above the sands were as happy as the boy who watched them. He can't prove that animals have such subjective experiences and he isn't sentimental about them, but he is convinced that they feel thingsthat the gulls were, indeed, happy. As a student and then a teacher of zoology at. Leiden University, he would start out well before dawn on a bicycle to reach the nearest gullery, an hour away, by sunrise, when the birds were most active. Farmers asked him wonderingly if this was how he made a living, he and his students, watching birds with fieldglasses, catching them with nets and ringing them to aid identification. We were tolerated because we were harmless fools, he says.

title: Recordings

Recent releases of Don Gio vanni (Philips 6707 022, four disks) and Die Zauberflte (Angel SCL 3807, three disks) are only the latest to join a steadily growing list of multiple, versions, and the coming months promise at least two more Giovanni's (Angel and RCA) and also two new recordings of Cosi fan tutte (Philips and London). No complaints from this cornerthese works are truly inexhaustible and always ready to reveal something fresh at the hands of a sympathetic conductor and cast.

Krause replaced Earl Stutz Jr., of Norfolk, Va., whose 755 had led the field since March 21. Krause posted games of 247, 257, and 269.

Kanarek and Debbie Campbell gained the final of the women's singles today.

title: Film: 'Promised Land'
description: Miguel Littin, writer-director of "The Promised Land," the Chilean entry in the New Directors series shown Saturday and last night at the Museum of Modern Art, states his case against Latin-American oppression with the fervor of an unvanquished revolutionary. But if his love of the land and its enfranchisement is as heartfelt as his impassioned rhetoric, his highly stylized drama is less than convincing in its treatment of the Establishment and foreign exploiters.The 31-year-old movie maker, who completed his film last year when he was still head of the studio that was an official part of the overthrown, left-wing Allende Government, is obviously autobiographical in his treatment of a group of 1930, Depression-afflicted, homeless, wandering peasants who founded and cooperatively worked a village called Palmillo (the director's birthplace).The sweep and the irony of "The Promised Land" are fitfully visualized against a colorful background of lush tropical and snow-draped, authentic backgrounds. Mr. Littin's hordes of peasants, led by Nelson Villagra, unsuccessfully attempt to rise against the entrenched capitalists in a neighboring town only to be cut down by the cavalry of another rightist government that has just come into power to thwart their desperate attempt at self-rule.The tragedy of injustice is strikingly apparent, but its impact is lessened by a plethora of loving declamatory scenes and diffuse religious symbolism that tend to confuse, rather than impress, an uninitiated observer. It is easy to feel the irony and reality of the off-screen, narration of the aged peasant who survived doleful things past. The symbolism, however, is still distratcing, and a viewer can't help wonder of the estate owners, businessmen and the religious figures were as one-dimensional as they are depicted to be.Mr. Littin, who is reported living in Mexico, is forthrightly biased, and his peasants and workers look truly confused and driven. But if this anguished outcry against exploitation is unbalanced, it is also a powerful illustration of the talents of a dedicated movie maker.

description: YOU AND HUE There's an American flag in black and white hanging in the new show at Kodak Gallery and Photo Information Center, 1133 Avenue of the Americas (2626170). He went to the Whitney and spent the empty time looking at things in solitary bliss.
