That plot of ground to be planted and harvested has, other yields besides cabbages and carrots, however. One of the most important is contact with the soil and growing things.

title: Doctor Pleads Not Guilty In Boston Abortion Case
description: BOSTON, April 17 (AP)A doctor at Boston City Hospital pleaded not guilty today to charges of manslaughter in connection with the abortion of a sixmonthold fetus at the hospital last October.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times yesterday Stated incorrectly that the Houston States Gas Corporation had acquired an interest in two foreign companies. The correct name of the company is the Coastal States Gas Corporation.

title: Panel Assails Antidrug Plans As Temptation to, Young People
description: ALBANY, April 17On the ground that preventive information programs have made drugs more tempting than forbidding to the young, a state commission today recommended the dismantling of the $23million drugabuse programs for young people.

title: People in Sports
description: Al Downing, the Los Angeles southpaw insisted yesterday in Cincinnati that little had changed since he pitched his historymaking homerun ball to Henry Aaron in Atlanta last week.

title: GASOLINE DROUGHT FEARED BY STATE
description: New York State's energy chief warned yesterday that there would be widespread shortages of gasoline this month if demand continued to rise at the present rate.

title: 3 Chargers Offered $1.5Million
description: SAN DIEGO, April 17 (AP)Russ Washington, Doug Wilkerson and Cid Edwards, three firststringers for the San Diego Chargers, have been offered a total of $1.5million jump to the World Football League, says the general manager of the Philadelphia Bell of the new league.

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL LOSES COURT SUIT
description: A shareholder of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation won the right yesterday to sue the giant steel producer and its officers to recover more than $500,000 alleged to have been spent to influence the outcome of the 1972 Presidential elections.

title: P.S.C. Aide Backs Con Edison Request for Increased Stearn Fees
description: ALBANY, April 17A Public Service Commission examiner recommended today that Consolidated Edison be granted the full 19.4 per cent increase in steam rates that it had requested.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Knicks vs. Boston

title: I.T.T. Divestiture of Avis Is Delayed
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation will have to try harder to divest itself of Avis, Inc., because their proposed sale of the autorental system to the American Express Company was terminated Merger yesterday by mutual agreement. Last March 12, American Express agreed in principle to buy I.T.T.'s 52 per cent stake in Avis as well as the rest of the stock held by the public at $25 each. With 6 million Avis shares outstanding, the deal would have involved $150million.

title: Don't Slam the Closet Door
description: Ordinances prohibiting discrimination against homosexuals have been passed in Minneapolis, Detroit and the District of Columbie recently; the matter comes before the New York City Council this morning.

title: 2 FORMER LEADERS IN SEOUL INACTIVE
description: SEOUL, South KoreaLee Hu Rak and Kim Dae Jung, once political adversaries, have a lot in common today.

title: Women White Wings Planned
description: The white wing, who disappeared more than three decades ago along with the cigar store Indian, may soon be back sweeping the streets. Robert T. Groh, who was sworn in at City Hall as the new Sanitation Commissioner, said he would like to use the women who pass the sanitationmen's test as white wings, dressed in pants suits while pushing a broom along curbs. Mr. Groh, the former deputy Queens Borough President, said he also planned to paint a white line nine inches from the curband to have cars park outside the lineto make it easier to flush streets with hydrant water prior to sweeping by white wings.

title: U.S. Bank Loan to Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 17 (Reuters)A group of United States, banks headed by the Bank of America has agreed to lend Argentina $100million, an Economic Ministry spokesman said today. The loan will be repaid over 10 years with a twoyear grace period and will have an annual interest rate of 1.5 per cent above Eurodollar market rates, the spokesman.

title: South Korea Opens Trial Of 32 Accused of Spying
description: SEOUL, South Korea, April 17A Seoul criminal court today began the trial of 32 South Koreans on charges of having spied for North Korea using Ullung Island off South Korea's east coast as their base.

title: Sargent Vetoes Busing Bill
description: BOSTON, April 17 (AP)  Gov. Francis W. Sargent vetoed today a bill that would have provided for a bindinng referendum on the school busing issue in Boston.

title: Ehrlichman Denies He Is Cool to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, April 17John D. Ehrlichman publicly pedged today his allegiance to President Nixon and the ministration in an attempt, sources close to Mr. Ehrlichthan said to put an end to repeated speculation about his loyalty in the face of at least three pending criminal trials.

title: Hughes Establishes Panel To Scrutinize State Courts
description: TRENTON, April 17Richard J. Hughes, Chief Justice of the New Jersey Supreme Court, today announced the establishment of an Advisory Committee one Judicial Conduct aimed at assuring public confidence in the court system's probity, objectivity and freedom from outside pressure of whatever kind.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The New Jersey Civil Service Commission ruled against the discharge of 250 employes of the Margaret Hague Maternity Hospital in advance of a merger with the Jersey City Medical Center. The commission said the plan to dismiss permanent Margaret Hague employes before the merger was onesided and inequitable. Temporary employes at both hospitals should be laid off before any permanent employes, the commission said. The teamsters union, which represents the Margaret Hague employes, opposed the discharges.

title: Juilliard Quartet Performs Persichetti's Parable X
description: A whiff of the nineteen thirties, but a verystrong one, emanated from the Juilliard String Quartet's concert on Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall. The occasion was the New York premiere of Vincent Persichetti's Fourth String Quartet, subtitled Parable X.

title: Klepto Wins 5th in Row in Big A Stakes
description: Klepto satisfied the favorite players in the crowd of 20,412 at Aqueduct yesterday by winning the $27,350 Bed o'Roses Handicap. The 4eyarold filly, owned by Dr. Leon J. Hekimian, engaged in a strength  sapping duel early with the 121 outsider, Peter's Pet, but still had enough in the stretch to hold off Ladies Agreement and win by half a length. Next in the field of six came the Rokeby Stable's Summer Guest, making her first start of the season.

title: ExGov. Johnston Murray Of Oklahoma Is Dead at 71
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, April 17 (AP)Former Gov. Johnston Murray of Oklahoma died yesterday at Mercy Hospital, eight days after undergoing surgery for a ruptured abdomen blood vessel. He was 71 years old.

title: Vietnam: No Peace Within Striking Distance
description: CHARLESTON, S. C.For years, Vietnam was frontpage news, a major political issue, and an emotional experience for the nation, Now this has changed: Casualties have been stopped, prisoners released and the controversy eclipsed by matters closer to home.

title: Status of justice in Chile Worries Many Backers of Junta
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 17The legality of Chile's, current Government and the state of Julia in Chile continue to trouble a growing number of supporters of the new regime. More than seven months after the military coup in which the junta took power, many lawyers, judges and clergymen say privately, and even publicly, that human rights are being violated daily.

title: Florida's RighttoReply Law Is Argued Before Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 the Supreme Court was told today that a Florida law requiring newspapers to print replies from political candidates implemented rather than offended the constitutional guarantee of press freedom.

title: 2 in L.I. Kidnapping Enter Guilty Pleas To Ransom Charge
description: NEWARK, April 17  Two defendants in the kidnapping of 8yearold John Calzadilla form his Long Island home last month pleaded guilty today in Federal District Court here to a single charge of demanding ransom over the telephone in violation of instatecommerce laws.

title: JUDGE BARS END TOINDIANS' TRIAL
description: ST. PAUL, April 17  While Indians chatted and danced to the beat of a war drum on the courthouse steps this afternoon, Federal District Judge Fred J. Nichol ruled that the misconduct and negligence of Government prosecutors and agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation was not gross enough to warrant dismissing criminal charges against Indians who seized Wounded Knee, S.D., last year.

title: Foes Build Roads to Control Mt. Hermon
description: MOUNT HERMON, IsraeliOccupied Syria, April 17Israeli Army bulldozers were busy today fortifying their positions on the upper flank of this strategically vital mountain and clearing a track to the snowcapped 9,200foot peak.

title: Market Place: Analysts Differ Over Polaroid
description: Shortly after 9 o'clock yesterday morning, the DowJones news service tapped out the message that Polaroid's firstquarter profits fell to 30 cents a share from 34 cents a year ago.

title: 8 PARTIES IN INDIA AGREE ON MERGER
description: NEW DELHI, April 16  Eight political groups hav worked out a merger to oppos the Congress party, which ha dominated India since inde pendence in 1947.

title: Stocks Ignore Rate Rises And Move Ahead Modestly
description: The stock market more or less ignored the recent rise in the prime rate instituted by some banks; including the latlest rise reported yesterday, as stock prices posted a modest gain in relatively light trading.

title: Guatentala ExChief Says John Kennedy Ordered His Ouster
description: SAN SALVADOR, April 17 (AP)  Former President Miguel Ydigoras Fuentes of Guatemala says President John F Kennedy, responding to the failure of the Bay of Pigs invasion of Cuba, ordered the coup that overthrew him 11 years ago.

title: MichiganRound Two
description: A Democrat has carried the Eighth Congressional District of Michigan for the first time since 1932. Four years ago the Republican candidate won by 66 per cent; two years ago he won by 59 per cent. This week the party's choice, James M. Sparling Jr., went down to minus 49 per cent and defeat.

title: Consumer Notes
description: The failure of stores to honor their own advertising remains a major problem in many areas. Sometimes, according to the Nassau County Consumer Affairs Department, it's deliberateto entice people into the store only to buy higherpriced things. More often, however, it apparently is a result of the administrative left hand not knowing what the right is up to.

title: People and Business
description: The Bank of America, the country's largest commercial bank, has consolidated its national and international wholesale operations into a single integrated unit, with Chauncey J. Medberry as its head. Mr. Medberry continues as chairman of the bank, while A. W. Clausen, 51 years old, remains president and chief executive officer.

title: POLL SINGS IN LUCIA WITH MISS BROOKS
description: It took nearly an act and a half for the New York City Opera's Lucia di Lammermoor to get off the ground on Tuesday night. Perhaps the large number of cast changes had something to do with it: Melvyn Poll (Edgardo), Maurizio Mazzierl (Raimondo) and Howard Fried (Normanno) were all new to their roles with the company, and Patricia Brooks was singing Lucia for the first time this season.

title: Trinity Church Vestry Gets a Woman Member
description: The first woman to become a member of the vestry in the 277year history of Trinity Episcopal Church at Broadway and Wall Street is Miss Martha Twitchell Muse, pres, ident and executive director of the Tinker Foundation. She was elected on Tuesday.

title: Local Board Backs Site of Drug Center On East 68th Street
description: A controversial drug rehabilitation center planned lot 68th Street off Madison Avenne was overwhelmingly approved last night by the local Commubity Board, which overrode the angry objections of several residents led by Roy M. Cohn, the lawyer.

title: OFFER EXTENDED TO HORSE PROJECT
description: SOMERVILLE, April 17  The Animal Medical Center of New York was told today that Connecticut would welcome its 80horse research project into equineinfectious anemia, now based in nearby Hillsborough.

title: A.T.&T. Reports 14.1% Income Rise
description: MINNEAPOLIS, April 17The American Telephone and Telegraph Company's firstquarter net income rose by 14.1 per cent on a 12.2 per cent rise in revenues, John D. deButts, chairman, told 2,015 stockholders at the 89th annual meeting in the Minneapolis Auditorium and Convention Hall here today.

title: SCHOOL COMPLEX GAINS IN BROOKLYN
description: A dream nurtured for five years by residents of a blighted Brooklyn neighborhood moved a major step closer to reality last night when the Board of Education awarded design contracts for the first two school units of the planned East New York educational complex.

title: NIGER ANNOUNCES MILITARY COUNCIL
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, April 17Niger today announced the formation of a 12officer military Government with Lieut. Col. Seyni Kountie, leader of Monday's coup d'tat, as chief of state.

title: The Screen:House on Chelouche Street' From Israel
description: "The House on Chelouche Street," Israel's nominee for this year's Oscar as best foreign-language film, is a mostly gentle, sweet-natured movie about growing up poor but good in Tel Aviv in the summer just before the 1948 War of Independence. The film, which is classified PG, opened yesterday at the Columbia 2 Theater.The movie's virtues are a kind of steadfast modesty, even in its melodramatic moments, and the precisely detailed, performances, especially by Gila Almagor as a pretty, youngish widow and Ophir Shalhin as her 15-year-old son, who is the film's focal point.Moshe Mizrahi, who was responsible for last year's "I Love You, Rosa," wrote and directed the film, which is in Hebrew with English subtitles.

title: Nets Beat Colonels On Shot by Erving
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 17. Julius Erving took things into his own hands tonight by sinking a jumper at the buzzer to give the New York Nets an 8987 victory over the Kentucky Colonels in their American Basketball Association Eastern final playoff series.

title: A MARIJUANA LINK TO STERILITY SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 Heavy use of marijuana can have a depressing effect on man's production of male sex hormones and sperm, medical scientists reported today.

title: Books of The Times
description: FOURSTROKE. By Don Mitchell. 243 pages. Little, Brown. $6.95.

title: Theater: A Personal Family Portrait
description: A theatrical experience can be so personal as to be hermetic, a playwright's secret sealed from the audience. The play can be a catharsis for the writer (and enable him to go on to more, responsive matters) and an expansion for the performers. But something  a lack of perspective or even selfindulgence  cart block the work from communicating.

title: 14 Seized in Oakland Raid On Black Panthers Freed
description: OAKLAND, Calif., April 17 (UPI)Fourteen persons arrested in a police raid on a Black Panther party voter registration office were released today because of insufficient evidence.

title: Weinberger Sees a Sharp Rise in Hospital Costs
description: Caspar W. Winberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said yesterday that failure by Congress to extend price controls on the nation's $80  billion  a  year healthcare industry could lead to the quick skyrocketing of medical and hospital fees.

title: Simon a Firm Believer in FreeEnterprise, FreeMarket System With a Minimal Government Role
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 William E. Simon, who was named by President Nixon to day to be Secretary of the Treasury, is a convinced believer in a freeenterprise, freemarket system with government interference kept to a minmum.

title: Judge Asks to Retire
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 17 (UPI)United States District Court Judge John Morgan Davis, 67 years old, a former Lieutenant Governor, has applied for retirement from the bench on disability grounds.

title: Hambletonian Trot Escapes City Lights
description: The Hambletonian, perhaps, rural America's fast great sports event, will remain a rustic spectcular.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Stans Defends Secrecy on Vesco Fund
description: Maurice H. Stans took the witness Stand in his own behalf yesterday and swore that he kept Robert L. Vesco's $200,000 cash contribution to President Nixon's reelection campaign a secret because privacy was his constitutional right under law.

title: Bistate Dispute Shows Politics Affect Port Agency
description: TRENTON, April 17When the agency that is now the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was created by the two states in 1921 to develop the transportation facilities of New York Harbor, its sponsors envisioned an impartial, bistate organization free of partisan political rancor or chauvinistic, crossHudson rivalry. The authority would be governed by Six Commissioners front each state who would insure that the objectives of the respective Governors who appointed them would be fulfilled with absolute parity.

title: U.S. to Delay E.E.C. Deadline On Tariff Concessions 2 Months
description: BRUSSELS, April 17The United States has agreed to push back by two months its deadline for the European Economic Community to make tariff concessions to compensate for trade losses suffered by the United States when the Common Market enlarged from six to nine members in 1973.

title: Mets Drop 6th in Row, 74, to Expos As Stone Loses
description: MONTREAL, April 17 Pitching, or the lack of it, is causing the New York Mets all sorts of trouble, such as building their losing streak to six games. This afternoon in Jarry Park, the usually reliable George Stone was battered for nine hits and six runs as the Montreal Expos trounced the Mets, 74.

title: JERSEY JAILS SUED ON HUMAN RIGHTS
description: TRENTON, April 17  The prisonersrights project of the American Civil Liberties Union to New Jersey charged today that county jails in the state deprived inmates of a wide range of fundamental human rights and urged that the institutions be closed unless conditions were improved.

title: Abbie Hoffman's Wife Says He Felt Drug Case Was Contrived
description: Abbie Hoffman's wife, Anita, said of her husband yesterday that he must have felt trapped and I think he felt that he could not expect justice any more in the courts or out of them because he had been framed for this drug bust.

title: Frank McGee of N.B.C. Dead; Newsman and Today Host, 52
description: Frank McGee, since 1957 ont of the most respected newsmen of the National. Broadcasting Company network, died yester day morning in ColumbiaPres byterian Medical Center. He was 52 years old and, lived it Manhattan.

title: The Jaworski Subpoena
description: The dominant note in Special Prosecutor Jaworski's subpoena of 64 tapes and documents related to the Watergate coverup is the reluctance with which he found himself driven to this distasteful confrontation. His decision to resort to a court order is another somber milestone along an investigative road made slow and arduous by White House obstruction of the kind that culminated the firing of Archibald Cox, Mr. Jaworski's predecessor.

title: Communists Begin TopLevel Meeting Of Warsaw Alliance
description: WARSAW, April 17  The leaders of the seven Communist nations that belong to the Warsaw Pact military alliance opened talks here today.

title: SUMMER SHORTAGE OF CHLORINE SEEN
description: MOUNT HOLLY, April 17 (UPI)A supplier of chlorine used to purify water in 40 New Jersey municipalities predicts a shortage of the gas this summer, but he says probably only clubs will feel the effect.

title: Henrietta Ripperger, 84, Magazine and Book Writer
description: Mrs. Henrietta Ripperger Hawley, who as Henrietta Ripperger was a regular contributor to Woman's Day, Good Housekeeping and Redbook, died yesterday at her home in Morrisville, Vt. Her age was 84.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Personal Income Gained In March and the Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 (Reuters)  Personal income rose $5.1billion in March to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $1,100billion following an upward revised gain of $7.8billion in February, the Commerce Department reported

title: Exhibition Offer Antidotes for City Crime
description: The Police Department and the Association for a Better New York opened a twoday exhibition yesterday on how not to be burglarized, mugged, raped or robbed.

title: New Books
description: Bright Eyes: The Story of Susette La Flesche, an Omaha Indian, by Dorothy Clarke Wilson (McGrawHill, $8.95).

title: PRICES ADVANCE FOR SOYBEAN OIL
description: The nearby soybean oil deliveries were bid up almost a cent a pound yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, while meal prices eased and soybeans themselves closed practically unchanged.

title: Foes Build Roads to Control Mt. Hermon
description: MOUNT HERMON, IsraeliOccupied Syria, April 17Israeli Army bulldozers were busy today fortifying their positions on the upper flank of this, strategically vital mountain and clearing a track to the snowcapped 9,200foot peak.

title: Business Briefs
description: Kaiser Aluminum Raises Can Prices

title: Personal Finance
description: One of the most common complaints of car owners today is that auto body shops are extremely expensive and. that damages, even those resulting from lowspeed collisions, are costly to repair.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Diamond M Drilling Company in Houston said yesterday it had received letters of intent from the Gulf Oil Corporation, the Amoco Production Company and Empresa Nationale del Petroleo for mobile oildrilling units. Revenues from the contracts, which call for units to drill offshore here and in Chile, will exceed $60:5million.

title: CITY CALLED LURE FOR WORLD TRADE
description: International trade. International finance. International travel. These were identified yesterday as prime areas for growth in th city's economy at a conference at Pace University sponsored by the Council on Economic Education.

title: ABRAHAM ROBINSON
description: Abraham Robinson, Sterling Professor of Mathemhtics at Yale University, died last Thursday. He was 55 years old.

title: Obscure Buckley Vaults Into Political Maelstrom
description: WASHINGTON, April 17  William F. Buckley Jr., the columnist, was in Nairobi when he received a telegram from his brother, Senator James L. Buckley, informing him that on the following morning, the Senator would urge President Nixon to resign. The telegram was signed Saint Sebastian, a refer ence to the thirdcentury Christian martyr who smiled as the archers bent their bows.

title: 4 Fail in Attempt to Free 3 From Tombs
description: Four alleged sympathizers of the Black Liberation Army, armed with two concealed handguns and carrying an acetylene torch, last night attempted to free three suspected army members from the Manhattan House of Detention for Men. They failed when the torch, which they were using to cut through a steel wall in a visitors booth, ran out of sxygen, a correction officer said.

title: RICHARDSON APPEALS FOR DILIGENT PRESS
description: ATLANTA, April 17 (AP) Former United States Attorney General Elliott L. Richardson said today that the news media must insist on being told the truth, and expand efforts to dig the truth out.

title: Volcano Erupts in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, April 17 (AP)A 15,584foot volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula, the easternmost part of the Soviet Union, has begun erupting after seven years, Tass reported today. The official Soviet press agency saidthat ashes were falling over 300 square miles.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Radio: WBAI Winner
description: If it's unusual for radio to attempt a 90minute documentary, it's not surprising that the unusual example, called The Little People, will turn up at 7:15 tonight. on WBAIFM, the listenersponsored station. The station's Pacifica Foundation older brother, KPFA in San Francisco, celebrated its 25th birthday this week and, appropriately enough, the program was produced at KPFA.

title: S.E.C. FRAUD CASE INVOLVING PENNSY BEING CONSIDERED
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 Fraud charges arising out of the spectacular financial collapse of the Penn Central Company nearly four years ago are being considered by the Securities and Exchange Commission, according to well  informed Government sources, who said action in the case was imminent.

title: METAL COMPANIES LIFT QUARTER NET
Dave Anderson
description: Dave DeBusichere is hurting. Willis Reed is laboring. Bill Bradley is missing. Walt Frazier is struggling. Earl Monroe is groping. And the New York Knicks appear to be dying. But their coach, Red Holzman, is calmly unwrinkling the cellophane from a cigar and thinking. He's at his best, Walt Frazier once said, when we're at our worst. By that logic, Red Holzman should be at his cerebral peak tomorrow night in Boston when the defending National Basketball Association champions try to prevent the Celtics from taking a commanding 3.0 lead in their fourofsevengame Eastern Conference playoff. In the clamor over the Knick players, Red Holzman often is forgotten. He prefers it that way. On the bench he is highly visible and highly vocal. But once the game is over, it's as if he vanishes. He hides behind innocuons phrases. He conceals himself under the Camouflage of cliches. He never shares any strategic secrets. As a result, he Is seldom quoted. But by not really saying anything, he is saying everything.

title: 4th Division Reflects Army Gains and Problems
description: FORT CARSON, Colo.I'm not running a country club for boys, said Maj. Gen. James F. Hamlet, I'm training a division to fight.

title: TV: Family Faces Crisis in Nicky's World Film
description: There's something touching about Nicky's World, the madeforTV movie on the Columbia. Broadcasting System tonight at 9:30 o'clock. It has little to do with the movie itself, although the portrait of a large and loving GreekAmerican family, has its share of moments. Rather, it is the anxious quest of the networks to duplicate the tone and, more significantly, the success of that other large and loving family called The Waltons. The awkwardness and sheer incompetence are touching.

title: American Express Lifts Its Bar To Stores' Discounts for Cash
description: WASHINGTON, April 17The American Express Company has agreed to allow merchants honoring its credit cards to offer discounts to any customer who pays cash, it was announced today.

title: D'Busschere Ailing and Needs Rest
description: Dave DeBusschere is in pain and struggling with a sprain of an abdominal stomach muscle. He needs rest, but hopes to play tomorrow night when the Knicks oppose the Celtics in the third game of the National Basketball Association Eastern Conference playoff final at the Boston Garden. The Celtics lead the four  of  seven  game series, 2.0.

title: Klepto Wits 5thin Row in Big Astakes
description: Klepto satisfied the favorite players in the crowd of 20,412 at Aqueduct yesterday by winning the $27,350 Bed o' Roses Handicap. The 4yearold filly, owned by Dr. Leon J. Heklmian, engaged in a strength  sapping duel early with the 121 outsider, Peter's Pet, but still had enough in the stretch to hold off Ladies Agreement and win by half a length. Next in the field pf six came the Rokeby Stable's Summer Guest, making her first start of the season.

title: SADAT ENDORSES U.S. MIDEAST ROLE
description: CAIRO, April 17President Anwar elSadat has reaffirmed his intention to work through the United States in seeking a settlement of the Middle East conflict, making it clear that in his eyes the Soviet Union has been relegated to a secondary role.

title: SADAT ENDORSES ES. MIDEAST ROLE
description: CAIRO, April 17President AnwarelSadat has reaffirmed his intention to work through the United States in seeking a settlement of the Middle East conflict, making it clear that in his eyes the Soviet Union has been relegated to a secondary role.

title: The Theater: Maugham's 1921 Circle
description: THE CIRCLE; a play by W. Somerset Maughan. Directed by Gene Feist; setting by Holmes Easley; lighting by Ricnard Winkler; costume by Charles Colette; original score by Philip Campanella; sound by Gory Harris; hair styles by Paul Huntle; stage manager, Ron Antone. Presented by the Roundabout Theater, Gene Feist, producing director; Michael Fried, executive director, by special arrangement with Sheldon Abend. At 307 West 26th Street.

title: American Express Lifts Its Bar To Discount by Stores for Cash
description: WASHINGTON, April 17The American Express Company has agreed to allow merchants honoring its credit cards to offer discounts to any customer who pays cash, it was announced today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israeli bulldozers were at work on the southwestern upper flank of Mount Hermon in the Golan Heights as Syrian earthmoving equipment pushed an opposing track up the strategic mountain's eastern slopes. Both sides consider the mountain a crucial bargaining card in the forthcoming talks on a separation of forces. While Israel claimed an initial victory by establishing a small outpost at the summit, the. Syrians seem determined to seize it. [1:1.]

title: Breeders Get Tips on Dog Health
description: Stressing that preventive medicine is much more effective than curative medicine, Dr. Jay Hyman, addressing the Dog Fanciers Club at its luncheon here last week, outlined some steps breeders should take.

title: Peking Reports Describe 30 Executions in Canton
description: PEKING, April 17 (Reuters) Travelers from the southern city of Canton reported today that they saw public notices listing the names and ages of about 30 people recently sentenced by criminal courts and executed.

title: Baseball Roundup
description: CHICAGO, April 17 (AP)George Mitterwald hit three home runs, one with the bases loaded, and drove in eight runs as the Chicago Cubs routed the Pittsburgh Pirates today, 189. All told, the Cubs hit six home runs in the game and the Pirates hit three.

title: Newsman Arrested
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 17 (UPI)A reporter for The San Francisco Examiner who refused to leave a California Public Utilities Commission meeting yesterday was arrested and charged with disturbing a lawful meeting. The newsman, R. L. Revenaugh, was later set free on $250 bail.

title: Riot Batons to Be Arms For Connecticut Guard
description: HARTFORD, April 17  Connecticut's National Guardsmen will be armed initially only with riot batons in dealing with disturbances, it was disclosed today.

description: The winning New Jersey aily lottery number yesterday

They failedwhen they torch they were using to cut through a steel wall in a visitors booth ran out of oxygen, a correction officer said.

title: Rolling Stones on Screen
description: Ladies and Gentlemen, the Rolling Stones, which opened Tuesday at the Ziegfeld Theater, is a poorly made movie that's immensely enjoyable. Objections first. The audience, which roars invisibly throughout, is almost totally snubbed by the camera. But we want to see the people who heard the Stones' last American tour, to feel their relationship to the musicians, to learn if they look different from the audiences of a few years ago, even to know what they're wearing. And why doesn't the picture include the Madison Square Garden crowd singing Happy Birthday to Mick Jagger?

title: 2 Banks Raise Rates
description: Two more banks have raised their / prime lending rate to top corporate customers. The Union Bank of Los Angeles set a rate of 10 per cent, while the Citizens and Southern National Bank of Atlanta increased its rate to 10 per cent on existing or outstanding borrowings and 10 per cent on renewals and new loans. Detans on Page 61.

title: ALBANY IN DEBATE ON MAIL PRIVILEGE
description: ALBANY, April 17Democrats and Republicans today traded charges of abuse of statepaid mailing privileges for legislators, with one Democratic State Senator stating that her office had been broken into an electioneering materials mailed, perhaps to embarrass her.

title: Rangers Skating on Air After Victory
description: ?? Rangers may look as if they're skating on air at Madison Square Garden tonight as they try to gain their fourth victory in the quarterfinal series with the Montreal Canadiens. They're liable to be high because of the dramatic finish as they scored 32 overtime victory in Montreal Tuesday night.

title: Michigan Populist Jerome Bob Trafler
description: BAY CITY, Mich., April 17 So you want to be a crook, Harry Traxler said to his son.

description: WASHINGTON, April 17 Attorney General William B. Saxbe said today that he believed Patricia Hearst was not a reluctant participant in a San Francisco bank robbery Monday.

title: Mrs. James Beck, Founded Newport Music Carnival
description: NEWPORT, R.I., April 17 Wrs. Mary Ridgely Carter Beck, who in 1956 established the Newport Music Carnival, died yesterday at Plaisance, her Newport estate. She was 72 years old and formerly lived in New York.

title: Parents of Kent Victims Can Sue, High Court Says
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 The, Supreme Court today authorized the parents of three Kent State University students killed by. National Guardsmen in 1970 to sue a former Governor of Ohio and Guard officers for damages.

title: ALBANY IN DEBATE
description: ALBANY, April 17Democrats and Republicans today traded charges of abuse of statepaid mailing privileges for legislators, with one Democratic State Senator stating that her office had been broken into an electioneering materials mailed, perhaps to embarrass her.

description: SOUTH ORANGE, April 17Basketball is still king at Seton Hall University, which has a long tradition in athletics.

title: Latin Officials and Kissinger Open Talks
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 Foreign Ministers of 24 LatinAmerican and Caribbean countries began meeting with Secretary of State Kissinger today.

title: Suspect Uses Wooden Leg To Hang Himself in His Cell
description: An arson suspect used his wooden leg to hang himself in his cell yesterday in the detention pen at the Union Avenue Precinct station in Brooklyn, the police said.

title: U.S. Aide Scores Supervision
description: MILWAUKEE, April 17 (AP) A Justice Department official criticized The Associated Press last night for suspending photographer who gave information about the Indian occupation of Wounded Knee to agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: SOLOMON J. WEINSTEIN
description: Solomon J. Weinstein, a broker and trader on the New York Produce Exchange, died last evening at his home, 2792 Sedgwick Avenue, the Bronx. He was 93 years old.

title: STATE RAISES AID TO RELIEF CLIENTS
description: ALBANY, April 17Governor Wilson today signed into law an 11.8 per cent increase in welfare payments, the first in four years.

title: CITY BAR RECEIVING DATA ON WATERGATE
description: The special Watergate prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, and the Senate Watergate committee are supplying the Bar Association of the City, of New York with a continuing supply of copies of indictments concerning lawyers involved in the Watergate scandal, an association official said last night.

title: Charge of False Research Data Stirs Cancer Scientists at SloanKettering
description: An allegation that a young physicianscientist at the Memorial SloanKettering Cancer Center here falsified patentially important research findings has caused widespread dismay among scientists both in and out of the famed institution.

title: TWO COURTS TO HEAR I.T.U. VIEW ON WRITS
description: Two international representatives of the International Typographical Union are scheduled to be present today when Local 6 seeks to have the courts vacate two injunctions enjoining the local from interfering with operations at The Daily News or The New York Times.

title: 4,000 in Gather in Suffolk to Begin Campaign
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., April 17Smarting from the effects of the Watergate scandal, but determined to display allegiance to their party, more than 4,000 Republicans gathered here tonight in a show of unity to kick off this year's polltical campaign in Suffolk County.

title: Women Unionists: Learning How to Be Heard
description: They had worked all night in post offices around the citysorting, bagging and boxing the mail  and by 9:30 A.M. they were tired. But not too tired to boo when the name of a certain slavedriving supervisor was mentioned.

title: Retailers Accused of Failure To Pass On Drop in Meat Prices
description: Federal consumer official said yesterday that retailers here were not passing along to consumers the full drop in wholesale meat prices.

title: Leavening in Brazil?
description: Brazil's new President, Ernesto Geisel, has allowed something to happen there that should not go unnoticed. He has permitted expiration of a tenyekr ban on political activity, invoked after the 1964 coup by.the military leaders against more than a hundred prominent Brazilian political figuresrincluding three former Presidents.

title: Rhode Island Official Termed Byrne's Choice for School Chief
description: TRENTONDr. Fred G. Byirke, Rhode Island's Commis, sioner of Education, was reported today to be Governor Byrne's choice for Commissioner of Education in New Jersey.

title: Watergate Is C aped Factor In G.O.P. Loss its Michigan
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 Republican and Democratic politicians agreed today that the Watergate scandals had contributed substantially to the Republicans' loss yesterday of Michigan's Eighth Congressional Districta House seat held by Republicans uninterruptedly for 40 years.

title: BLACKS GIVEN AID FOR LAW STUDIES
description: WASHINGTON, April 17  Two New Yorkbased foundations announced today that they Would award grants totaling $1.2million to black law students in the South, whose numbers have sharply increased in the last four years.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ALIENATION Three plays by three foreign, playwrights open in town today. A Candle in the Wind, written several years ago by Alexandr I. Solzhenitsyn, plays from tonight through Saturday at 7:30, in Studio 39 of the Manhattan Theater Club, 321 East 73d Street (2882500). This Englishlanguage version is done by a cast of adozen directed by Michael Howard, who heads the acting department at Juilliard. After, each performance, experts will discuss it. The speaker for tonight is to be announced. Tomorrow, the talkers are Stanley Kauffmann, critic for The New Republic, and Stephen Cohen, head of Princeton's Russian studies. On Saturday, Loren Graham, Columbia historian, and Patricia Blake, of Time.

description: Prices rose for the second consecutive day yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market amid conflicting reports on interest rates.

description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Handicapped in U.S. Seen Getting Limited Education
description: Leading city, state and Federal school officials said yesterday that despite an expansion of educational opportunities for handicapped youngsters, many of the estimated total of seven million schoolage children in the United States with physical and mental handicaps were still inadequately served or not served at all.

title: General Says Israel Was Negligent at Qiryat Shemona
description: TEL AVIV, April 17An Israeli general, a hero of the October war and now an opposition leader in Parliament, charged today that Israel had been negligent in protecting Qiryat Shemona, the northern town that was raided last week by Arab terrorists.

title: Opera
description: Fans of Poulene's Les Mamelles de Tiresiasand there are more than you might guess from the dearth of performances around here will be delighted to learn that a snappy new production of the effervescent work has been mounted by the Manhattan Theater Club and will be on view through April 27.

title: COPPER FABRICATORS CHARGED ON PATENT
description: WASHINGTON, April 17 (UPI) The Justice Department today charged 11 copper fabricating companies and their trade association with violating Federal antitrust laws by conspiring to limit patent rights on a new plumbing system to manufacturers that agree to use copper or copper alloys.

title: Ballet: Sacrifice Ritual
description: Updating myth by providing it with a local habitation is often attempted but seldom wholly successful. Most tries have a certain initial novelty that is intriguing but have less staying power once the parallel is explicity made. Brian Macdonald's The Lottery was moderately successful at bringing the spring sacrifice ritual to the Harkness Theater on Tuesday evening, in its premiere by the Harkness Ballet.

title: D'Busschere Ailing and Needs Rest
description: Dr. Andrew Patterson, the Knicks' doctor, knows DeBusschere needs rest. He says rest is the only cureall for such an injury. but there is no time for it; this is the playoffs.

title: New Treasury Chief
description: William E. Simon, a former Wall Street bond dealer who came to national notice as the Federal energy czar, has been chosen by President Nixon as his fourth Secretary of the Treasury. Perhaps the most significant element about the appointment, however, was that its announcement was made not by the. President himself but by his deputy press secietary, a familiar technique of Presidents unwilling to invest an appointment with undue importance.

title: MAE PROFIT SET FOR AIRMAN AIR
description: American Airlines, Inc., reported yesterday a $1million profit for March  its first monthly profit since Octoberbut announced a $10.5million loss for the first quarter.
