description: Rangers vs. Philadelphia

title: 4 OFFICERS HURT IN PRISON FIGHT
description: Four correction officers were cut and badly bruised last night when 260 unarmed inmates seized control of a wing of the Trenton State Prison following a fight between two inmates drunk on liquor secretly brewed in the prison, officials said.

title: SHOP TALK
description: You mean I can't shop? Joanne Woodward sounded honestly disappointed. She had come to the opening of Bloomingdale's model rooms exhibit with her husband, Paul Newman, Wednesday night after the store closed.

title: Port Transit Funds Pressed in Albany
description: ALBANY, April 25The Republican legislative leadership, acting without the approval of Governor Wilson, agreed today on a measure that would allow the Port Authority to help subsidize mass transit  a move that could mean $100million a year for transit subsidies and capital construction in the metropolitan area.

title: Samara Captures Decathlon
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 25 Fred Samara of the New York Athletic Club dominated the second day and set a meet record today as he captured the Penn Relays decathlon. Samara's total of 7,864 points eclipsed the record set last year by Ron Evans of Connecticut at 7,819.

title: PHILIP STOUGHTON
description: Philip Van Everen Stoughton, a retired consulting chemist, died yesterday after a stroke, He was 74 years old and lived at 45 Gramercy Park North.

title: 3 LARGE AIRLINES COST GAINS IN NET
description: Three of the nation's 11 big trunk airlines, including United Air Lines, the nation's largest, reported sharp earnings gains yesterday for the three months touted March 31.

title: Proclamation in Lisbon
description: LISBON, April 25 (Reuters)Following, as translated by Reuters, is the text of the proclamation issued by the military junta that seized power today in Portugal:

title: 95 IN RELIGIOUS SECT JAILED AS LOITERERS
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., April 25 (UPI)  Ninetyfive members of a traveling Illinois religious sect were jailed yesterday in the wake of a mass roundup at a shopping center, where customers complained of harassment by the revivalists.

title: Dr. Herman M. Sternberg, Orthopedic Surgeon, Dead
description: Dr. Herman Max Sternberg, orthopedic surgeon, died of a cardiac ailment Wednesday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 147 West 79th Street.

title: Store Sales Off 4% in Week
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 The Department of Commerce reported today that departmentstore sales last week fell 4 per cent to an estimated $986million from $1.03billion a year earlier. Total retailstore sales were $10.09billion, off slightly from the yearearlier $10.7billion.

title: Andretti Team Wins at Monza
description: MONZA, Italy, April 25 (UPI)Mario Andretti of Nazareth, Pa., and Arturo Merzario of Italy led Alfa Romeo in sweeping the first three places today in the 1,000 kilometers of Monza auto race, opening the world manufacturers' chmpionshp season. Jacky Ickx of Belgium and Rolf Stommelen of West Germany were second and Carlo Facetti and Andrea De Adamich third.

title: N.B.A. Championship
description: Boston vs. Milwaukee

title: KARPOV WINS, TAKING LEAD OVER SPASSKY
description: MOSCOW, April 25 (AP) Anotoly Karpov, the Soviet chess champion, defeated Boris Spassky in the sixth game of their semifinal Candidates Match in Leningrad to take a twovictoriestoone lead over the former world champion.

title: A Hinterland Plea on Taxes...
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo.For a long time I have been thinking about telling you, Mr. Congressman and Mr. Senator, what your constituents are thinkidgthings you never hear. We want to know how you lire going to cut taxes when you continue to make larger and larger appropriations.

title: DR. ARCFIIE STALLINGS
description: BRYAN, Tex., April 25 (AP) Dr. Archie Stallings, a veterinarian who developed a serum for the treatment of anthrax, primarily a disease of animals, died Tuesday at the age of 80.

title: Times Appoints Schwartz As a Family/Style Editor
description: Jack Schwartz has been named assistant family/style editor by A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor of The New York Times. Joan Whitman is the family style editor.

title: COAST JUDGE BARS MASS QUESTIONING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 25 The San Francisco police acted in violation of the Federal Constitution when they stopped and questioned some 600 young black men in the investigation of 12 random killings, Federal Judge Alfonso J. Zirpoli ruled today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Kissinger's Department : Morale Up, Role Enhanced
description: WASHINGTON, April 25After seven months as Secretary of State, Henry A., Kissinger has succeeded in reviving the morale of the State Department and restoring it to its traditional place at the center of American foreign policy.

title: Biaggi Finds H.E.W. Biased On Bilingual Education Aid
description: I WASHINGTON, April 25 (UPI)  Representative Mario Biaggi, Democrat of the Bronx, accused the United States Health, Education, and Welfare Department today of documented, unforgiyagle discrimination against certain ethnic minorities in funding Federal bilingual education programs.

title: ExNew York Judge Criticizes 2Track ChildPlacement Plan
description: ATLANTIC CITY, April 25 Justine Wise Polier called today for an end to the twotrack system of child placement, which she said parceled out limited facilities to youngsters deemed most likely to succeed and abandoned others to a human scrap heap.

title: State Police Declare Death Of Probasco Girl a Murder
description: WOODSTOWN, April 25 the State police said today that 4yearold Brenda Probasco of West Deptford Township, who was found drowned 15 miles from her home Tuesday, had been murdered.

title: PATRICK A. FEELEY
description: Patrick A. Feeley, treasurer and trustee of the IRI Research Institute at 1 Rockefeller Plaza, which is concerned with agricultural research in underdeveloped nations, died at his office yesterday. His age was 53, and he lived at 205 West End Avenue.

title: Michael Straight, of Arts Fund, Will Marry Mrs. Nina Auchincloss Steers
description: Mrs. Nina Gore Auchindoss Steers, a stepsister of Mrs. Aristotle S. Onassis and a halfsister of Gore Vidal, and Michael Whitney Straight, deputy chairman of the National Endowment of the Arts in Washington, plan to be married here on Wednesday at noon by the Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., Episcopal Bishop or New York, at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.

title: Kissinger's Department: Morale Up, Role Enhanced
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 After seven months as Secretary of State, Henry A. Kissinger has succeeded in reviving the morale of the State Department and restoring it to its traditional place at the center of American foreign policy.

title: Bites Reported on the Increase in City As More People Acquire Watchdogs
description: The fatal attack on a 6yearold Long Island boy by a neighbor's Saint Bernard dog Wednesday has focused on a growing problem in many urban and suburban areas, and especially in New York City, health officials said yesterday.

title: ELVIO H. SADUN, 56, PARASITES EXPERT
description: Dr. Elvio H. Sadun, director of the new International Laboratory for Research on Animal Diseases in Nairobi, Kenya, died of cancer of the liver in Walter Reed Hospital, Washington, on Wednesday. He was 56 years old and lived in Chevy Chase, Md.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: CAR OUTPUT IN WEEK SEEN AS 1973'S HIGH
description: DETROIT, April 25  Domestic auto plants are expected to build 171,422 cars this week, highest weekly total so far this year.

title: American Brands and IngersollRand Report Records as Companies List Sales and Earnings Results
Business Briefs
description: AKRON, Ohio, April 25 (AP)The Firestone Bank in Arkron is paying $1.10 for 100 pennies in an effort to get more of the coins in circulation, a bank spokesman said today.

title: Profits Up 92% for Standard Oil of California and 52% at Shell
description: The Standard Oil Company of California, the fifth largest oil company in the nation, announced firstquarter profits yesterday that increased 92 per cent over results for the first three months of 1973.

title: The Dance: Graham's Night Journey
description: Although difficult to imagine, there are possibly people who choose to go through life without ever seeing the work of Martha Graham. For those who refuse to deny themselves a memorable theatrical experience, the current season by the Martha Graham Dance Company at the Mark Hellinger Theater is offering a crash course in the Graham repertory since 1940.

title: COAST JUDGE BARS MASS QUESTIONING
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 25 The San Francisco police acted in violation of the Federal Constitution when they stopped and questioned some 600 young black men in the investigation of 12 random killings, Federal Judge Alfonso J. Zirpoli ruled today.

title: Rockefeller Honored Here With Four Freedoms Award
description: Former Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller was honored with this year's Four Freedoms award at a banquet last night and praised for his public service in speeches by Mayor Beame, Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. of Connecticut, Governor Byrne of New Jersey and former Gov. W. Averell Harriman, whom Mr. Rockefeller defeated for the office in 1958.

title: About the Mets ...
description: Because they started three lefthanded pitchers in row in San Diego, the Mets saw little of the Padres' highpriced winter trade talent: Willie McCovey, Matty Alou and Bob Tolan. They saw nothing of a fourth imported player, Glen Beckert, who is on the disabled list with arthritis the ankle... Enzo Hernandez, the Padres' shortstop, has been on his own in most situations while stealing bases against the Mets, says Manager John McNamara, himself an import from the San Francisco Giants.

title: Israelis Are Subdued On 26th Anniversary
description: JERUSALEM, April 25Israelis celebrated the 26th anniversary of their independence today in a subdued and reflective mood that contrasted sharply with the selfconfidence and exuberance of a year ago.

title: Retests on Reading Urged To Correct Abuses Here
description: A confidential staff report to the Board of Education has proposed that 30,000 city pupils, selected at random, be retested this term to make up for abuses in the citywide reading tests given earlier this month.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Showed Rise During Week
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials edged up to 231.4 from 231.0 last week.

title: An Aide to Brandt Is Arrested as a Spy
description: BONN, April 25An aide of Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany was arrested last night on suspicion of being a spy for East Germany.

title: Searetti Fights Disbarment
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 25 (UPI)Donald H. Segretti, who served a six month sentence for distributing fraudulent campaign material, has asked the Caliofrnia Supreme Court temporarily to halt disbarment proceedings based on hisn testimony before the Senate Watergate Committee and statements he made in Washington, as evidence against him. He asked for the halt because he had been granted immunity from his Watergate testimony.

title: Dance: Sleeping Beauty
description: On important aspect of Rudolf Nureyev's staging of The Sleeping Beauty, to be seen with the National Ballet of Canada at the Metropolitan Opera House, is the amplitude and grandeur of the settings and costumes. This is not merely the most intelligent and sensitive of stagings, but the designs of Nicholas Georgiadis also have true sweep and magnificence. Wednesday night it was the turn of Veronica Tennant to dance Aurora, partnered, of course, by Mr. Nureyev who appears at almost every performance with the Canadians in New York.

title: Suspect in Rail Threat Held
description: AMARILLO, Tex., April 25 (UPI)Robert Wallace Knight of Amarillo was charged yesterday with attempting to extort $150,000 from the Santa Fe Railroad by threatening to wreck its Los AngelestoChicago trains.

title: Sticks and Names Break Flyers' Streak
description: Flashing their machismo, Ranger players and Ranger fans were beaming by the end of last nights brawlfilled Stanley Cup semifinal game against the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: HARRIET DAVIS DIES; WRITER AND EDITOR
description: Mrs. Harriet Eager Davis, a writer and editor for 50 years, died Wednesday at the Glenside Nursing Home in New Providence, N. J. She was 82 years old and formerly lived in Southold, L. I., and Hlghtstown, N. J.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: Chicago vs. Toronto

title: Richard Huelsenbeck, Helped To Start Dadaist Movement
description: LOCARNO, Switzerland, April 24 (Reuters)Richard Huelsenbeck, a Germanborn physician, writer and psychoanalyst who helped begin the Dadaist literary and artistic movement during World War I, died Saturday at Minusio near here after a long illness. He was 81 years old.

title: Sawhill Says Fuel Overcharges May Total Over $100Million
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 (UPI)John C. Sawhill said today that United States fuel distributors might have overcharged customers by more than $100million during the energy crisis.

title: Nixon Democrat Gives Up F.C.C. Bid
description: WASHINGTON, April 25A Federal official nominated by President Nixon to one of the Democratic seats on the Federal Communications Commission asked today that his name be withdrawn from consideration after it was disclosed he had offered to use his office to help reelect Mr. Nixon.

title: Poetry Society Awards Prizes to 25 at Dinner
description: Twentyfive poets among hundreds who with their guests, attended the annual dinner of the Poetry Society of America at the Plaza Hotel last night had special reason for rejoicing. They were the 1974 winners of the society's prizes.

title: B. B. King Gives a Blues Lesson
description: Although there was nothing conventionally academic about the setting, the more than 700 Harlem schoolchildren who wriggled happily in their seatsat the Apollo Theater yesterday were receiving a pointed lesson in music appreciation. The subject was the blues, and the teacher was the legendary blues vocalist and guitarist B, B. King.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: Utah vs. Indiana

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
description: April 25, 1974

title: CORRECTION
description: Lieut. John J. Egan, a former commander of the Police Department's special investigating unit for narcotics who is now under Federal indictment for allegedly seizing proceeds from illicit narcotics sales, was incorrectly identified yesterday as the hero of the film The French Connection. The central character in the movie was based on former Detective Edward R. Egan, who was a member of the Police Department's narcotics division.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and index, Page 39

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: GOUNG OUT Guide
description: DUKE Edward Kennedy Ellington will be 75 years old Monday, and celebrations will abound. Tonight a number of musicians will romp through Ellingtonia, playing wellknown and lesserknown compositions. Sy Oliver will conduct the New York Jazz Repertory Company. And the Bob Wilber Ensemble, Stanley Cowell and other artists including Ellington alumni will also take part in the concert at Carnegie Hall (CI 77459), at Seventh Avenue and 57th Street. Tickets for the 8 P.M. event are priced from $3,50 to $7.50.

title: Kuh Drops Case Against Duryea, Calling for State Bill to Bar Dirty Tricks in Campaigns
description: District Attorney Richard H. Kuh of Manhattan yesterday dropped an electionfraud case against Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea, but called on the Legislature and Governor Wilson to enact a new law to bar campaign dirty tricks such as those Mr. Duryea and five Republican colleagues were charged with.

title: PAKIST AN REQUESTS EASING OF U.S. DEBT
description: WASHINGTON, April 25  The Pakistani Finance Minister wound up two days of talks with Nixon Administration officials today after having requested the easiest terms possible for repaying $1.87billion in debts to the United States.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: WILLCOX & GIBBS A??al Meeting of Shareholders will be held on April 26th (WGAMEX)Advt.

title: Company Disputes City Finding On Tank That Set Off Gas Blast
description: A Brooklyn company conceded yesterday that it had worked without a plumbing license or a city permit when it installed four waterpressure tanks at the site of Monday's gas explosion near the United Nations. But the company and the Fire Department differed on whether a tank that ruptured, setting off the blast, was a part of that installation.

title: Democrats Admit Facing Delay In Extending Curbs on Prices
description: WASHINGTON, April 25Democrats in Congress con ceded today that they coup not get extension of limited pricewage controls throug Congress before the schedule expiration of controls at mid night Tuesday.

title: A. & P. Reports a Profit Exceeding Predictions
description: The Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Company, which operates more food supermarkets than any other American chain, yesterday reported a return to profitability in both its fiscal year and final quarter ended Feb. 23. The 3,680store chain said it had net income in the quarter of $12,497,000, or 50 cents a share, against a loss of $1,258,000 in the like quarter the year before.

title: People in Sports
description: The Atlanta Hawks have been discussing a possible trade with New Orleans, the latest expansion club in the National Basketball Association. But there may be a major hitch in the deal. Pete Maravich, the player to be traded, may not go along with the transaction and Pistol Pete has a notradewithoutapproval clause in his Hawks' contract. Maravich, who just finished the fourth season of a fiveseason contract with the Hawks at $300,000 a year, is very distressed, according to his at torney, Lester Zittrain. Pat Williams, general manager of the Hawks, indicated the trade would take place if Pistol Pete eventually agreed to it.

title: ...And a Reform Plan
description: WASHINGTON  Public opinion in this country rates President, Nixon at an alltime low. Yet the voters rate the Congress even lower. Is it disillusionment resulting from a general atmosphere of distrust that we have come to label Watergate? Will public disillusionment disappear if the Congress remains resolute and we discover once and for all the truth of the President's involvement or noninvolvement in the Watergate affair? Will an impeachment trial eliminate public disappointment and dismay?

title: Most Active Stocks
description: Thursday, April 25, 1974

title: Advertising: Foley Looks Ahead
description: If I were asked to choose today one single year out of all the others, to have it cast in a crystal star for permanent adoration, I very much doubt that I would choose 1974, at least not on the basis of the first few innings, Paul Foley said yesterday, adding But the full game is yet to be played.

title: Little Italy Is Restive as Chinatown Expands
description: For 50 years, Little Italy and Chinatown enjoyed a colorful, peaceful, but highly unorthodox coexistence, like wontons in minestrone.

title: Legislature Passes SchoolAid Package
description: ALBANY, April 25  The State Legislature approved a $307million schoolaid package late tonight that includes an additional $78.5million for New York City as well as significant increases for suburban school districts.

title: FOX FILM FILES SUIT ON MERRICK
description: The Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation yesterday accused David Merrick, the Broadway producer, of a conspiracy to obtain control of the company by use of illegel, improper, deceptive and fraudulent acts.

title: FARES TO RISE 50c ON AIRPORT BUSES
description: An increase of 50 cents in the fares on Carey Transportation buses from midtown Manhattan to Kennedy International and La Guardia Airports was, voted by the Board of Estimate yesterday, effective next Wednesday.

title: JOSEPH BILLIK
description: Joseph Billik, a director and former president of William Grant & Sons, Inc., a liquor importer, died at Kennedy Airport on Tuesday evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was returning from Glasgow, headquarters of William Grant & Sons, Ltd., of Glasgow, the parent company. He was 66 years old and lived at 4300 Broadway.

title: Senate Votes for Raritan Canal Park
description: TRENTON, April 25  At the urging of state environmental groups, the Senate unanimously approved a measure today that would create a 60milepark along the Delaware and Raritan Canal.

title: U,S. AGENCY ENDS SECRET OIL TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 The United States Geological Survey has agreed to discontinue its practice of privately consulting a committee of oil industry representatves before establishing regulations for offshore drilling on the continental shelf of the United States.

title: INQUIRY IN MARYLAND WIDENED, PAPER SAYS
description: BALTIMORE, April 25 (UPI) A Federal inquiry into Maryland political corruption that led to the resignation of Spiro T. Agnew as Vice President and of his successor in a county post now includes two friends of Gov. Marvin Mandel and one of Mr. Agnew's strongest supporters, a Baltimore newspaper reported today.

title: People and Business
description: On Monday, Louis E. Fischer will become president and chief executive officer of the General Development Corporation, a builder of communities in Florida. The post had been vacant for the last few months.

title: France's Election Battle
description: Rapidly and unexpectedly, the Presidential campaign in France has opened the possibility of a fundamental change in the country's political future. After sixteen years of oneman and oneparty domination under General de Gaulle and his successor President. Pompidou, a serious double challenge to continued Gaullist rule has been mounted from left and right.

title: Screen
description: DREAMS AND NIGHTMARES, a documentary written and directed by Abe Osheroff; produced and edited by Larry Klingman; distributed by New Yorker Films. Running, time: 60 minutes.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
Energy Crisis is Called A Symptom of Problems
description: New mechanisms and methods must be developed to deal with emerging world rawmaterial problems such as the ienergy crisis, several promnent international politicians and businessmen suggested yesterday.

title: Rhodesia Uneasy About Coup Effects For Mozambique
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, April 25 (UPI)Military and Government sources in Mozambique, the Portuguese controlled territory, reported today that people there were very excited about reports from Lisbon of a military coup.

title: EMMY VOTE IS LED BY JANE PITTMAN
description: LOS ANGELES, April 25 (AP)The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman, tracing the life of a black woman from slavery to civil rights, received 12 television Emmy nominations today.

title: Port Transit Funds Pressed in Albany
description: ALBANY, April 25The Republican legislative leadership, acting without the approval of Governor Wilson, agreed today on a measure that would allow the Port Authority to help subsidize mass transit  a move that could mean $100million a year for transit subsidies and capital construction in the metropolitan area.

title: Norton Simon Offers Collection, Financing to Pasadena Museum
description: LOS ANGELES, April 25Norton Simon, the industrialist, has offered to place much of his renowned art collection, including such masterpieces as Raphael's Madonna and Child, in the Pasadena Museum of Modern Art, according to a museum source.

title: HYLAND DISPUTES SUMMONS QUOTA
description: TRENTON, April 25  A spokesman for the State Attorney General, William F. Hyland, said tonight that his office had received no information on whether New Jersey state troopers had begun reducing the number of traffic summonses they issue to motorists on the state's highways.

title: Red Smith
description: People named Pincay and Shoemaker and Baeza are going to be in the news for a while because now comes Kentucky Derby time, when America gets interested in racehorses and the little men who ride them for a living. Joe Alexander sides horses for a living, too, but without saddle, stirrups, reins or any of the rapport a jockey like Bill Shoemaker sometimes enjoys with his mount. The horses Joe Alexander rides have only one aim in life and that is to pitch Joe Alexander into the last row of the bleachers on his head. As the reader may have deduced, Joe is a bareback rider in rodeo. More accurately, Joe is the bareback rider in rodeo, on his way to becoming the bareback rider of all human and equine history.

title: RODINO'S INQUIRY WILL SEND NIXON QUERIES ON TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, April 25  The House Judiciary Committee is preparing to send written questions to President Nixon to determine if criminal fraud was involved in the President's Federal income tax returns for 1969 through 1972.

title: Market Place: Losses Occur Despite S.I.P.C.
description: It is a familiar story for followers of the affairs of customers of the bankrupt Weis Securities, Inc., and it emphasizes once again that the Federal legislation passed in 1970 to protect the investing public is inadequate at best.

title: Koosman Gets 3d Victory As Mets Notch 4th, 52
description: SAN DIEGO, April 25Jerry Koosman restored a bit of sanity to the mad world of the New York Mets tonight when he pitched and batted them to a 52 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: DEATH OF GIRL, 4, RULED A MURDER
description: WOODSTOWN, N. J., April 25  The state police said today that 4yearold Brenda Probasco of West Deptford Township, who was found drowned 15 miles from her home Tuesday, had been murdered.

title: Meskill Expected to Sign
description: HARTFORD, April 25Both houses of the Connecticut General Assembly have voted overwhelmingly to regulate campaign contributions and spend. ing and, by narrower margins, to prohibit campaign contributions by labor organizations, business and civic associations and all other standing institutions except party political committees.

title: Kissinger And Jackson
description: WASHINGTON, April 25  The KissingerJackson row over how, to negotiate a strategic military arms agreement with the Soviet Union illustrates what happens here when a President loses the confidence of the people and politicians begin scrambling to succeed him.

title: Penn Relays Open Today With Field of Fast Stars
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 25  Steve Williams of San Diego State says he has been saving himself this spring for the races that really count.

title: Campaign Controls Voted In Jersey and Connecticut
description: TRENTON, April 25A bitterly contested measure providing for the public financing of gubernatorial campaigns in New Jersey as well as limitations on private contributions won approval today in the State Senate.

title: Kennedy, Ending Visit to Soviet, Reaffirms TradeEmigration Tie
description: MOSCOW, April 25Senator Edward M. Kennedy ended a sixday visit here today after a postmidnight meeting with a group of Jews who have been seeking unsuccessfully to emigrate to Israel.

title: Buzhardt Asserts He Opposed Criminal Action in Spying Case
description: WASHINGTON, April 25 J. Fred Buzhardt, general counsel of the Pentagon, told the Senate firmed Services Committee in testimony taken nearly two months ago that he had recommended against any criminal prosecutions in the military spying incident involving the White House and Pentagon in late 1971.

title: Indianapolis Tempest Mars Unalloyed Boosterism
description: INDIANAPOLIS  This city's boosters  and there are lots of them heremake George Babbitt sound like a pessimist.

title: CenterRight Coalition Cabinet Is Inaugurated by Belgian King
description: BRUSSELS, April 25A new Belgian Cabinet, a minority coalition of centrists and conservatives, was sworn in by King Baudouin today.

title: About the Yankees ...
description: Bobby Murcer missed yesterday's game with a strained back muscle but hopes to play tonight when the Yankees open a fourgame series with Texas... Graig Nettles had his runsbattedin streak stopped at 10 games, grounding out three times .... Paul Splittorff allowed just two hits, then bad to leave in the eighth inning with a blister on the middle finger of his pitching hand.... Roy White on Splittorff: He doesn't give you much to hit. He doesn't put the ball over the middle of the plate so you can hit on the fat part of the bat. ... Fritz Peterson on Fritz Peterson, who allowed three hits in three innings of relief: I felt like a high school kid out there. But at least I wasn't shaking like I was in Cleveland. ... The Yankee's only run came on Lou Piniella's double, a ground out and Thurman Munson's sacrifice fly.... Peterson and Pat Dobson have shaved their mustaches. Snake got tired of trimming his, Peterson said, and mine was just too ugly.

title: PORTUGAL'S ARMY SEIZES CONTROL AND PROCLAIMS DEMOCRATIC GOAL; CAETANO'S SURRENDER ANNOUNCED
description: LISBON, Friday, April 26A group of army officers, proclaiming a desire to bring democracy to Portugal and peace to her African territories, seized control of the country, yesterday and announced the end of more than 40 years of authoritarian rule.

title: RODINO'S INQUIRY WILL SEND NIXON QUERIES ON TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, April 25  The House Judiciary Committee is preparing to send written questions to President Nixon to determine if criminal fraud was involved in the President's Federal income tax returns for 1969 through 1972.

title: JOSEPH BOURGHOLTZER
description: Joseph Benedict Bourgholtzer, founder and president of a pharmaceutical advertising company in Mahwah, N. J., bearing his name, died yesterday at Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern, N. Y. His age was 55, and he lived in Mahwah.

title: Campaign Controls Voted In Jersey and Connecticut
description: TRENTON, April 25A bitterly contested measure providing for the public financing of gubernatorial campaigns in New Jersey as well as limitations on private contributions won approval today in the State Senate.

title: Music: Recent Rochberg
description: George Rochberg, once a composer  la mode in the strict serial manner, began having heretical thoughts about a decade ago. His recent works, two of which were performed at the Concord String Quartet's concert in Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday night, have shocked some believers in musical progress by the composer's return to traditional tonality and apparent attempt to solve today's esthetic problems with yesterday's formulas.

title: Nine Football Rules Amended by Pros To Enliven Games
description: Sweeping rules changes were made yesterday in an effort to enliven the National Football League games. Not since 1933 has the sport been so drastically altered.

title: Lisbon Paper Reports Freedom From Censor
description: LISBON, April 25 (UPI)The newspaper Republica announced to its readers today that it was publishing without censorship for the first time.

title: Uncommitted Hold Key in France
description: PARIS, April 24The result of the coming presidential election is expected to turn, as usual, on two million to three million uncommitted votersabout 10 per cent of the electorate. These are the votes for which the three major candidates are really fighting, and the polls show them still undecided.

title: Again the Executioner
description: In approving a return to the death penalty, the State Assembly combined retrogression with deception. To gather support for the measure, its sponsors limited its mandatory application to the willful murder of onduty peace officers or prison guards. But they openly boasted that, once enacted in its limited form, the law could readily be extended next year to cover a broader area of violent crimes.

title: Scenting Victory, Many Democrats File For Congressional Primary Elections
description: TRENTON, April 25  Ar unusually large number of New Jersey Democrats, many of them eager to exploit the Watergate scandal, crowded the State House here today to meet a 4 o'clock filing deadline for candidates in Congressional primary elections.

title: New M.T.A. Chief Favors Dropping Curbs on Port Unit
description: David L. Yunich, newly designated chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, said yesterday that he favored repeal of the restrictive bistate cvenants that have barred the Prt Authrity f New Yrk and New Jersey from using its huge resources to invest in rail transit projects.

title: The Fed's Lonely Fight
description: Chairman Burns and his associates in the Federal Reserve Board are seeking to make clear to the world that they intend to bring United States inflation under control. That is the meaning of the Fed's action in raising the discount rate  the rate which it charges member banks short of funds to a record 8 per cent.

title: TV Review
description: Tonight at 9 o'clock CBS News is presenting a twohour exhibition of Four Portraits in Black, profiles of four black families who have achieved a measure of financial independence in that nebulous bracket labeled middle income. The program revives a concept that CBS News used in 1968 for an Of Black America series, which combined several reports and private polls.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: Chicago vs. Toronto

title: Overturn in Portugal
description: Idealistic Portuguese Army officers, determined to restore democracy at home and peace to the African territories, appear to have succeededon their second attempt in five weeksin overthrowing Premier Marcello Caetano's authoritarian Government. The Movement of the Armed Forces, as the rebel force calls itself, promises to govern the country only until elections can be held for an assembly that will write a new, democratic Constitution.

title: Declaration to Waldheim Urges Nations to Promote Birth Control
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 25A declaration stressing the urgency of world food and population problems was presented to, Secretary General Waldheim today. The document speaks of the responsibility of governments to provide their peoples with birth control information and equipment.

title: ExOfficial of Newark Jailed on Tax Charge
description: NEWARK, April 25 (UPI) A Federal judge today sentenced Louis M. Turco, former Newark City Council President to one year in prison on tax charges stemming from Mr. Turco's gambling debts.

title: Farah to Reopen Plant
description: EL PASO. April 25 (UPI)  The Farah Manufacturing Company will reopen one of its San Antonio plants within a few weeks, William F. Farah, the concern's president, said yesterday.

title: Pacers Win To Square Series, 33
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., April 25 (AP)The Indiana Pacers built a 15point lead, then held off a desperate Utah, rally and beat the Stars, 9189 tonight to tie their American Basketball Association West Division playoff at 33. George McGinnis led the Pacers with 23 points.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW SHARP DROP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market fell sharply yesterday in continued light trading.

title: Judge Denies Dismissal at Racing Trial
description: A defense motion to dismiss the racefixing indictments against 13 harness drivers and nine codefendants was denied yesterday in Brooklyn Federal Court by Judge Orrin G. Judd.

title: Open Interest
description: (In bushels, 000 omitted)

title: Allin's Lead at 4 Shots
description: CARLSBAD, Calif., April 26Little Bud Allin, who insists he's no big deal and plays golf one stroke at a time, increased his lead to four strokes today in in elite field of 25 golfers as the 22d annual Tournament of Champions reached its halfway point.

title: A.B.A. Sues to Stop AllStar Game
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 26 (UPI)  The American Basketball Association filed a suit today asking that a temporary restraining order be granted that would prevent a proposed allstar game from being played here May 18.

title: Ohio Valley Plans Basketball Playoff
description: MURRAY, Ky., April 26 (UPI)The Ohio Valley conference established today a postseason basketball tournament, matching the league's top four finishers, to determine its future representatives in the National Collegiate Tournament. The conference scheduled the first postseason tourney for Nashville, next March 7 and 8.

title: 16,000 in Chicago Are Forced From Homes by Chemical Fog
description: CHICAGO, April 26 (UPI)A fivemilelong, halfmile wide cloud of fumes spread over Chicago's Far South Side today. The police said at least 16,000 persons had been told to leave their homes.

title: Krumpe Out As President Of N.Y.R.A.
description: Declaring that his job was no longer any fun, John H. (Jack) Krumpe resigned yesterday as president of the New York Racing Association.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices of wheat and soybean futures dropped sharply on the Midwest commodity exchanges yesterday, while the nearby corn deliveries were bid up a few cents a bushel.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary, end Index, Page 33

title: TIM SPENCER, BEGAN SONS OF PIONEERS
description: VICTORVILLE, Calif. (UPI)Tim Spencer, originator of the Western singing group, the Sons of the Pioneers, died today at a convalescent hospital. He was 65 years old.

title: MitchellStans Jury Asks for Don Nixon Memorandum
description: What has been called the Don Nixon memorandum throughout the 45day MitchellStans trial was the first official document the jury asked to review yesterdayits first full day of deliberations.

title: ExAide Says Haldeman Controlled 3d Cash Fund
description: WASHINGTON, April 26A third cash fund controlled by H. R. Haldeman when he was White House Chief of Staffconsisting of a twoinchthick stack of $20 and $100 billshas come to light in testimony released today in a Watergate civil suit.

title: Understating of Oil Prof its Alleged by Some Analysts
description: Profits reported by major oil companies for the first quarter have shown increases averaging nearly 80 per cent from a year ago, but some analysts estimate that they may be much higher.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Up
description: WASHINGTON, April 26The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.6 billion tonmiles, 3.8 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same period totaled 520,276 cars, 1.7 per cent above last year.

title: Transsexual Denied Divorce as Marriage Is Held to Be Illegal
description: A woman who underwent surgery two years ago to become a man and then married and later sought a divorce, charging abandonment by the wife, was denied the divorce yesterday on the ground that the marriage was illegal.

title: U.N. Agency to Give Food to African Insurgents
description: UNITED NATIONS, April 26 The World Food Program, an arm of the United Nations, has decided to make food aid available to peoples in the liberated areas in the colonial territories of Africa and their national libberatlon movements, it was a nounced here today.

title: San Francisco Police Plan To Appeal Search Order
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 26 (UPI)  The San Francisco Police Department said today it would appeal a Federal court order forbidding the city's massive stopandsearch operation in the socalled Zebra killings.

title: Payment of Full Wage Urged To Waiters and Waitresses
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI) Representative Mario Biaggi, Democrat of the Bronx, said today that he would propose legislation next week designed to guarantee a full minimum wage to waiters and waitresses.

title: Rehoboth Beach Is Sprucing Up For Influx of Washingtonians
description: REHOBOTH BEACH, Del., April 21The other morning, just as Jerry Ward and his family drove past the city limits sign, a gaggle of geese flapped out of town in the opposite direction, headed north toward Canada. It was a mere coincidence, this almost perfectly synchronized arrival and departure, but it was also a rather striking reminder of the essential role that the migratory habits of man and bird have come to play in the life of this tiny seaside resort.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs Rangers vs. Philadelphia
description: April 20Phila. 4, Rangers 0.

title: Villanova Again ins Distance Medley at Penn Relays
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26 A passenger in a dark car. spotted Eamonn Coghlan in the familiar blue Villanova sweatsuit warming up outside of Franklin Field for the distance medley relay today.

title: U.S. and Common Market Get Time to End Dispute
description: GENEVA, April 26  The United States and the European Economic Community received an additional two months today in which to settle their differences over the damage done to American exports by the entry of Britain, Denmarg and Ireland into the European bloc.

title: Average Salary of a U.S. Professor Is $17,810
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) The salary of the average college professor rose to $17,810 in the current academic year, but faculty members lost ground economically, the American Association of University Professors reported today.

title: Strings and Tones Show Dance Style Of Harlem Theater
description: The Dance Theater of Harlem presented John Taras's Design for Strings and Arthur Mitchell's Tones on Thursday at the ANTA Theater. It was an evening of fascination to watch the company smoothly shift dance gears between pieces like these and Le Corsaire and Dougla."

title: Understating of Oil Profits Alleged by Some Analysts
description: Profits reported by major oil companies for the first quarter have shown increases averaging nearly 80 per cent from a year Imo, but some analysts estimate, that they may be much higher.

title: Jaworski Opposes Bid to Disqualify Sirica in Watergate Trial
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 The special prosecutor, Leon Jaworski, strongly defended Judge John J. Sirica today against charges of bias and prejudice in the Watergate coverup case.

title: For U.S. Initiatives to Repair Relations With Europe
description: WASHINGTONThe grand design of President John F. Kennedy, revealed in a notable speech in Philadelphia in 1962, envisioned an increasingly united European community linked inexorably with the United States by the bond of Atlantic partnership. The popular, illustrative name applied was dumbbell, describing a large sphere, Europe, connected by a bar of steel with an equal sphere, the United States. What has happened to this concept? Does it provide a feasible basis for our relations with Europe?

title: Trade Balance in Deficit First Time in 9 Months
description: WASHINGTON, April. 26 The United States's balance of trade slipped into a deficit position in March for the first time in nine months, the Census Bureau reported today. The major contributing factor was the sharp increase in the price of imported oil.

title: Four Records Bettered At 65th Drake Relays
Art Valued at $20Million Stolen From Irish Mansion
description: BLESSINGTON, Ireland, Saturday, April 27A gang of armed art thieves directed by a young woman raided the mansion of a goldmining millionaire here late last night, tied up everyone in the house and got away with masterpieces valued by the police at $20.4million.

title: People in Sports
description: Refusing to hang up his sneakers after the recent season of limited action, Jerry West signed a longterm contract yesterday with the Los Angeles Lakers that will assure him of playing at least one more (his 15th) season with the National Basketball Association team. There are not set years involved in the contract, said Allan Rothenberg, the Lakers' attorney. It's openended and for as long as Jerry wants to play, with some provisions for beign with the Lakers after his playing days ale over.

title: Hyland Splits With Byrne on Proposal For Referendum on Statewide Casinos
description: TRENTON, April 26State Attorney General William F. Hyland openly broke with Governor Byrne today over a proposed voter referendum on statewide casino gambling in New Jersey.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI)The Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today that member thrift institutions gained $1.8billion in deposits in March despite a rapid outflow of savings at month's end. Except for the unusually high rate of withdrawals in late March, the net gain would have exceeded $2billion for only the second time in 14 months, an official said.

title: AGENCY THAT AIDED EXCLERGY HALTS
description: Bearings for ReEstablishment, an agency established eight years ago to help former priests and nuns make the transition to secular life, has ceased operation.

title: Campus Notes
description: Avanti BCC is the code name for an onthestreet college recruitment program to be conducted in the FordhamBelmont section of the Bronx.

title: WALTER LOGAN, BARKER, 85, DIES
description: Walter S, Logan, general counsel and vice president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York from 1928 to 1953, died Thursday in Washington, Conn., where he lived. His age was 85.

title: Strings and Tones' Show Dance Style Of Harlem Theater
description: The Dance Theater of Harlem presented John Taras's Design for Strings and Arthur Mitchell's Tones on Thursday at the ANTA Theater. It was an evening of fascination to watch the company smoothly shift dance gears between pieces like these and Le Corsaire and Dougla.

title: Reforms to Improve Working Life
description: WASHINGTON  The thesis of Work in America, the muchdiscussed report of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare, is that substantial numbers of American workers find their jobs barren of meaning and often intolerable. The report suggests that work must be reformed so that it will produce greater satisfaction, and increased production is the foremost key to how to abate inflation.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: Boy Jumping From City Bus Is Killed by Car Behind
description: A 7yearold Brooklyn boy hitching on the rear on a Transit Authority bus was killed when he jumped off and then was struck by a car, about a block from his home in the BedfordStuyvesant section.

title: Portugal's Empire
description: From the hot, dusty town of Tete, on the banks of the Zambezi River, truckloads of Portuguese soldiers lurch into the Mozambique countryside at least twice a day looking for guerrillas or running convoys of men and equipment the 70 miles up to the construction site of the huge Cabora Bassa Dam.

title: NIXON IS EXPECTED TO ASK PUBLIC AID IN TAPES DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, April 26President Nixon will reportedly seek public support next week for a decision to give the House Judiciary Committee transcripts rather than tape recordings of Watergaterelated conversations subpoenaed for the impeachment inquiry.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, N, J., April 26Gary Kilpatrick, Princeton University's lightweight crew coach, works hard make sure that his oarsmen never rest. Now in his second year as varsity coach, he is putting the Princeton crew through a training regimen that is tougher than ever, the lightweights prepare to defend their position at the top of Eastern rowing.

title: Stock Average Gains as Trading Slows
Tower's Window Panes To Cost $6Million
description: BOSTON, April 26, (AP)It will cost approximately $6 million to replace the 10,344 window panes in the new 60inch story John Hancock Tower, officials say.

title: Senate Aides Urge White House Curbs To Prevent Abuses
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI) Senate investigators have concluded that excessive secrecy and concentration of power in the Presidency gave rise to the Watergate scandal, and they have drafted recommendations to drastically diffuse that power as a safeguard against any recurrence.

title: Trenton Prison Is Shifting 83 In First Step of Closing It Down
description: NEWARK, April 26Representative Henry Helstoski, Democrat of the Ninth District, testified briefly today before a Federal grand jury investigating allegations that he accepted payoffs for sponsoring special immigration bills to protect aliens from deportation.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times yesterday about the First National City Bank's analysis of firstquarter profits incorrectly reported that profits were lower than in the preceding quarter. It should have said that firstquarter profits were 2 per cent higher than in the fourth quarter of 1973.

title: Bridge: A HighCard Hand Brings Problems if Partner Bids
description: A player with 23 highcard points who hears his partner open the bidding has four courses or action open to him: he can faint right away, suffering from shock; he can look suspiciously at his partner, suspecting a psychic; he can bid a majestic seven notrump, or he can look for a sensible way of confirming his belief that a grand slam is there for the taking.

title: Understating of Oil Profits Alleged by Some Analysts
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 John C. Sawhill, the new head of the Federal Energy Office, said today that the agency was reviewing its standard for determining how much an international oil company can charge itself for imports of its own crude oil.

title: Superpower Games In Egypt
description: WITH THE EGYPTIAN THIRD ARMYThe helicopter that brought me to Egypt's Third Army was a Russian MI8. The major artillery pieces are Russian 122 and 155millimeter guns. The standard armor comprises Russian T55 and T62 tanks. The infantry's principal automatic weapon is the Russian Kalashnikov.

title: Canadian Postal Walkout Ends But Pay Negotiations Continue
description: OTTAWA, April 26Striking Canadian postal workers returned to their jobs today, ending a walkout that had virtually paralyzed mail service throughout the country for nearly two weeks.

title: The Dance
description: The current Martha Graham season at the Mark Hellinger Theater has beer particularly interesting not only for the number of works that have been revived from the Graham repertory, but also equally for the number of dancers assuming new roles, either for the first time in New York or the first time in their careers.

title: SIMON IS BACKED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (UPI) The Senate Finance Committee voted unanimously today in favor of the nomination of William E. Simon as new Secretary of the Treasury. The full Senate is expected to confirm him next week.

title: Anne Wilson Wed in Jersey
description: Miss Anne Wilson, daughter of Mrs. Henry Mayer Wilson of Madison, N. J., and the late Mr. Wilson, was married yesterday evening to Pfc. John Robert Custer, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Joseph Custer of New Providence, N.J.

title: Cairo Said to Hold 75 in Conspiracy To Depose Sadat
description: CAIRO, April 26 (AP)Egyptian security authorities have arrested 75 persons, including 16 military cadets and two sailors, in an alleged plot to overthrow President Anwar elSadat, Cairo newspapers reported today.

title: Chile Is Said to Doom 5 On ArmsTraining Charge
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, April 26Five civilians were tried secretly yesterday and sentenced to death by an army courtmartial in San Fernando, a farming center about 80 miles south of here, according to church sources.

title: Miss Wade Gains Net Semifinal
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26 Virginia Wade, Britain's newly named Federation Cup captain, advanced to the semifinal round of the $50,000 Virginia Slims of Philadelphia tennis tournament tonight. She overcame a chalienge by Glynis Coles of London to win, 46, 61, 64 at the Palestra.

title: AFRICAN REBELS VOW TO PUSH WAR
description: The military takeover in Portugal by officers committed to peace in the country's three African territories was greeted yesterday by guerrilla pledges to step up efforts against the authorities in Portuguese Guinea and Angola.

title: U.S. Blocks '70 Mississippi Law As Unfair to Black Eectorate
description: WASHINGTON, April 26 (AP) The Justice Department today rejected Mississippi's proposed open primary law on grounds that it would discriminate against black voters.

title: Fire in Astoria Synagogue Follows BreakIn by Boys
description: A fire that authorities called: Isuspicious damaged the basement of a synagogue in Astoria, Queens, yesterday afternoon, Iabout two hours after a group of teenagers were reported to., have broken into the building and committed acts of vandal ism. No one was injured.

title: MILITARY LEADER IN LISBON PLEDGES ELECTIONS IN YEAR
description: LISBON, April 26The general who assumed the leadership of Portugal yesterday after the swift military coup said today that a provisional government of civilians headed by a military man would be formed in three weeks. He promised general elections in one year.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Gen. Antonio de Spinola, who assumed the leadership of Portugal after Thursday's swift military coup, said that a provisional governeminent of civilians headed by a military man would be formed in three weeks. He promised general elections in one year. [1:1.]

title: Curbs on Inflation Elude Brazil in Economic Goals
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 26Brazil's new administration has fixed a goal for continued rapid economic growth but has been unable to set a goal limiting inflation in the face of high oil prices.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Yanks Win, Trade 4 Pitchers
description: A sevenman trade between the Yankees and Cleveland Indians, announced moments after New York had defeated the Texas. Rangers, 43, at Shea Stadium last night, created an air of shock in the Yanks' dressing room.

title: BALI CRASH SPURS INQUIRY ON PH AM
description: The Federal Aviation Administration ordered an emergency, indepth inspection of the worldwide flight operations of Pan American World Airways yesterday, following the crash of a Pan American Boeing 707 on Bali, in Indonesia, on Monday. It was the fourth crash of a Pan Am 707 within nine months.

title: A Fire at Fontainebleau
description: MIAMI BEACH, April 26 (UPI)A fire today damaged several rooms of the Fontainebleau Hotel and filled the upper floors with smoke.

title: EMIL SADY, 57, DIES; IN U.N. SECRETARIAT
description: Emil J. Sady, deputy director of the Public Administration Division of the United Nations Secretariat, collapsed and died while playing tennis last Saturday in HastingsonHudson, N. Y., where he lived. He was 57 years old.

title: Unmet Duty
description: The decision of District Attorney Kuh to drop election fraud charges against Assembly Speaker Duryea makes no less reprehensible the deceptive political practices on which the charges were based.

title: Drawings by Schiele and Klint Shown at 2 Galleries
description: Among the artists who were active in Vienna in the first part of this century it is Egon Schiele who has lately had most attention. A Schiele drawing is unmistakable, for one thing. For another, there are a great many of them. And, as Henry James once said in quite another context, he does not shirk the demonstrative matter; when his attention turns to the female body, as it does very often, there is an emphasis on entrances and exits that even today stands out for its forthright

title: Mrs. Streit Wins Golf By 5 and 3
description: PINEHURST, N. C., April 26 (AP)Mrs. Marlene Stewart Streit shot oneunderpar golf to defeat Mrs. Nancy Roth Syms, 5 and 3, today. It was her second North and South amateur tournament victory.

title: Miss Wade Gains Net Semifinal
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26 Virginia waae, Britain's newly named Federation Cup captain, advanced to the semifinal round of the $50,000 Virginia Slims of Philadelphia tennis tournament tonight. She overcame a challenge by Glynis Coles of London to win, 46, 61, 6.4 at the Palestra.

title: Illinois Sues on Pollution
description: CHICAGO, April 26 (UPI)Attorney General William J. Scott of Illinois filed today suit in United States District Court to prevent the Government from further polluting Lake Michigan at its Fort Sheridan Army post.

title: Maurice Bernhardt, 74, Dies; State Justice and Jewish Leader
description: Justice Maurice Bernhardt of the State Supreme Court for the Second District, which includes the Counties of Kings and Richmond, died yesterday in Long Island Jewish Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 13904 Rockaway Beach Boulevard, Belle Harbor, Queens.

title: Kissinger Says Diplomacy Is Not Used for Politics
description: WASHINGTON, April 26Secretary of State Kissinger strongly defended the Administration's foreign policy today against any suggestion that President Nixon was trying to manipulate it for domestic political advantage.

title: Samuel J. Friedman Dies; Theater Press Agent, 62
description: Samuel J. Friedman, who over the years has done publicity for many major Broadday producers, died yesterday, apparently of heart failure, in Beth Israel Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey, daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE

title: SolarHeat Complex Sought
description: AMHERST, Mass., April 26 (AP)  The Zoning Board of Appeals here has been asked to approve a $3million solarheated businessresidential complex. Plans call for a restaurant, theater, shops and 20 condominiums, all under one large roof designed to capture enough solar energy to provide 85 per cent of the heating needed in winter.

title: Duryea Asks More for Arts As Senate Doubles Budget
description: ALBANY, April 26 The State Senate has voted to double the current budget for the State Council on the Arts, and Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea said today that he favored an even larger increase.

title: 10 Hurt in Texas Tornado
description: PECOS, Tex., April 26 (AP) Four persons were hospitalized today when a tornado struck trailer park here. Six others were treated and released.

title: Books of The Times
description: TALLEYRAND: The Art of Survival. By Jean Orieux. Translated from the French by Patricia Wolf. 677 Pages. Illustrated. Alfred A. Knopf. $12.95.

title: WINE TALK
description: Here is a recapitulation of last week's wine quiz with, hopefully, the correct answers.

title: Mrs. Donnelly Wed. To Me H. Gregory
description: The Unitarian Church of All Souls was the setting here yesterday evening for the marriage of Mrs. Sandy Farwell Donnelly of New York, daughter of Mrs. Frederick Marcus Farwell of Montrose, Ala., and the late Mr. Farwell, to Michael Hewes Gregory of Montclair, N.J., and Washington. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Walter D. Kring.

title: MRS. THOMAS J. KEARNS
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., April 26Mrs. Elizabeth R. Kearns, an elementaryschool teacher whose career spaned 66 years, died today in Nassau Hospital, Minneola. She was 88 years old, and lived at 26 Hamilton Place here.

title: Dangerous Trifles
description: It could have been boredom more than any meaningful policy change that led United States representatives this week to accept a shabby and onesided United Nations Security Council resolution condemning Israel in strident terms but dancing away from any similarly explicit condemnation of wanton Arab terrorists. The resolution is empty anyway, the Washington reasoning apparently went, so it was hardly worth fighting over. Such cynicism merely debases further U.N. usefulness as an instrument for peace in the Middle East.

title: Town's Little League Reluctantly Signs 3 Girls
description: UNION, N.J., April 26 They've been playing Little League baseball in this modest, suburban town for 21 years.

title: Ronan Leaving M.T.A. With a Lot of Believers
description: In the late nineteensixties, when you could cut the enmity between Long Island Rail Road passengers and the conductors with a knife, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority took a survey. The M.T.A., which owns the railroad, discovered that the average trainman's job was his third choice as an occupation.

title: Questionable Bill on City Taxing Passes the State Senate, 533
description: ALBANY, April 26A bill that was frankly drafted to allow the state's cities to evade for another year the legal limit on their taxing power passed the State Senate today after debate in which even the bill's sponsor conceded that it was of dubious constitutionality.

title: West Texas Fires Battled
description: BALMORHEA, Tex., April 26 (UPI) Firefighters from the Texas Forest Service joined ranchers in fighting fires that have burned more than 128,000 acres on the Davis Mountains in West Texas.

title: Regents Table Clark's Integration Plan
description: ALBANY, April 26  Asserting that it had no power to supersede a local school board, the State Board of Regents today tabled a propo$al by Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, its lone black member, to establish special commission to desegregate the. New York City school system.

title: ETHIOPIAN UNITS MUTINY IN CAPITAL
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, April 26Units of Ethiopia's Army in Addis Ababa and police commandos staged mutinies here today, military sources said tonight.

title: NEW FILM EXAMINES MOZAMBIQUE ISSUES
description: A film dealing with revolutionary activities in Mozambique, which feature prominently in the pageone news on Portugal, is included in the new screen program showing through Wednesday at the Whitney Museum of American Art.

title: Fonda Still in Hospital
description: Henry Fonda, who collapsed Tuesday with what physicians called total exhaustion, was not released from Lenox Hill Hospital as expected yesterday because of a worsening of his condition. Mr. Fonda collapsed after a performance of his oneman show, Clarence narrow, at the Helen Hayes Theater. Al hospital administrator said late yesterday that the 68yearold actor would remain several more days until control of his heart rhythm was gained.

title: Franklin's Grave Damaged
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 26 (AP)Bronze plaques marking the graves of nine historical figures, including Benjamin Franklin and his wife, Deborah, have been stolen from the Christ Church burial grounds here, the police said yesterday. The police said the plaques, valued collectively at $2,000 had probably been removed by collectors.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Gen. Antnio de Spinola, who assumed the leadership of Portugal after Thursday's swift military coup, said that a provisional governernment of civilians headed by a military man would be formed in three weeks. He promised general elections in one year. [1:1.]

title: Director Resigns In Apparent Split At RapidAmerican
description: Harry H. Wachtel, a longtime member of the board of directors of the RapidAmerican Corporation, has resigned in an apparent dispute with the consumergoods conglomerate's flamboyant chairman, Mcshulam Riklis.

title: Aaron Slams Way to Another Record
description: Henry Aaron, the major league's career homer run king, broke another record last night when he hit the 15th grand slam of his 21year career. Aaron's homer was his sixth of the season and No. 719 lifetime.

title: WILSON CAUTIOUS ON STATE ISSUES
description: ALBANY, April 26Governor Wilson dealt cautiously with the remaining issues before the Legislature today, offering few details of his position on such questions as help for the New York City budget, rent control and Port Authority bonds.

title: NO CAUSE FOUND FOR DOG'S ATTACK
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., April 26 Suffolk County's Chief Medical Examiner said today that we will never know why St. Bernard dog attacked and killed a 6yearold boy last Wednesday in East Islip.

title: Mutual Fund Share Offer
description: American General Reserve Fund, Inc., a newlyorganized mutual fund that will invest in moneymarket securities, has registered 2 million common shares to be offered at an initial price of $25 per share. The investment adviser is the Channing Management Corporation.

title: Contract Awards
description: The AM General Corporation, a unit of the Amer ican Motors Corporation, has received a $20.4million addition to an Army contract for production 2ton trucks. The contract calls for an additional 2,334 trucks and raises the total number of the sixwheel drive units to be built by AM General to 7,929 with a total value of $91.2million.

title: Blast in Phnom Penh Kills 5, Hurts 15 at Wedding Party
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 26 (UPI)A hand grenade was thrown Into a wedding reception last night attended by Premier Long Boret, killing five persons and wounding 15. Government sources said. The Premier was not injured.

title: Test Today Will Whittle Derby Field
description: The 100th running of the Kentucky Derby next Saturday promises to attract more than a score of entrants, matter of concern to Lynn Stone, Churchill Downs president. The Churchill Downs meeting will start tomorrow, with the Stepping Stone purse as one of the main attractions. This race, too, will have a comparatively big field, with 13 named on the overnight list.

title: SALT and Watergate
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson accuses President Nixon of seeking to offset his Watergate troubles by rushing into a quickfix strategic arms agreement at June's summit meeting in Moscow.

title: Body in Air Crash Found
description: ELKTON, Va., April 26 (AP) The body of Norman Hortman of New Hope, Pa., was recovered last night from the wreckage of his twinengine plane, which crashed in the Blue Ridge Mountains, a Civil Air Patrol spokesman said. The body of Norman Hortman of New Hope, Pa., was recovered last night from the wreckage of his twinengine plane, which crashed in the Blue Ridge Mountains, a Civil Air Patrol spokesman said.

description: A.B.A. Playoffs

title: 2 BLACKS EXPLAIN AID TO IMPERIALE
description: NewarkNearly seven years ago during the riots here, State Senator Anthony Imperiale achieved a certain kind of public recognition as Newark's white militant challenger to black militants.

title: People and Business
description: Harry Holiday has been named president of the Armco Steel Corporation, effective May 1. C. William Verity, chairman and chief executive officer, filled the post temporarily following the retirement of Donald E. Reichelderfer on March 31 at the age of 65.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: hairloser

description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Museum Takes Simon Offer
description: LOS ANGELES, April 26The trustees of the Pasadena Museum of Modern Art agreed today to place much of Norton Simon's art collection in the museum. In return the Norton Simon Foundation and the Norton Simon, Inc. Museum of Art will assume the museum's debts and acquire a significant voice on its board or trustees. The museum will resume its former name, the Pasadena Museum. of Art.

title: LATE CITY EDITION,
description: Weather: Sunny, mild today; mild tonight. Sunny and warm tomorrow: Temp. range: today 48.68; Friday 4767. Additional details on Page 62.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: Los AngelesBilly Lloyd, 160 pounds, Philadelphia knocked out Zovek Barajas, 149, Mexico, 4 rounds.

title: G. M. ANNOUNCES 85% PROFIT DROP
description: DETROIT, April 26The General Motors Corporation announced today that its earnings for the first quarter of 1974 declined by 85 per cent from the 1973 first quarter.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times yesterday about the First National City Bank's analysis of firstquarter profits incorrectly reported that profits were lower than in the preceding quarter. It should have said that firstquarter profits were 2 per cent higher than in the fourth quarter of 1973.

title: National League LAST NIGHT'S GAMES
description: New York 6, San Francisco 0.

title: Permissive Maryland
description: Informed that two close political associates are under Federal investigation for corruption, Maryland's Democratic Governor Marvin Mandel said: If you are going to take anyone who comes under investigation and automatically make them criminals, then I think our whole system has gone to pot.

title: SOVIET CHARGES TURKS AID KURDS Sees Imperialist Forces Behind Rebels in Iraq
description: MOSCOW, April 26  The Soviet press, in its first major reaction to fighting in northern Iraq, has accused Turkey of arming and abetting Kurdish rebels against the Iraqi Government.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The gasoline shortage cost New Jersey almost $6million in lost tax revenues, it was reported. The state's Tax Director, Sidney Glaser, said unofficial figures showed that motorfuel tax income was down more than 8 per cent for December, January and February. This loss of revenue is a direct result of the energy crisis, he said.

title: CHARLES J. NOURSE, LAW PARTNER, DIES
description: Charles J. Nourse, retired senior partner in the law firm of Winthrop, Stimson, Putnam & Roberts, 40 Wall Street, died Thursday at his home, 115 East 167th Street. He was 86 years old and also lived at Oyster Bay, L. I.

The M.T.A., which owns the railroad, discovered that the average trainman's job was his third choice as an occupation.

title: West Texas Fires Battled
description: BALMORHEA, Tex., April 26 (UPI)  Firefighters from the Texas Forest Service joined ranchers in fighting fires that have burned more than 128,000 acres on the Davis Mountains in West Texas.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., April 26 (UPI)  The American Basketball Association filed a suit today asking that a temporary restraining order be granted that would prevent a proposed allstar game from being played here May 18.

title: STOCKS MOVE UP ON AMEX AND OTC
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market closed with small gains yesterday in slower trading.

title: NIXON IS EXPECTED TO ASK PUBLIC AID IN TAPES DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, April 26President Nixon will reportedly seek public support next week for a decision to give the House Judiciary Committee transcripts rather than tape recordings of Watergaterelated conversations subpoenaed for the impeachment inquiry.

title: STANS TIED TO PLEA FOR ILLEGAL FUNDS
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., April 26 (AP)  The WinstonSalem Journal said today that the chairman of the Wachovia Corporation had confirmed that Maurice H. Stans unsuccessfully solicited an illegal $45,000 contribution from the bankholding corporation in October 1972.
