description: St. Barnabas Episcopal Church in Greenwich, Conn., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Susan Kent King to Albert Stickney 3d. The Rev. Howard Bassage performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Mellick Belshaw.

title: 23 Plots of Federal Land Given for Recreation Use
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP) The White House has announced that 23 parcels of Federal land in 14 states are being turned over to local, county or state control for park and recreation use.

title: JOHN J. M'CALLEN
description: John J. McCallen, a patent attorney, died on Friday night, apparently of a heart attack, while on his Way home. He was 41 years old and lived at 35 Mayfair Drive, Huntington, L. I.

title: Ailey Dancers on May 5
description: In today's Arts and Leisure Section, the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater is erroneously listed as appearing at the Church of the Holy Apostles this afternoon. The listing should have said that the Alvin Ailey Dancers, a workshop group affiliated with the Alvin Ailey American Dance Center, would appear next Sunday at the church, which is at Ninth Avenue and 28th Street, at 3 P.M.

title: New U.S. History Textbooks Putting Stress On Minorities Contribution to Building Nation
description: Look, son I understand why you're inpatient. I was, too, at your age. But you have to remember what things were like then when was a boy in order to see how much better they are now.

title: CIIEMICAL PERIL EASED IN CHICAGO
description: CHICAGO, April 27 (UPI)A cloud of caustic fumes cause?? by a leak at a chemical storag?? plant broke up and drifted to ward Lake Michigan today while w rkere tried to seal the leak.

title: Yonkers to Seek Outside Renewal Aid
description: The city of Yonkers has decided to seek outside help, forgoing its own Department of Development, in a new bid to attract private industry to the blighted Getty Square and waterfront areas.

title: Princeton Defeats Columbia in Tennis
description: Princeton dealt a blow to Columbia's hopes for a third consecutive Eastern Intercollegiate Tennis Association championship by defeating the Lions, 63, yesterday in a meeting of unbeaten league teams at Baker Field.

title: Labor Is Delta's Key to Profits
PERRY A. PEPPER
description: Perry A. Pepper, an aeronautical research scientist with the Edo Corporation of College Point, Queens, which deals with equipment for marine and airborne devices and crafts, died Friday of a heart attack at his home,. 5, Woileys Lane East, Great Neck, L.I. His age was 58.

title: A German view of a German villain
description: Adolf Hitler was a brave soldier in World War I, but he was never promoted to the ranks of noncommissioned officers because, according to the subsequent testimony of the regimental adjutant, we could discover no leadership qualities in him. It was not an entirely unreasonable judgment. Until the age of 30, he never made a single speech and didn't even belong to any political party. When he finally ventured into politics, he made several bad miscalculations and ended in Landsberg prison, where the warden wrote of him: He is easily content, modest and desirous to please. Makes no demands, is quiet and sensible, serious and quite without aggressiveness. By the time this muchmisunderstood man finally destroyed himself just after his 56th birthday, he had fulfilled his own prediction that we will carry half the world into destruction with us. Yet our understanding of the destroyer has not advanced very far beyond that day in 1930 when Hitler, on hearing that various critics were investigating his origins, nervously told an associate: These people must not be allowed to find out who I am.

title: Letter to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A master opportunist
description: Talleyrand is almost unbeatable as a subject for biography. He said of himself, For forty years I was the most morally discredited man in Europe, yet I was allpowerful in government, or on the threshold of it. He had a career which drew him into an astonishing variety of occupationsrevoluh, Lion, diplomacy, religion, speculation, gambling: he knew most of the great beauties of his day, as well as all the important men. He influenced events as few individuals have, for he was not just the partisan of one cause, but served every regime in power, and was honored and listened to by governments of totally opposed complexion.

title: Dr. Marjorie Schramm Is Married
description: In the Old Chapel of Central Moravian Church in Bethlehem, Pa., yesterday, Dr. Marjorie Elizabeth Schramm, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Frank Ernest Schramm Jr. of Bethlehem and St. Croix, V.I., became the bride of Dr. George Winston AranaCisneros.

title: KARPOV AND SPASSKY DRAW SEVENTH GAME
description: MOSCOW, April 27 (AP)Anatoly Karpov and Boris Spassky agreed to a draw today without resuming play in the seventh; game of their world chess challengers' semifinal match.

title: Saigon Keeping Vietcong Team Isolated
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 27For the third straight week, the Saigon Government today kept the Vietcong's military delegation here cut off from the outside world and prevented it from holding its customary Saturday news conference.

title: Milwaukee Awaits Start Of N.B.A. Title Playoffs
description: MILWAUKEE, April 27Gentlemen, dribble your basketballs. Set your picks. And don't forget to hit the open man. It's time for the Big Matchup.

title: Prison Official in Illinois Halts Malaria Research on Inmates
description: CHICAGO, April 27  The Illinois Department of Corrections has ordered an end to all malaria experiments on inmates at the Stateville Penitentiary after 29 years of research.

title: Fashion: An alternative to pants
description: There is something new under the sun. Well, new again is more like it. The longer skirt. This time around it's not a big investment, so enjoy your whimsy. Who knows? Skirts may replace pants.

title: College Recruiting: The Odyssey of One Student
description: Recruiting will change your life, my father cautioned as I boarded the plane to visit My first college.

title: State Seeks Funds For Bicycle Trails
description: TRENTON  New Jersey is making a belated effort to get Federal funds this year to construct bicycle trails in the state.

title: Letters to the Editor Newark Airport, Ann Klein's Role
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Woman, 93, Dies in Fire
description: A 93yearold woman died of smoke inhalation early yesterday in a twoalarm blaze in her Sbuth Bronx apartment, fire officials reported. She was identified as Elvira Agosto of 938 East 163d Street. Firemen found Mrs. Agosto unconscious lon the floor of the apartment she shared with her 67yearold laughter.

title: KaiserPermanente is a good legacy of the Great Depression Health maintenance: It works
description: In the Depression year of 1933, having just finished his surgeon's residency in southern California, Dr. Sidney Garfield decided to look for work in the middle of the Mojave Desert, near a large construction project where some 5,000 men were digging a canal to bring water from the Colorado River to Los Angeles. I went out there as a feeforservice doctor, but I soon discovered that I couldn't make a living that way, particularly since the insurance companies were taking all of the onthejob accident cases to hospitals in Los Angeles. So he persuaded the insurance companies to prepay him 5 cents a day per worker for industrial medical care, and then he talked the construction firms into offering the workers a voluntary 5centsaday payroll deduction for general medical services. These per capita funds enabled him to hire four other doctors and to operate four small field hospitals which followed the workers the desert.

title: Photo Art Show Chronicles the 60's
description: PRINCETON  An exhibition of the work of Danny Lyon, a young photographer, and a painting by Jim Dine, the pop artist, are sharing the honors at the Princeton University. Art Museum this month.

title: Buzz Off, Melissa
description: DUSSYCATS CAN GO FAR (Atco SD 7044), Buzzy Linhart's latest album, makes one wonder if this singersongwriter isn't actually a creation of the National Lampoon. His lyrics are so fatuous, his voice so flat and his ego so boundless that he seems to be parodying contemporary pop music.

title: Price of War and Peace
description: SUEZ, EgyptThe dazzling success of U.S.Egyptian policy during the past six months exposes Washington and its new friend, President Anwar elSadat, to popular disillusionment in this part of the world and to Soviet retribution unless diplomatic achievements are rapidly followed up by economic support.

title: Boy Killed by Dog Is Buried In Simple Rite in Bay Shore
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., April 27With dozens of mourners weeping softly, 6yearold Lawrence Calemmo was buried here today.

title: Passaic DinnerTheater Presents OffBroadway
description: PASSAIC  Dinnertheaters have become a familiar part of the American scene in recent years. Normally, they are huge places that offer a fullcourse dinner followed by a Broadway musical. However, the Cafe Theater at 320 Monroe Street adds a modest new dimension to the traditional dinnertheater: intimacy and OffBroadway musicals.

title: The Complete Fairy Tales and Stories
description: Anyone glancing at Books in Print, where there are 64 listings under Hans Christian Andersen, might wonder if still another volume of the celebrated storyteller's work is really needed. Yet, eight of the entries are versions of The Emperor's New Clothes, six of them are The Ugly Duckling and the existing collections tend to include only the bestknown Andersen. Not since Jean Hersholt translated 168 stories for The Complete Andersen in 1948 has anyone really attempted an inclusive collection of the Andersen tales, famous and obscure, charming and tedious, and the Hersholt work is out of print.

title: Uncoded Discharge Papers Are Offered to Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI)  The Defense Depart ment announced today that veterans may obtain new discharge papers on request that will omit the controversial number codes indicating the reason why they were discharged.

title: Art Show Planned At Polish Festival
description: HOLMDELAn art exhibit and sale will be held during the third annual Polish Cultural Festival at the Garden State Arts Center June 2.

title: Charles Overtakes Min At 209 for OneShot Lead
description: CARLSBAD, Calif., April 27 The field, and those tough last three holes on the LaCosta Country Club golf course, caught up with Brian (Buddy) Allin today and set the stage for a stampede like finish for the 22d annual Tournament of Champions tomorrow. It will be televised nationally at 4:30 P.M., New York time.

title: Legend and mythmaker
description: Our historians, wrote Macaulay in a famous essay in the Edinburgh Review for 1828, miserably neglect the art of narration, the art of interesting the affection. That is why histories of great empires lie unread on the shelves of ostentatious libraries, while, at the appearance of a new biography by a Voltaire, a Boswell, a Southey, the circulating libraries are mobbed; the book societies are in commotion; the new novel lies uncut; the magazines and newspapers fill their columns with extracts.

title: Lady Love, $10, Wins Top Flight by Two Lengths
description: Ada L. Rice's Lady Love, the 4yearold daughter of Dr. Fager who had never been able to win a stakes event, finally turned the trick yesterday by capturing the $55,200 Top Flight Handicap by two lengths at Aqueduct. the head of the sevenhorse

title: BurglarResistant Door Sought
description: WASHINGTON, April 27The Federal Government thinks that most burglars wander around a neighborhood or an apartment building and kick, pry or hammer at the doors until a flimsy one springs open.

title: ExGreek Aide to Face Trial
description: ATHENS, April 27 (Reuters) Greece's military  backed 1 Government today said it will prosecute 44 people, including Michael Balopoulos, a former Under Secretary of Commerce, for mismanagement of public funds.

title: An Assessment Of Ervin & Co.: Pathfinders
description: WASHINGTONLate next month the Senate Watergate committee will quietly go out of business. It will have led a brief but spectacular life, a life of glamor and drudgery, of success and failure, a life that began when the Watergate storm was a speck on the horizon and ended with the impeachment of the President in sight.

title: Christine A. Johnson Betrothed To Jeffrey Tallackson, a Lawyer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Larrabee M. Johnson of Neto Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Christine Ann Johnson, to Jeffrey S. Tallackson, son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Robert Tallackson of Oak Ridge, Tenn.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayNewton, Sussex County Fair and Show Grounds, Branchville, N.J. Regular, green, junior, and adult amateur working hunters; open, junior and pony jumpers; pony hunters, equitation. 8 A.M.

title: Mr. Wilson Is Promoting Unity
description: LONDONWhen the Cabinet of the new Labor Government meets at 10 Downing Street, the atmosphere is informal, members address each other by first names rather than the traditional Mr. Secretary or Mr. Chancellor.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: John L. Dowling, senior vice president of Cushman & Wakefield, Inc., has been named Manhattan's Most Ingenious Broker of the Year for 1973 by the Real Estate Board of New York.

title: Congressman and 2 L. I. Officials Are Going on Trial Tomorrow
description: MINEOLA, L.I., April 27 Representative Angelo D. Roncallo and two Oyster Bay officials are scheduled to go on trial Monday on charges of extortion in an alleged kickback scheme involving a company doing business with the town.

title: Pollution Problem Continues Along Jersey Coast
description: SANDY HOOK, N.J.  Even though the cost of pleasure boating is going up faster than the cost of necessities, predictions are for the usual heavy power and sail traffic in 1974 from Raritan and Sandy Hook Bays down the North Jersey coast to Manasquan and Barnegat Inlets and beyond.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Rising interest rates played havoc with the stock market last week. Stock prices dropped sharply in more active trading.

title: SEARS TESTIMONY STUDIED BY JURY
description: The jury in the MitchellStans trial, in the third day of deliberations, spent at least part of yesterday wrestling with the problem of whether John N. Mitchell has committed perjury.

title: Here Comes May
description: April thins away and here comes May. There is no question about what time it is by the clock of the year. It is spring, no longer a promise but now a performance, well along in its first act. The maples have started bloom, and the shadblow is frothy with flowers. The haze of undergrowthgreen in the woodland is spreading upward into the trees. There is a pasteldelicate mixture of pale green and pink and yellow in the birches and the poplars.

title: Martin Makes Fast Exit; Tidrow Makes Fast Debut
description: Dick Tidrow, one of three new Yankees traded to New York from Cleveland late Friday night, made an impressive debut in a longterm relief stint yesterday at Shea Stadium.

title: Television
description: THERE is a tendency among seriousminded people to laugh or shrug about television commercials. It is said that they are silly and exaggerated little dramas, of minor consequence. But I wonder. TV commercials clearly illuminate commonly held and accepted ideas about the role of women in our society. John Kenneth Galbraith, the economist, says, in few other matters has the economic system been so successful in establishing values and moulding resulting behavior to its needs as in the shaping of a womanly attitude and behavior.

title: College Schedules Energy Workshop
description: EDISONThe Divisions of Continuing Education and Science at Middlesex County College will be the sponsors of an Energy Workshop here next Saturday. The program, which will begin at 8:30 A.M., will be held in the College Center.

title: Floating on the Thames Is One Way of Drinking In London
description: THE great age of the Thames as the main street of London began in 1676 when the city was practically brand new, having been almost completely, rebuilt after be Great Fire 10 years before, and this age carried right through the 18th century. Since that time, however, the appearance of docks, warehouses and embankments carrying roadways have somewhat hidden this thoroughfare from Londoners. Yet a new appreciation of the old Thames has lately been awakened, for now the river can be viewed by landlubbers not only from the vantage points of riverside tavern balconies but also from several boats, some operational, some anchored in one spot, that serve as floating bars, restaurants and even discotheques. These craft use the busy river with its traffic, ornate bridges and London skyline a backdrop.

title: He Dreamed of Floating Islands
description: THE major artist is the one who carries within himself, and eventually makes visible, the whole history of the human race. As an ambition, it's colossal; but someone who got within striking distance of it was Robert Smithson, who Was killed in a plane crash in July of last year while prospecting above the site of his Amarillo Ramp in what is called the Texas Panhandle.

title: Paula Brakeley Bride Of Robert B. Snyder
description: Miss Paula Winter Brakeley and Robert Bruce Snyder of Coventry, Conn., were married yesterday afternoon in the Storrs (Conn.) Congregational Church by the Rev. James P. Tudesco.

title: 43 KNOWN DEAD IN PERU SLIDES
description: LIMA, Peru, April 27 (AP)Fortythree people were confirmed dead tonight in southern Peru in the aftermath of a strong earth tremor and huge landslides.

title: Public Can Explore 60Room Mansion
description: BERNARDSVILLE  Upton Pyne, a 60room, turnofthecentury mansion on a 200acre wooded estate here, will be open to the public from May 6 to June 2.

title: New Look for Trenton Show
description: You can't keep a good show down. Trenton, which in 1972 had the largest dog event in America, only to slip to third place last year, has roared back. I'm delighted to say that we have 3,997 dogs, said Mrs. James A. Gribbin, serving her third term as club president. We were concerned with the energy crisis and so were doubly surprised with the tremendous response from the fanciers.

title: Ships Watch for Balloonist
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP)  Pentagon officials said today that there had been no reported sighting of a missing transAtlantic balloonist for more than six weeks, but they had not closed the case. Elements of the Navy and the Coast Guard are under instructions to watch for any trace of Thomas L. Gatch and his balloon, last in contact by radio on Feb. 19. Mr. Gatch, an Army Reserve colonel from Virginia, took off from Harrisburg, Pa., on Feb. 18.

title: The Caribia Bowing Out On Last Sail
description: The liner Caribia, formerly the Caronia of the Cunard Lines, left New York Harbor it the end of a towline yesterday, bound for a scrapyard in Taiwan.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The Yankees and the Oakland A's, neither of whom ended up with Dick Williams as manager this season, will meet in Shea Stadium Tuesday night at 8 and Wednesday at 2 P.M. as the New Yorkers wind up a sevenday home stint.

title: Knee Surgery for Briles
description: KANSAS CITY, April 27 (UPI)Nelson Briles, a pitcher for the Kansas City Royals, was placed on the 60day disabled list today. Briles, whose wonlost record is 01 this season, will undergo surgery on his right knee for torn cartilage Wednesday, He will be eligible to return to the active roster June 22.

title: Brooklyn and Queens Colleges Called Defkients on Minorities
description: Two institutions in the City University system  Brooklyn and Queens Colleges  have been cited by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare for deficiencies in their employment policies involving members of minority groups and women.

title: 113 Setback Dims Met Revival
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 27 Satisfied that Toni Seaver was alive and well, the New York Mets got down to less cosmic matters today and took an 113 lacing from the San Francisco Giants.

title: Red Smith
description: Jerry Quarry moved in with a sudden headfeint and dug a left hook into the body of the sparring partner, who flinched and backed away. Time! Gil Clancy said. The sparring partner's distress was obvious as he left the ring. Just got out of the hospital the other day, he said. Three broken ribs. I shouldn't be in there, but I got to get in shape. He is a sports light heavyweight who fights as Cassius Clay Jr., square name Frank White. As he talked, a great big guy named Raoul Garosito got in with Quarry. He is a former amateur champion from Argentina. Watch this, Clancy said. Jerry couldn't unload on the other guy.

title: Ships Watch for Balloonist
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP)  Pentagon officials said today that there had been no reported sighting of a missing transAtlantic balloonist for more than six weeks, but they had not closed the case. Elements of the Navy and the Coast Guard are under instructions to watch for any trace of Thomas L. Gatch and his balloon last in contact by radio on Feb. 19. Mr. Gatch, an Army Reserve colonel from Virginia, took off from Harrisburg, Pa., on Feb. 18.

title: The Khrushchev Tapes Provide a Rare Archive for Scholarly Research on Contemporary Soviet History
description: American scholars will soon have available for intimate and detailed study more than 800,000 words of reminiscences recorded on tape by Nikita S. Khrushchev in the final years of his life.

title: The lives of old people
description: In 1964 Mary Adelaide Mendelson began a 10year search into the incredibly lucrative nursing home industry. Her original goal was to improve nursing homes in Cleveland and the state of Ohioto investigate and prevent the horrors taking place by reforming state regulations and increasing payments to nursing home patients. Mrs. Mendelson quickly moved from her original reformist innocence; her experiences with the operators of nursing homes forced her to question the feasibility of any reform measures. That abuses existed was easily proved; trying to find someone who cared enough to change things was another matter. Mrs. Mendelson states her purpose changed to something radically different, to a determination to document and expose a national scandal in which greedy nursing home operators are getting rich by exploiting helpless patients and extracting huge sums from governments  state and Federalthat do not seem to care about the patients or the taxpayer.

title: Conesaba, $46.20, Triumphs in Garden State Feature
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., April 27 (AP)  Conesaba came from off the pace to beat Hasty Tudor by 4 lengths today In the $27,150 Cavalcade Handicap at Garden State Park.

title: CONGRESS FARES BADLY IN SURVEY
description: More voters disapprove of the way President Nixon is doing his job than disapprove of Congress; and more approve of Congress than of the President; the latest Gallup Poll indicates.

title: Peggy Howard Grants
description: WELLESLEY, Mass., April 27 (AP)Mr. and Mrs. Gordon E. Howard of Alexandria, Va., have donated an undisclosed sum to established the Peggy Howard grants in economics, Wellesley College announced.

title: Library Is Offering Poetry Anthology
description: PATERSON  Subtleties, Transparencies and Sounds, an anthology of poetry by winners of the William Carlos Williams Poetry Center's second annual contest, is now available without charge. Individuals, libraries or organizations wishing to obtain a copy can do so by writing to Joan Stahl, Poetry Coordinator, Paterson Free Public Library, 250 Broadway, Paterson 07501, or by visiting the library personally.

title: Ideas & Trends Education, Psychology, Archeology
description: Say behavior modification and many people will think Clockwork Orange: Malcolm McDowell strapped into a chair, eyes taped open, forced to undergo unspeakable experiences and ultimately emerging as a vegetable. But to the growing number of behavior therapists, this image is violently aversiveand grossly misleading.

title: The Rockefeller Problem
description: Once again, Nelson Rockefeller is apparently a candidate for President. And once again, as he roams across the country trying to convince the Republican faithful that he is worthy of their trustand as he revs up the engine for what has been called his vehicle for getting the Republican nomination, the $6.5million Commission on Critical Choices for Americans the problem central to a candidacy is being ignored.

title: AROUND THE
description: Buy full supply of vegetable and annual seed needed for entire growing season. Stocks are usually depleted or gone by midsummer.... It is early to set out tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers or to plant corn or limas. Wait until mid to late May... Finish planting trees, shrubs end evergreens. . . . Spray roses with benlate as a black spot preventive... Start tuberous begonias and ealadiums indoors... Prune forsythia and quince.

title: Drivers' Fans Give Allison's Crew Tough Problem
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., April 27First of all, a very shaken Bobby Allison wants it known, the shooting began after members of his pit crew left Cathy's Place, two to go to Wilkes County General Hospital, Durihg the shooting, R. T. Staley, the owner of Cathy's Place, was killed and two other men injured. Auto racing is taken very seriously in Wilkes County, N. C.

title: Javits Will Propose Curbs On Powers of Presidency
description: Asserting that the power of the Presidency, has pyramided to nearly that of a monarch, Senator Jacob K. Javits said yesterday that he would introduce legislation aimed at restoring a balance of power between the executive and legislative branches of governments.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Salmon Woes Tides Around New York
description: The Atlantic salmon's survival is again being threatened by Denmark, says Richard A. Buck, chairman of Restoration of the Atlantic Salmon in America, Inc.

title: Russia Finds. an Unexpected Ace in Oil
description: POINT OF VIES

title: Pa  Tooey! Tobacco Chewers Rise in Baseball
description: Steve Hamilton almost choked on a wad as big as a baseball when he learned that Jack McKeon, the young manager of the Kansas City Royals, mixed bubble gum with his chewing tobacco.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Long after the shooting stops in this country's major wars, reminders of the battles crop up in the capital markets when states raise funds to pay veterans' benefits. So it is that Ohio is coming to the market next month with a $125million issue of Vietnam Conflict Compensation Bons.

title: In Their Dream House, Music Becomes a Means of Meditation
description: THOSE who feel that the term avantgarde is still appropriate for works by Boulez or Carter or Schuller or Crumb are probably in for a rude awakening if they attend any of the performances by LaMonte Young and Marian Zazeela and their Theatre of Eternal Music this week. Not that the music these artists will present in their Dream House is particularly harsh or hard to take. In fact, it has almost no dissonance whatever. It does, however, pose several crucial esthetic questions. Does a piece of music have to have a beginning and ending? Are cliMimes and mood changes indispensable? Can music be a form of meditation?

title: Salem Assays Impact of Nuclear Plants
description: LOWER ALLOWAYS CREEK  I approve of the power plant being here, Deputy Mayor George Stiles said. A lot of the heavy taxpayers approve, too, because the plant relieves them of a heavy tax burden. But, like anything else, there's two handfuls for it and a handful against it.

title: Virginia Wyman Married to Juan Meyer
description: Miss Virginia Ann Wyman, daughter of Mrs. Charles Alfred Wyman of New York and Holmes, N. Y., and the late Mr. Wyman, was married in Greenwich, Conn., yesterday to Juan Miguel Meyer, son of Mrs. Kurt Meyer of Caracas, Venezuela, and the. late Mr. Meyer.

title: Design: A man's home can be his castle
description: Five thousand dollars. That's the magic figure designers and decorators agree on as a minimum for putting together a onebedroom apartment that emphasizes a personal look and good design. This sum allows for new furniture or old (as opposed to thriftshop finds): Two examples of $5,000 solutions are shown: two more will follow next week.

title: The Nation. In Summary
description: A case that goes to the essence of the., conflict between those who would clean up the environment and the economic interests that stand to be hurt in the process has crystallized in Minnesota. After a long trial, a Federal judge closed down a huge mining plant bicause, he said, there was a real possibility its pollution might produce cancer and other serious illness years from now; the owners and the community it supported ap4 Pealed; and. the Plant is now open. while the case is argued again.

title: Letters: Plaza SuiteAnd Sometimes Sour
description: To the Editor:Richard Curtis at the end of The World's Greatest TwoMile Spree (Travel/Section, April 7) prolonged the last sweet moments of it. No doubt the sweetest moment of all for the hotel staff at the Plaza was that of his departure  after having spread all of $5 among doormen, bellmen, the maid who had to clean up after his little cheesebiscuitsandwine party and the waiter In the Palm Court.

title: Director Taps Out Thoughts On Dance
description: HEMPSTEADSnapping his fingers, clapping his hands, and slapping his thighs at irregular intervals, Merce Cunningham, the choreographer, strode about the stage at Hofstra University last Monday setting his dancers in motion.

title: Waiting For Nixon
description: The ground on which the issue of impeachment is being fought out between the White House and the House Judiciary Committee has narrowed, but in the process it has sharpened as well.

title: Home Tells a Town's History
description: YAPHANK, L. I.Twelve years ago Inez and Vito Mannino bought a diplapidated house in this village in the geographic center of Long Island. They knew at the time that it was old, but they found out just how old only when a threeday downpour washed away the accumulated grime and revealed a 1726 cornerstone.

title: Mrs. Levbarg Engaged to Martin Klein
description: Dr. and Mrs. Morrison Levbarg of New York and Palm Beach have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mrs. Diane Rebecca Levbarg, to Martin 1. Klein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Klein of Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: JAZZ REP SALUTES DUKE AT EVE OF 76
description: The New York Jazz Repertory Company put on a program of Duke Ellington's music Friday evening at Carnegie Hall that was wider ranging and more varied than anything Mr. Ellington himself has done in many years.

title: Jailed Americans' Case Caught in. U.S.Turkey Debate
description: ANKARA, Turkey, April 27The fate of three Americans sentenced to life imprisonment here for smuggling hashish has become entangled in the growing conflict between Turkey and the United States over Turkey's decision to resume cultivation of opium poppies.

title: Appeal on Ouster Allowed
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex. April 27 (UPI)A judicial council of the United Methodist Church has determined that a minister who was suspended after he announced that he was a homosexual may reapply for his Ministerial credentials but that the Southwest Texas Conference of the church is under no obligation to accept the application of F. Gene Leggett, who was suspended after he led a protest at a meeting of the conference here in June, 1971.

title: Stamps
description: MOMENT of high drama in space, a moment that brought new life to the wounded Skylab spacecraft as it circled the earth, has been reenacted on a new United States commemorative for the Skylab undertaking.

title: Realism: The Painting Is Fiction Enough
description: NEW HAVEN, CONN. OF the many forms of visual art that currently compete for our attention, by far the most difficult to come to critical terms with is that congeries of styles and counterstyles that goes under the general name of realism. For tastes nurtured exclusively on the more radical forms of modernist art, realism of any sort constitutes a betrayal of the faith, and little more needs to be said about it. Those who pride themselves on a more pluralistic approach to current art are, on the other hand, haunted by the sentimental appeals to socalled humanistic values in the name of which really bad representational art has so often been defended in the past. Realism does not lack its partisans, but it does rather conspicuously lack a persuasive theory. And given the nature of bur intellectual commerce with works of art, to lack a persuasive theory is to lack something crucialthe means by which our experience of individual works is joined to our understanding of the values they signify.

title: Ford Attacks Democrats For Stress on Watergate
description: TULSA, Okla., April 27Vice President Ford intensified today an apparent campaign to bolster President Nixon by asking Republicans to stand with the White House for the good of the party in the November Congressional elections.

title: On Fairfield County's ThriftShop Circuit
description: SPRINGTIME in southwestern Connecticut means new green on the trees, daffodils along the Merritt Parkway and bagsale time in the thrift shops of Fairfield County. A bag sale, for the uninitiated, is one where all you can cram into a brown paper grocery sack is yours to take home for 50 cents or a dollar, depending on which thrift shop is running the sale. And what do you cram into the bag? Well, it might be material for braiding rugs or making quilts, or old clothes for the children to play dress up in, or a few slightly worn ski sweaters for yourself, or whatever.

title: Anne T. Breed To Wed Aug. 10
description: Dr. and Mrs. Frederic Brooks Breed of Gloucester, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Taylor Breed, to Michael Anthony Caringe of Killington, Vt., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Anthony Caringe of Glovei.sville, N. Y.

title: FRANK C. REGAN
description: Frank C. Regan, a former deputy collector of customs at the Port of New York, died Friday at the Clearview Nursing Home in Whitestone, Queens. He was 67 years old and lived at Wexford Terrace in Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Hospital in Neptune To Cite Area Clergy
description: NEPTUNE  The Jersey Shore Medical Center will hold its second annual Interfaith Clergy Luncheon at the hospital tomorrow. All clergymen in the hospital's service area are invited to attend.

title: U.S. Abandons Controls With Inflation Thriving And No Extra Answers
description: Wage and price controlsthe curse of conservatives and, for years, the utopian dream of liberalstook hold of the United States economy with a vengeance in August, 1971, and became everyman's whipping boy.

title: Mrs. Agnew in Hospital
description: TOWSON, Md., April 27 (UPI)Mrs. Spiro T. Agnew, wife of the former Vice President, spent today in St. Joseph's Hospital undergoing unspecified treatment and tests.

title: April in Detroit Is Murder
description: DETROITIf you live in Detroit, you have a better than 2,000 to 1 chance of not being killed by one of your fellow citizens, though the, odds vary slightly depending on where in the city you live. Optimists searching for perspective in the statistics of murder here insist those odds are, pretty good.

title: Nixon to Attend Expo
description: SPOKANE, Wash., April 27 (UPI)  President and Mrs. Nixon will attend the opening ceremonies for the Expo '74 world's fair. J. Welles Hender son, United States commissioner to Expo, said yesterday that he had received word that the President would fly here May 4 from Phoenix, Ariz., to attend the opening of the sixmonth long environmental fair with his wife.

title: OneofKind Regatta. Best Still a Question
description: The OneofaKind Regatta sponsored by Yachting magazine last weekend off Newport Beach, Calif., did not do anything to settle the burning question, What's the best class?

title: In the Other Catskills It's Tough To Exploit Development Opportunity
description: MARGARETVILLE, N. Y.The thin coating of snow that had been a disappointment to skiresort owners in the Catskill Mountains has melted. The soft, smoky gray of the maples on the roking landscape is gradually giving way to the green of spring.

title: UTAH CITY SHAKEN BY THREE KILLINGS
description: OGDEN, Utah, April 27Two young helicopter mechanics, accused of three killings and the shooting of two others in a stereo shop robbery, will be arraigned on firstdegree murder charges in City Court here Monday.

title: WestchesterConnecticut
description: STRATFORD, Conn.The water generally is cleaner. There never was real energy crisis in terms of marine fuels. Boats and equipment are selling well this spring even though prices have jumped from six to 15 per cent. That is the consensus one gains from visits to the harbor towns along the shores of Westchester and Connecticut on the north shore of Long Island Sound.

description: LODI  Felician College will offer a program today in which the 100year history of the Felician Sisters in America will be portrayed through an extravaganza of dance, song, music, slides and pageantry. The program will be presented in the college auditorium, starting at 3 P.M.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Last Monday Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, spoke out in his strongest terms yet about the Federal Reserve's responsibility to be tough in checking the growth of money and credit in the current inflationary environment, even at the cost of some damage to homebuilding.

Va.West Virginia State College scheduled a nineteenminute convocation Friday on Justice in America, and several hundred students and faculty members forsook brilliant spring sunshine, budding trees and lunch to hear and question a couple of imported speakers in an overheated auditorium.

description: LIMA, Peru, April 27 (Reuers)At least 21 people were killed and more han 100 reported missing when, a series of landslides wrecked three towns in he Peruvian Andes, according to reports reaching here today.

title: Bronx Boy Crushed to Death
description: A 12yearold Bronx boy was crushed to death yesterday by a boulder while playing near his home at 2108 Davidson Avenue, in the Morris Heights section. The victim, Hector La Sada, apparently dislodged the 1,200  pound rock after hitting a supporting beam with a hammer, the police said.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Many readers have urged me to divulge my wisdom about wine, and I do so gladly, for wine is a noble thing, being much slower than the martini (known in bibulous circles as the quick blow to the back of the head) and much harder than differential calculus.

description: Fiorella Bonicelli and Beatriz Araujo played a tennis exhibition at the Glen Head Racquet Club at noon last Tuesday. In Buenos Aires, perhaps, or Lima, Peru, that would be news. In Glen Head, L.I., 23 women and their preSports children showed up. And it was free.

description: Miss Martha Vollmer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold H. On Thursday, the trainer saddled Seth Hancock's Judger, who went on to win the Blue Grass Stakes at Keeneland. At Churchill Dawns today, Stephens sent John Olin's Cannonade into the Stepping Stone purse, and that colt went on to take, the sevenfurlong sprint by, two lengths against a dozen rivals.

description: There are progress reports based on Times inquiries into some unfinished news events.

title: Senior Wins Hearst Award
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 27 (UPT)William J. Schmick Jr., a senior journalism student at Temple University, has been named firstplace winner in the final 1973.74 national writing competition of the William Randolph Hearst Foundation's journalism awards program. Mr. Schmick, 24 years old, was chosen Tuesday for his news article on the financial crisis facing the Pennsylvania Ballet Company. The article, published in The Philadelphia Bulletin, resulted in contributions of $100,000 to the ballet company.

title: Tenants Want This, Owners Want That
description: It used to be you could tell spring had arrived In New York because the natives were again wondering, What's going to happen to the Mets this year? Now, if the past few years are any indication, another question has become a sign of spring here: What's going to happen to rent control this year?

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Recordings
description: THE onetoone relationship that a song recitalist establishes between himself and his audience is in many ways the most intimate, vulnerable and potentially wonderful situation in the entire musical experience. When it works, when vocal technique, interpretive insight, the song itself, and the listener's receptivity mesh, one's emotional responses are likely to be engaged on a personal level that is impossible in the more public idioms of opera, concert or even chamber music.

title: Subway Repairs Voted By City
description: Money for ugently needed repairs on the Sea Beach subway line was hastily voted by the city last week to enable the Transit Authority to proceed with the shoring up of a retaining wall said to be in imminent danger of collapse.

title: MOVIE OPENINGS
description: THE LORDS OF FLATBUSH A film directed by Stephen F. Verona and Martin Davidson and written by Gayle Gleckler, Verona and Davidson, Wednesday at the Baronet and RKO Kenmore in Brooklyn.

title: Music in Review
description: Silvia Parodi With the Guitar

title: Dave Anderson
description: Perhaps they were inspired by the name of the Jamaica resort where they meditated. Tryall.

title: Executive Volunteer Corps Here Assisting SmallBusiness Men
description: Eight years ago, two retired businessmen sat in a corner of an office of the city's Economic Development Administration and dispensed free advice to about 20 smallbusiness men a week.

title: Broker to Wed Mrs. Queeney
description: Mrs. Sharon Ann Queeney of New York plans to be married June 8 in Palm Beach, Fla., to William Gardner Knight, who is with the investment firm of W. E. Hutton & Co., here.

title: Faith Greenfield Married to John Lewis
description: Miss Faith Greenfield and John Van Dusen Lewis were married here yesterday afternoon in the Unitarian Church of All Souls. The Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring performed the ceremony.

title: The 38 who weigh Nixon's fate
description: WASHINGTON. The eagle never blinks. Perched in the center of the pale green wall, it stares fixedly across Room 2141 of the Rayburn House Office Building at Peter W. Rodino Jr. Plaster, yes, cloaked in white paint and gilt. But more, much more: a symbol of national greatness, an embodiment of a republic, a reminder of history's omnipresence. The talons cling tenaciously to the olive branch and the arrows. The beak clamps unyielding to the unfurled banner with the Latin phrase etched in gold. E Pluribus Unum. Out of many, one.

title: 25 ARE ARRESTED IN CAIRO PROTEST
description: CAIRO, April 27  Twentyfive Moslems were arrested yesterday when they tried to force their way into the National Assembly in the belief that the prayer leader at their mosque had been arrested in connection with the attack on a military academy here 10 days ago.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: May 34Sports Car Club of America TransAm and VW Gold Cup races at Lime Rock (Conn.) Park. Friday: practice and qualitying begins at 10 A.M. Saturday: 10 lap race for vintage cars at 11:45 A.M.; 60mile race for Super Vee cars at 1:30 P.M.; 200mile TransAm race at 2:45 P.M. Information: Lime Rock Park, P.O. Box 441, Lakeville, Conn. 06039; phone (203) 4352814.

title: Numismatics
description: MISS MARY BROOKS, director of the U.S. Mint, Miss Eva Adams, former Director, and Teresa (Mrs. Anthony) De Francisci, who was the model for the radiant head of Miss. Liberty on the Peace dollar designed by her husband in 1921, will be among the nationally known special guests at the second annual Greater New York Coin Convention in the New York Sheraton Hotel, Seventh Avenue at 56th Street. The fourday show opens to the public at noon on Thursday and there is no admission charge. The show's closing hour on Thursday is 9 P.M. On Friday the hours are 10 A.M. to 9 P.M.; on Saturday from 10 A.M. to 6:30 P.M. (to allow for social activities), and on Sunday the hours are 10:30 A.M. to 4 P.M.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Lee Elder, who won the Monsanto open, thus becoming the first black to gain automatic entry to the Masters, admits he nearly skipped the Monsanto event until his wife, Rose, changed his mind: She told me I should play because I had a lot of good friends in Florida. I didn't get down there until Wednesday and I didn't prepare myself for the tournament. But when I played a practice round, I started to hit the ball pretty good. As I continued to play in the tournament, all my friends told me how great I was playing and that I was going to win.

title: 3 Closing Birdies Keep Miller 2 Strokes Ahead
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., April 27 (AP)  Allen Miller had birdies on the final three holes today as he posted a fiveunderpar 67 and retained a twostroke lead at 201 in the $90,000 Tallahassee golf tournament.

title: In White Africa and Black Africa, the Political Changes May Be Profound
description: Colonialism may yet flourish for many years in Portuguese Africa, and black liberation still looks as distant as ever in South Africa. But after a military coup in Portugal and an unprecedented sucelles for the only legal South African party that is committed to real change, the expression, if not the face, of Southern African politics has begun to alter.

title: Champions Race At Lime Rock
description: Two Sports Car Club of America champions are among the drivers who will compete in the racing program at Lime Rock Park at Lakeville, Conn., next Saturday. They are Peter Gregg, the TransAm champion, and Bertil Roos, the Formula Super Vee titleholder.

title: When the Party Meets, Shirtsleeves and Long Talk
description: TEL AVIVThe scene is a shabby, rundown theater near Dizengoff Circle in the heart of Tel Aviv. More than 600 persons have filled every seat and packed the balcony. From the bare, harshlylit stage, a succession of shirtaleeved speakers harangues the audience, which rarely listens. People move in and out, clustering in the corridors and in the small cafe on the first floor where tea Is served in glasses, Russianstyle.

title: A Rabbi's Dream for Carolina Youth Is Shattered
description: WHITEVILLE, N.C.  Rabbi Reuben Kesner came to Whitevilla from Chicago 10 years ago as a circuitriding rabbi, living in the quiet little town With his unmarried sister and traveling long miles along the highways and blacktop roads lined with myrtle to reach 300 or so Jews scattered across deep southeastern North Carolina.

title: Revered Guru Who Abdicated 40 Years Ago Speaks at Carnegie Hall
description: More than 40 years ago, a man from India, revered by many thousands as virtually a new messiah, renounced his role and dispersed his follow, ers, declaring, Truth is a pathless land. . . You cannot approach it by any religion, any sect,

title: Bridge Being Repaired
description: SAG HARBOR  The North Haven Bridge, which crosses Sag Harbor Cove on Route, 114 between Shelter Island and this community, is undergoing a major facelifting. The 390footlong bridge, which is being repaired by the State Transportation Department at a cost of $343,370, has been closed to traffic since last month and is expected to be reopened by Memorial Day.

title: Abortion: Stormy Debate Due
description: TRENTONIn what promises to be a stormy session, the Department of Health will hold a public hearing here Tuesday on proposed regulations embracing the licensing and operation of abortion clinics throughout the state.

title: 2 Women senators Stand Together
description: ALBANY  State Senator Karen S. Burstein of Lawrence was cheerful last week. The Senate had just passed her second bill in two years. In her first term as Senator, however, she has yet to create a law. Her first bill was killed in the Assembly. And it appears her second, too, is headed for the graveyard of the Assembly Rules Committee.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: The Approaching Struggle Over Reform in the House
description: The House Democratic Caucus is planning to meet this week to consider a major proposal for House reform that has precipitated a bitter power struggle between Representative Richard Bolling, Demoarat of Missouri, and Representative Wilbur Mills, Democrat of Arkansas. If Mr. Mills loses the fight, he may also lose his customary informal title as the most powerful man in the Congress.

title: MIXED PIANO RECITAL PLAYED BY WHITTEN
description: Benjamin Whitten came to Town Hall on Saturday afternoon with a demanding pianorecital program and a mixed set of skills and aptitudes for performing it.

title: All Eyes Turn to Kentucky on Saturday
description: Played on any other day, it sounds like a minstrelshow anachronism.

title: Ramiro Artasanchez Madrigal Fiance of Pamela A. Marquard
description: Mr. and Mrs. William A. Marquard Jr., of New York and Quogue, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Pamela Ann Marquard, to Ramiro Artasanchez Madrigal of Mexico City.

title: TwoThirds of L.I.R.R. Riders Will Be Using New Cars, Starting Next Month
description: Twothirds of the Long Island Rail Road's 120,000 daily riders will be using the new fleet of 770 Metropolitan (M1), airconditioned trains when the road's new timetables go into effect May 20, according to the line's officials.

title: The Spinola Papers
description: The catalyst in the political reaction that brought Portugal a new government last week was a book, Portugal and the Future, by the country's new leader, Gen. Antonio Sebastitio Ribeiro de Spinola. What follows are excerpts:

title: A Musical Feast Named Sammy Cahn
description: MY theory is that Sammy Cahn is a natural dramatist and that Somerset Maugham was a surreptitious musician. Mr. Cahn is at Present holding fifth at the Golden (there's something extra about him, I think he has three hands) in a memorylane of lyrics called Words and Music, while Mr. Maugham is having his 1921 The Circle polished mirrorbright at the Roundabout halfway downtown, and if you don't believe me about Mr. Cahn you have only to attend to the agon he makes (agon: contest, agony) of a song called Three Coins in the Foimtain.

title: Music: English Chamber
description: Verdi's String Quartet, the only extant independent intrumental piece he ever rote, is so characteristic of is late style that on hearing it one expects to see Dame Quickly bustle onstage any moment to greet Falstaff. It is a genial, sunny, lyrical work, shrewdly crafted, not profound or subtle but as engaging as can be.

title: News of the Stage
description: Bette Davis has signed contracts to star in Miss Moffett, the musical adaptation of Emlyn Williams's priyewinning play, The Corn Is Green, dialing with a Welsh youth, who, through the sympathetic interest of one of his early teachers, obtains an education.

title: He traded in boxing gloves for a typewriter
description: Joe Flaherty is kind of halfbaked. A longshoreman turned New Journalist, he is obviously still shopping for a comfortable writing style. Sometimes he is Damon Runyon at a floating crap game, sometimes Robert Benchley cowering before a malevolent umbrella. On more strenuous occasions he may appear as a leftwing Eric Hoffer or a rightwing Murray Kempton, and when nothing less than literature is called for, he becomes his friend Norman Mailer. Included in Chez Joey are three unbelievable pieces on the race horse Secretariat, whom Flahertysounding word for unctuous word like Aquarius in the rocket's glare at Cape Canaveralapotheosizes as the Spirit of Reckless American Innocence.

title: ARMY TAKES OVER IN MOZAMBIQUE
description: LOURENCO MARQUES, Mozambique, April 27The flag of the Governor General of Mozambique was still flying here today, but the military has as effectively taken over in this territory as it did in Lisbon on Thursday.

title: Theater of Harlem In Dance Premiere Of Ancient Voices
description: The Dance Theater of Harlem presented one of the most attractive evenings of its ANTA Theater season on Friday. The house was sold out and numbered George Balanchine and Lincoln Kirstein among an audience that saw the New York dance premiere of Ancient Voices of Children, by the Yugoslav choreographer Milko Sparemblek.

title: Ideas & Trends
description: The Supreme Court has sidestepped the controversial issues of racial quotas and reverse discrimination, leaving professional schools free to continue programs that give racial minorities preferencesat the expense of whites.

title: Analysts' View
description: Wall Streeters who watch Delta Air Lines attribute the success of Its acquisition of Northeast Airlines to its ability to feed additional traffic into Northeast.

title: 3 Colleges In Hudson Cooperating In New Plan
description: JERSEY CITY  A public higher  education agency that acts as a broker between students and colleges has been established to meet the need for a community college in Hudson County. The county now has no such institution of its own.

title: Semiconductors Throw Their Weight Around
description: The American semiconducfor industry, originally tied firmly to the apron strings of the Federal Government and computer manufacturers, appears to be finding real happiness in the consumer markets.

title: Soviet Producers Told to Heed Consumer Needs
description: MOSCOW, April 27The Soviet Council of Ministers has told manufacturers of consumer goods here to set their own volumes of production according to market, demand.

title: KHEEL AND POWERS MEET ON CONTRACT
description: Theodore W. Kneel met for several hours yesterday with the head of be local printers' union in an effort to resolve their stalemated contract negotiations with the city's three major daily newspapers.

title: Mendel Davis Appointed
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (AP) Representative Mendel J. Davis, Democrat of South Carolina, has been appointed to the Board of Visitors to the Air Force Academy. His appointment was by the House Armed Seiwices Committee.

title: Headliners
description: While dealing with Labor for the Nixon Administration as Ambassador to Britain, Walter H. Annenberg has had labor problems of his own in the United States, Four years ago, groundskeepers who tended the private 18hole golf course on Mr. Annenberg's California estate went on strike, claiming that their wages were $1.25 less than those paid on other courses. Picket lines were set up, and Mr. Annenberg went to court for an injunction against the picketers. He claimed that his guests, who have included former Vice President Spiro Agnew and the Prince of Wales, were being abused by the strikers. Last week the court turned him down, ruling that When one accepts employment in a private home, he does not thereby become some kind of secondclass working person. Mr. Annenberg, busy in London, did not say whether he would appeal.

title: The Tyranny Of History
description: WASHINGTON, April 27One of the perversities of history is that it refuses to adjust itself to the convenience of men or nations. It keeps asking the most critical questions at the most awkward times. It ought to know that President Nixon is preoccupied with the Watergate and that everywhere there is now political disruption and a longing for quiet to sort things out, but it will not wait for a new political order.

title: Major Bills in Legislature
description: SATURDAY, APRIL 27, 1974

title: TV Monitors the Boardwalk
description: ATLANTIC CITYA boardwalk stroller.asked a policeman if that thing at the top of that pole was a television camera. The officer smiled and replied that it was, adding:

title: SHOP TALK
description: TEANECK  The Gem Mine, a new shop here, is owned by a roofer, a banker and a wine merchant. All three are rockhounds, a catchall word that embraces the millionplus Americans who are involved in a dozen diverse hobbies related to rocks and minerals.

title: Books: Tennis/Golf/Sumo
description: TENNIS FOR WOMEN. Edited by Ford Hovis with individual chapters by 10 women professionals. 255 pages. Rutledge. $12.95

title: Flyers Wary of Referees In Ranger Playoff Today
description: The carefully groomed, stylishly dressed, wildly cheering Philadelphia fan in the good seat at Madison Square Garden today will be Ed Snider, the board chairman of the Flyers.

title: Legislature Urged To Aid Alcoholics
description: TRENTON  The Legislature is seriously considering an expensive program that would eliminate penalties for public drunkenness and create new facilities at which to treat alcoholics.

title: Michael B. Gasch Will Marry Alice W. True in the Summer
description: Miss Alice Wentworth True and Michael Barrett Gasch plan to marry this summer. Their engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Edward Russell True Jr. of Washington, Berryville, Va., and Wianno, Mass., parents of the future bride.

title: One hundred glorious years of racing
description: Today, the Louisville CourierJournal said on May 17, 1875, will be historic to Kentucky annals, as the first Derby Day of what patentees to be a long series of annual turf festivities which we confidently expect our grandchildren 100 years hence to celebrate in glorious continuous rejoicings.

title: P.A.F. Gets Grant Of $10,000 for Year
description: The Huntington Town Board made an emergency grant last week of $10,000 to the Performing Arts Foundation of Long Island to help it through a financial crisis.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Theater Benefits

title: Civil Service Retirement Aid Up to Social Security Level
description: WASHINGTON, April 27 (UPI)President Nixon has signed a bill putting the minimum civil service retirement annuity benefit on a par with the minimum Social Security, benefit of $90.50 a month, the White House said today.

title: Students' Residence Curb Upheld by Appeals Court
description: CINCINNATI, April 27 (AP)A Federal appeals court has ruled that students registered to vote in staes in which they attend college are not automatically legal residents of those states.

title: The Explosion That Was
description: Had the threat to life been more remote, and the damage less devastating, the explosion that wrecked a 24story East Side office building last week could better be described in Rube Goldberg terms than as the near catastrophe it was.

title: Cambodia's Military Situation Worsening, With No Peace Talks in Sight
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 25  The battered Khmer Republic is moving toward the fifth rainy season of its civil war with no peace negotiations in sight and with both its military and economic fronts visibly deteriorating.

title: Golf Lead Taken By Jane Blalock
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., April 27 (UPI)  Jane Blalock surged into the lead in the second round of the Birmingham Classic today, carding a 68 for a total of 141.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: PAUL L. TILLES
description: Paul L. Tilles, president of Planco, Inc., business consultants, and former executive vice president of Michaels Brothers, the furniture chain, died yesterday at his home, 235 East 73d Street. His age was 74.

title: SERVICE CHANGES URGED ON M.T.A.
description: A Columbia University transportation specialist has called on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to make major service changes involving variable fares based on distance traveled and time of day and skipstop scheduling of trains.

title: AN AURA OF PEACE MARKS DAMASCUS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 27Despite the sounds of war that are clearly heard each day in Damascus, the Syrian capital is awaiting the arrival of Secretary of State Kissinger with little apparent tension.

title: Philippine Rebels Kill 9
description: MANILA, April 27 (AP)At least nine persons were killed and 19 wounded when insurgents, believed to be Moslems, ambushed a bus outside Iligan city in northern Minlanao, Philippine sources said today.

title: 2 Views on Controls
description: Two prominent economists of differing views evaluate the wage and price control system on the first page of Section 3.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Conquest of Rainier By a Rank Amateur
description: IN early August, the height of the climbing season at Mount Rainier National Park in the state of Washington, I drove south from Seattle to climb the 14,410foot peak. I had absolutely no climbing experience, but before I returned to my normal routine as a college professor in New York I was to learn that you don't have to be an expert to scale Rainier, one of the world's highest mountains. All you have to do is expose yourself to raging gales, push yourself to the point of exhaustion, freeze yourself to the bone and then spend the night in an unheated Shack 10,000 feet high.

title: Mary A. Glover Bride Of David Brett Forer
description: Miss Mary Adelaide Glover, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Glover of Locust, N. J., was married last evening to David Brett Foreir, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Forer of New York and Locust. Daniel O'Hern, Mayor of Red Bank, N, J., performed the ceremony at the Shadowbrook in Shrewsbury, N. J.

title: MAYER CHARTOCK
description: Mayer Chartock, a former manufacturer of sample cards, died Friday at Long Island Jewish Hospital in New Hyde Park. He was 85 years old and lived at 201 Brighton First Road, Brooklyn.

title: In Summary
description: The Consolidated Edison Company, beset by outraged customers, is now in trouble with its stockholders and potential investors as well. The utility for the first time failed to pay a quarterly stock dividend, its credit rating dropped and the state agreed to take over two Con Edison plants to help solve its financial problems.

title: LETTERS
description: Indexing

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTON  Senatorial courtesy, the controversial but unwritten rule that allows individual State Senators of either party to block gubernatorial nominees from their home districts, shows increasing signs of losing its clout.

title: Elizabeth Carrington Betrothed
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. John Claiborne Carrington of New York of the engagement of their datighter, Miss Elizabeth Carrington, to Stephen Koplik Bierman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel D. Bierman of New York and Norwalk, Conn.

title: MAHEU'S LAWYER TO ARGUE TUESDAY
description: LOS ANGELES, April 26The defense in the HughesMaheu defamation trial ended today its presentation of evidence designed to prove that Howard R. Hughes told the truth when he charged in a news conference in 1972 that Robert A. Maheu stole me blind while manager of Mr. Hughes's Nevada operations in 196670.

title: MacNeil: Changes Are Due
description: THERE is a lot of talk these days about what's wrong with the Metropolitan Opera. The administration complains of deficits and says everything would be all right if it had more money. Outsiders wonder why the repertory isn't fresher, the casting better, the conductors more experienced. But not much is heard about the situation from the performers; except for an occasional temperamental blowup that gets into print. Yet they see what's going on inside the organization, are privy to the flaws in its structure and have their own ideas as to what should be done.

title: Social Announcements
description: Births

title: Newark Treasure Chest
description: NEWARK  A new and major exhibition called Treasures from the Members' Fund is now at the Newark Museum. It looks back on a 25year period of notable growth in collecting.

title: News of the Camera World
description: A SERIES of six new movie projectors  all dual models that will take regular 8mm or Super 8 films  have recently been introduced by Eastman Kodak. All have a modern, lowprofile design with hinged, smoke colored dust covers (much like those used on record players), and all have automatic film threading with an enclosed 400foot takeup reel.

title: Music: Webern Night
description: The New York Philharmonic's Prospective Encounter discussionconcert at New York University's Loeb Student Center on Friday night turned out to be an Anton Webern night, though it was not billed as such.

title: There's Something Sour About The Sugarland Express
description: HOPING to cultivate an American New Wave, critics have recently given considerable attention to several young directors, including George Lucas (American Graffiti), Martin Scorsese (Mean Streets), Ralph Bakshi (Heavy Traffic) and John Hancock (Bang the Drum Slowly). Two more names can now be added to the list of contenders: Steven Spielberg, the 26yearold director of The Sugarland Express, and Terrence Malick, the 29year  old director of Badlands. A comparison is tempting because both movies are drawn from true crime stories about young lovers on the lam; but they represent opposite approaches to filmmaking.

title: Suffolk Officials Optimistic About Summer Tourism
description: MONTAUK  Capt. Carl Darenberg, who owns the Montauk Marina here, stood on top of a crate and surveyed the rows of boats that were parked at the pier.

title: Epilogue
description: Jury Report

title: Museum in Bergen Gets a New Home
description: RUTHERFORD  The 12yearold Rutherford Museum, whose displays range from fluorescent rocks and American Indian relics to the original talking doll and a homespun corner, has purchased a new home.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayPenn Treaty K.C. allbreed and obedience, Sun Oil Athletic Field, Concord Road, Feltonville, Pa.; 1,725 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: Ownerless Earth
description: When Michael Hamburger was a schoolboy in Berlin, there came the day when a teacher lined up the Jewish boys in the class to interrogate them. He reports laconically, I went home and discovered that was one of those who should have lined up. The Hamburgers got out to England in 1933; and by 1937 his father, having put himself back to medical School, the famous and ancient send Michael to Westminister School, the famous and ancient cradle of John Dryden and Matthew Prior and many another English poet.

title: The Dance
description: As its third and final major cast change in Martha Graham's Clytemnestra, the Martha Graham Dance Company presented Pearl Lang in the title role Friday night at the Mark Hellinger theater.

title: Svare Takes Blame in Drug Case
description: SAN DIEGO, April 27 (AP) General Manager Harland Svare of the San Diego Chargers took the blame today for violations of the National Football League's drug policy that resulted in $40,000 in fines for apparent marijuana use.

title: 14 ISRAELIS KILLED ON MOUNT HERMON
description: TEL AVIV, April 27 (Reuters) Fourteen Israeli soldiers were killed and seven injured today in a Syrian artillery attack and a helicopter crash on Mount Hermon, the Israeli Anny spokesman announced tonight.

title: Irish Police Hunt, Thieves, Who Stole 19 Paintings; Owner Says He Won't Pay Any Ransom for Them
description: BLESSINGTON, Ireland, April 27A woman with a French accent and four men who carefully selected 19 masterpieces valued at $20million from the mansion of a private collector were being sought by the police today.

title: Bergen Bar Unit Giving Needy Free Divorce Aid
description: HACKENSACKThe Bergen County Bar Association, in cooperation with the county, courts, has set up a volunteer system to provide free legal counsel to needy clients involved in matrimonial cases.

title: From Pennsy To Conrail Is a Long, Hard Trip
description: Someone is always putting a spike under the tracks that are supposed to carry the bankrupt Penn Central Railroad into prosperity just 18 months from now. When, and if, it gets there, the railroad is supposed to have a long life as mainstay of the Northeast rail network the Federal Government trying to glue together out of the battered remains of the Pennsy and six other financially ailing roads.

title: A TV Director And Muffy Renz Are Wed Here
description: Miss Janet Pitchford Renz was married yesterday afternoon to John Clinton McDonough Jr., an associate director for television with the sports department of CBS, Inc. (the new name of the Columbia Broadcasting System). The Rev. John Burton Thomas performed the ceremony in the. Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest. Msgr. Edward Fleming also took part in the ceremony.

title: New Game on Garden Ice Once Known as Hockey
description: The new game in town, sometimes referred to as hockey, delighted the throng at Madison Square Garden yesterday.

title: Henry Rogatz, 71, inventor And Oil Geologist, Is Dead
description: Dr. Henry Rogatz, a petroleum geologist who invented an apparatus to determine direction and dip of well bores and a drill bit to cut hard rock, died last night at Parkland Memorial Hospital in Dallas, from injuries suffered in a fall at home. He was 71 years old.

title: Rutgers Sweeps 3 Races
description: DERBY, Conn., April 28 Rutgers' lightweight crews swept to victory in all three races over Yale and Dartmouth today at the Derby race course on the Housatonic River.

title: Strong Showings of 3 Horses Expected to Cut Derby Field
description: LOUISVILLE, April 28Although few owners or trainers have said so, the indications are that the field for the 100th running of the Kentucky Derby on Saturday will be within reasonable bounds. The earlier fears that a topheavy entry list would necessitate running of the Derby, in an unprecedented two divisions have been dissipated by three crack performances within the last two weeks.

title: TRADE IN OPTIONS PROVOKES BATTLE
description: A battle is developing between the young Chicago Board Options Exchange and New York's old American Stock Exchange over the securities industry's newest bonanzathe lucrative business in stock options.

title: Staggered Working Hours Gain Acceptance
description: To have a better working day, start it a half hour earlier or later than everyone else.

title: Amy Phillips of Parke Bernet Is Married to Kevin P. Sullivan
description: Miss Amy L. Phillips, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. A. Lewis Phillips of New York and East Hampton, L. I., was married here yesterday afternoon to Kevin P. Sullivan, son of Mr. and Mrs. R. Peter Sullivan Jr. of Southampton, L. I., and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: U. N. Official Urges New Strategy on Commodities
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 28 Gamani Corea, the Inew head of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development is urging poor and prosperous countries to work out a new strategy for commodities.

title: Farm Worker Week Opens With a Mass
description: UNION CITY, April 28Farm Worker Week in New Jersey began at noon today with a church service dedicated to the United Farm Workers and their efforts to win better working conditions for those who labor in the lettuce Notes fields and vineyards.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: Weather: Cloudy, warm, showers likely today through tomorrow. Temp range: today 5680. Sunday. 4980. Additional details on Page 66.

title: Toll in Leningrad Air Crash Is Believed to Be 118 Dead
description: MOSCOW, April 28 (Reuters) All 118 passengers and crew members on a Soviet airliner were killed when it crashed and exploded in flames near Leningrad, Western sources said here today.

title: Angola: 13Year Struggle
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, April 28African nationalists have conducted a guerrilla struggle against Portuguese troops in Angola, Portugal's largest and richest African territory, since 1961.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The fall fashion show openings gathered momentum on Seventh Avenue last week without causing any undue alarums or excursions. The big event was the joint presentation of fashions by Egon von Furstenberg and his wife, Diane.

title: Roosevelt to Jonas Funeral
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 (UPI)President Nixon has designated James Roosevelt, son of President Franklin D. Roosevelt, to head a United States delegation attending funeral services tomorrow for Austria's President, Franz Jonas, the White House announced today.

title: NATIONAL CEMETERY PLANS BIG EXPANSION
description: WASHINGTON, April 28 (UPI) Arlington National Cemetery, which is so crowded that most veterans are no longer allowed to be buried there, has announced plans for an expansion that will increase the number of burial sites almost 20 times.

title: 31 Are Seized in 21 Raids Here On $189Million Garnbling Ring
description: Teams of rackets investigators simultaneously raided 21 alleged gambling wire rooms across the city yesterday, arresting 31 persons and dismantling what authorities described as a $189millionayear sportsand horsebetting operation.

title: Acquitted ExOfficials
description: Throughout the 48 days of the trial, as witness after witness took the stand, he sat there impassively, staring straight ahead or scribbling on a yellow lawyer's pad in front of him. Once only he laughed, when a witness said, When John Mitchell said drop it, you dropped it. When he was not in court, John Newton Mitchell slipped in and out of the Essex House at odd times, so that the guests and other residents seldom saw him. He lives alone there, being separated from his wife.

title: Legal Problems Not Over For 2 ExCabinet Officers
description: WASHINGTON, April 28Today's acquittal of John N. Mitchell and Maurice H. Stans does not end the legal problem of the two former Cabinet officers.

title: Cougars Score; Aeros on Top
description: CHICAGO, April 28 (UPI) Rosaire Paiement scored twice in the first seven minutes of the last period tonight to give the Chicago Cougars an uphill 3.2 victory over the Toronto Toros and a 21 lead in their fourofsevenganie World Hockey Association playoff.

title: Blacks Building a Nation While Battling Portugal
description: A JUNGLE CAMP, Portuguese Guinea  For 14 years, African rebels in this malariaridden jungle territory have been carrying on an armed struggle against Portuguese rule.

title: Hitchcock's Stars Recall His PersuasionPlusCheek
description: Alfred Hitchcock, that cherubic master of horror films, once quipped years ago, Actors are cattle. The remark, delivered in his slumbrous drymartini voice, so peeved Carole Lombard, who was appearing in his comedy Mr. and Mrs. Smith, that she rounded up three calves and herded them into a corral she had built on the set.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: DR. EDDIE ANDERSON, EXFOOTBALL COACH
description: LARGO, Fla., April 28 (UPI) Dr. Edward Anderson, retired football coach at Holy Cross College, who was elected to the Hall of Fame of the National Football Foundation for his coaching there and at the University of Iowa, died, Friday at his home in Bellair Beach. He was 73 years old.

title: Blacks Building a Nation While Battling Portugal
description: A JUNGLE CAMP, Portuguese Guinea  For 14 years, African rebels in this malariaridden jungle territory have been carrying on an armed struggle against Portuguese rule.

title: Film: Eye of the Artist
description: The idea that artists and creativity are synonomous is only partly illustrated by Films by Artists, the collection of six short subjects that opened last week at the Film Forum. The five artists involved are obviously sincere, in attempting to fuse avantgarde visions with the movie medium but only two appear to have succeeded with ideas that are visually arresting.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: If Dr. Russel V. Lee's April 12 OpEd article about the danger of mentally ill leaders merely lengthened the rent in psychiatry's garment of credibility, I would keep my peace. But it also distorts the field itselfits content, boundaries, professionalism and uses. And it offers suggestions which are liable to touch everyone.

title: Dr. Karl Meyer, Viral Scientist, Dies
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 28 Dr. Karl F. Meyer, an internationally renowned veterinarian scientist, died late yesterday of cancer at the University of California Medical Center. He was 89 years old.

title: Vesco Pleased bat Says He Won't Return to U.S.
description: Robert L. Vesco said yesterday that he was happy with the acquittal of John N. Mitchell and Maurice H. Stans.

title: Tea Prices May Rise
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, April 28 (Reuters)The cost of cup of tea around the world will rise if Sri Lanka and India, the major producers, put into operation a plan to insure higher prices for their crop. The plantation industry ministers of Sri Lanka Colvin De Silva, said his country was seeking support from Indonesia and producing countries in East Africa for a plan for setting a minimum price for tea.

title: L.I. Singles' Nights Offered at College
description: GREENVALE, L. I., Miriam was married for a while, but now she's single again. She says there are two alternatives for single people in the suburbs  the four walls or the singles bars. She prefers the four walls.

title: 3 Slay Ft. Dix Soldier and Stab Another in Seeking Marijuana
description: An 18yearold Army private was stabbed to death and another soldier was seriously slashed at Fort Dix early yesterday morning after an argument with three men who had asked them about buying some marijuana, a base spokesman said.

title: Leftists Plan Role; Socialist Leader Returns
description: LISBON, April 28Mario Soares, the leader of the Socialist party, returned here in triumph today from five years of exile in Paris as Portuguese, leftists began organizing themselves for the possibility of a role in a provisional government.

title: MISS GAMSON GIVES DANCES BY DUNCAN
description: Isadora Duncan is a legend, but on the evidence of Annabelle Gamson's program of solo dances at the American Theater Laboratory on Saturday, she was a substantial choreographer as well. Miss Gamson performed three dances and a suite of waltzes by Miss Duncan that were taught her (with the exception of two reconstructed waltzes) by Julia Levien, a member of the Duncan Dance Companies.

title: Bottle Stops Champion
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, April 28 (UPI)  Chartchai Chionoi of Thailand, the World Boxing Association flyweight champion, retained his title last night with a split decision over Fritz Chervet of Switzerland in 15 rounds. There were no knockdowns but the enraged Swiss fans stormed the, ring when the decision was announced and Chartchai was knocked down by a bottle as he was being hustled to the dressing room after his unpopular victory.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: WILLCOX ?? gher than 1972 (WGAMEX)Advt.

title: American League YESTERDAY'S GAMES
description: New York 11, Texas 2 (1st).

title: Rescue Workers in Peru Report 200 Dead in Slides
description: HUANCAYO, Peru, Monday, April 29 (Reuters)  Rescue workers said today that more than 200 people had been killed by a series of landslides that destroyed several towns and villages in the Peruvian Andes.

title: 1 KILLED, 6 INJURED IN FIRE ON TANKER
