And tonight, after the fifth game between the Rangers and the Philadelphia Flyers, who are tied, 22, either a Ranger or Flyer will say in defeat:

title: REPUBLIC LIFE SUED TO RESCIND MERGER
description: The Republic National Life Insurance Company, sued by the Securities and Exchange Commission last month on fraud charges, has been sued !again by a Tennessee company seeking to rescind a 1971 merger deal, it was reported yesterday.

title: U.S. Depicted as Unable to Deal With Shortages of Commodities
description: WASHINGTON, April 29The General Accounting Office reported today that shortages of basic commodities and raw materials were causing serious economic, social and political problems for the United States and other nations and that the Government's ability to deal with the shortages has been inadequate.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: The formation of Advocates for the Arts, which is assembling the first national constituency of citizens to support economic, public and legal action for the arts, was announced yesterday by David Rockefeller Jr., acting chairman, and John B. Hightower, president of the Associated Councils of the Arts.

title: TIGHTER SECURITY INVOKED BY I.B.M.
description: ST. LOUIS, April 29Frank T. Cary, chairman of the International Business Machines Corporation, told stockholders at the annual meeting here today that the company had increased security in its laboratories and he pledged to fight pending lawsuits against the company to completion.

title: FlameRetardant Pajamas: An Issue of Child Safety vs. Ecology
description: The simple task of washing children's sleepwear in New York State has come to exemplify how two worthy sets of laws can pit one goal against another: in this case ecology versus safety.

title: Hawaii SugarPineapple Strike Ends
description: HONOLULU, April 29 Hawaii's first dual sugarpineapple strike ended today with the return of about 6,000 members of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Unions to pineapple plantations on three islands.

title: Right of Reply (Cont.)
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.Arthur S. Miller's article on The Right of Reply on this page last week dealt a jolting setback to all of us herein the heartland who have been trying, bravely, to put in a kind word for the perfidious Eastern Establishtnent.

title: 4 Die in Oregon Plane Crash
description: GOLD BEACH, Ore., April 29 (UPI)Four men from Santa Barbara, Calif., were killed yesterday when their light plane crashed and burned shortly after taking off from this coastal community; The Curry County sheriff's office identifled the victims as Richard W. Stevens, 30 years old; Daniel E. Van Fossen, 33; Don A. Wirths, 33, and Alvin L. Hummel, 39.

title: C.A.B. Approves Fare Rise To Mexico and Caribbean
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (UPI)  The Civil Aeronautics Board approved today higher air fares between the United States and Mexico and the United States and the Caribbean.

title: A New SoftLens Maker Wins Approval of F.D.A.
description: Soft Lenses, Inc., a smal West Coast optical company has been granted approval by the Food and Drug Administration to make and sell soft con. tact lenses for cosmetic use.

title: Nixon Concedes Weighing Hush Payments for Hunt
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 President Nixon conceded for the first time tonight that at his March 21, 1973, meeting with John W. Dean 3d, he openly considered ordering payments to one of the Watergate conspirators, E. Howard Hunt Jr., to prevent Mr. Hunt from disclosing sensitive national security matters.

title: Sales of Chain Stores Gained 12.6% in March
description: With sales increased by the return of gasoline and the early Easter, chain stores achieved a 12.6 per cent gain in volume in March, over March, 1973, according to Chain Store Age magazine.

title: CHRYSLER RAISES CAR PRICES 2.9%
description: DETROIT, April 29  The Chrysler Corporation increased the price of its 1974 model cars an average of $99 today, predicted that another price rise would be needed before next September and issued a report that showed Its earnings for the first quarter of the year were down 98.2 per cent.

title: Beyond Compromises
description: In granting President Nixon a delay in responding to its subpoena, the House Judiciary Committee acted with the courtesy and restraint that from the outset have marked its conduct of a difficult assignment. view of his deliberate delays, his obfuscatory distortions, his withholding of evidence, and his own verbal attacks and those of his spokesmen, Mr. Nixon can hardly be said to have reciprocated the committee's model behavior. Unfortunately, his decision announced last night to provide only his own edited version of the tapes is another effort to outmaneuver the committee while professing to cooperate with it.

title: MICHAEL MOONEY, 58, LAWYER HERE, DIES
description: Michael Edward Mooney, former general counsel of the New York Curb Exchange and later of the American Stock Exchange, died yesterday at his home, 11 Pinecrest Road, Scarsdale, N. Y. He was 58 years old.

title: Democrats and Reform
description: The Democrats in the House of Representatives are scheduled to meet in caucus tomorrow and Thursday to decide their party's position on the proposed realignment of House committees. An unusual alliance of business and labor lobbies is working with a powerful bloc of selfinterested committee and subcommittee chairmen to defeat this desirable and rather modest reform.

title: Dunlop Criticizes Chrysler's Price Rise
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 John T. Dunlop, the Government's chief price enforcer, fired a broadside of criticism today at the Chrysler Corporation and its chairman, Lynn Townsend, for announcing an average price increase of $99 a car.

title: New P.S.C. Chairman
description: ALBANY, April 29Among the discoveries of Dr. Alfred E. Kahn during a career as an expert in publicutility regulation has been that the chairmanship of the State Public Service Commission is a thankless job. He offered that unvarnished estimate today while speaking of the post he was nonetheless accepting with great enthusiasm.

title: NIXON WILL GIVE EDITED TAPE TRANSCRIPTS ON WATERGATE TO HOUSE AND THE PUBLIC; NOTES AMBIGUITIES, INSISTS HE IS INNOCENT
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 President Nixon's offer of massive amounts of edited transscripts of his Watergate tape recordings delighted some Republicans on the House Judiciary Committee tonight, but may not have resolved the panel's demand for copies of the tapes themselves.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 43

title: For Economy Vacations Abroad, Families Switch Homes With Foreigners
description: H. Raymond Kluster is a lawyer who lives on Cape Cod, Leonard Ross is a lawyer living in England. Until 16 days ago, they had never heard of each other. But this summer they will live in each other's homes.

title: Economics Dominating Fterich Rade
description: PARIS, April 29The politics of economics has moved to the center of the French presidential campaign, as left and right clash over how best to assure increased employment and decreased inflation.

title: Mr. Nixon's Evidence
description: The massive pile of transcript pages that Richard Nixon now Says is to be made public may give him a shortterm political boost; in the long run, however, this gesture does not answer the needs of the House Judiciary Committee or conform to any law but Mr. Nixon's own.

title: Jersey Assembly Backs Casino Gambling Measure
description: TRENTON, April 29  The State Assembly approved a pro. posed constituional amendment tonight that would authorize casino gambling in New Jersey.

title: For Economy Vacations Abroad, Families Switch Homes With Foreigners
description: H. Raymond Kluster is a lawyer who lives on Cape Cod, Leonard Ross is a lawyer living in England. Until 16 days ago, they had never heard of each other. But this summenthey will live in each other's homes.

title: Contract Awards
description: CE Lummus Engineering, a subsidiary of Combustion Engineering, Inc., announced yesterday that it had been awarded a contract valued at $180million for an olefins and aromatics complex in Bahia, Brazil. The contract from Petroquisa, a large Brazilian chemical producer, covers engineering, procurement, construction advisory services and initial operating assistance. Scheduled for completion inp date 1977, the complex will produce aromatics, saturated hydrocarbons and gasoline.

title: NIXON WILL GIVE EDITED TAPE TRANSCRIPTS ON WATERGATE TO HOUSE AND THE PUBLIC; NOTES AMBIGUITIES, INSISTS HE IS INNOCENT
description: WASHINGTON, April 29President Nixon announced tonight that he would turn over to the House Judiciary Committee and make public tomorrow 1,200 pages of edited transcripts of Watergate conversations.

title: McDonald's Lifts Net 30.5% to Record
U.S. Oilman Reported Freed by Argentine Guerrillas
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 29 (AP)Victor E. Samuelson, the American oil executive for whom the Exxon Corporation paid a record ransom of $14.2million 49 days ago, was released today by his guerrilla kidnappers, informed sources said. He had been held for nearly five months.

title: May Crashes 2 Homers In Astros' 9Run Inning
description: HOUSTON, April 29 (AP)Lee May slammed a pair of tworun homers in a ninerun sixth inning as the Houston Astros crushed the Chicago Cubs tonight, 182.

title: Suffolk Check Shows, Penicillin Costs Vary
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., April 29 Suffolk County's Consumer Affairs Commissioner disclosed today that his agency had found that the price of 16 tablets of penicillin at pharmacies in the county ranged from 98 cents to $5.70.

title: Geogia a Districting Backed
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (AP) The Justice Department approved today Georgia's plan for redistricting 30 seats in the House of Representatives. J. Stanley Pottinger, Assistant Attorney General, told the Georgia Attorney General, Arthur K. Bolton, that the department's Civil Rights Division had found that the plan met the standards of the 1965 Voting Rights Act.

title: Hirohito Hailed With Deep Emotion By Tokyo Throng on His 73d Birthday
description: TOKYO, April 29Emperor Hirohito celebrated, his 73d birthday today, and 55,000 Japanese trooped through the moated confines of the Imperial Palace in a demonstration of the deep emotion and respect the Emperor still commands.

title: Grain and Livestock Futures Prices Register a Decline
description: The bears dominated the Midwest grain and livestock markets yesterday and slashed prices almost to limit lows in most of them.

title: Canada Wants a Trade Treaty To Bind Closer Ties With E.E.C.
description: BRUSSELS, April 29Canada has told the European Common Market that it would like to intensify its relations with Europe by negotiating trade treaty with the ninenation trade bloc, a Common Market spokesman confirmed today.

title: BOY DIES IN FIRE, 19 PERSONS HURT
description: A sixyearold boy was killed and 19 other persons, including 10 firemen, were injured early today when a threealarm fire spread through at least five residential buildings in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn.

title: Gurney Indicted in Florida On State Election Charges
description: WASHINGTON, April 29Senator Edward J. Gurney, Republican of Florida, has been indicted by a county grand jury in Tallahpssee, Fla., on charges of violating state election laws, an aide in the Senator's office here announced today.

title: Baltimore Aide Enters Plea Of No Contest on Tax Counts
description: BALTIMORE, April 29 (AP)  State Senator Clarence M. Mitchell 3d pleaded no contest today to four counts of failing to file Federal income tax returns.

title: Court Narrows Charges at Bloomfield
description: NEWARK, April 29All but two of seven charges against Bloomfield College were dismissed in Essex County court today, cutting through to the heart of the dispute between the private, coeducational institution and 13 faculty members and representatives of the American Association of University Professors.

title: CASINO GAMBLING GAINS IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, April 29  The State Assembly approved a proposed constitutional amendment tonight that would authorize casino gambling in New Jersey.

title: EXECUTIVES URGE WATERGATE'S END
description: WASHINGTON, April 29If a sampling of the mood of members of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States is any indication; Main Street U.S.A. wants the Watergate crisis to come to an end at almost any costincluding the impeachment of President Nixon.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Advantage Miss Morozova, Mr. Tanner, Mr. Smith
description: Arthur Ashe hopes he never has to play tennis in Denver again, Olga Morozova finally found her lucky city far from the Volga and Stan Smith got over his blues in St. Louis.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SAN DIEGO, April 29 (AP)Eugene Klein, owner the San Diego Charged, the first National Football League team, fined for use of drugs, proposed today that every N.F.L. player be given a urine test after each game if evidence of drugs is found, my recommendation is immediate suspensionno ifs, ands or buts, Klein said in a speech sports writers and broadcasters.

title: Space Lab Holding Orbit
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, April 29 (AP)  The Skylab space laboratory, abandoned by United States astronauts Feb. 8, is continuing in a stable orbit and has a lifetime of more than five years, the North American Air Defense Command reported today.

title: 68th St. Residents Win Point in Fight On Drug Program
description: Roy M. Cohn and other residents of East 68th Street won a round yesterday In their protracted legal battle to have a program for drug users and troubled adolescents removed from their block.

title: Yankees' Changes Shake Up Fans, Too
description: There's no doubt that the New York Yankees who will play the Oakland A's at Shea Stadium tonight are not the Babe RuthLou Gehrig Yankees. Neither are they the Joe DiMaggio Yankees nor the Mickey Mantle Yankees. Who then are these New York Yankees? They're the new New York Yankees, that'S who.

title: Nixon's Counterattack
description: WASHINGTON, April 29President Nixon launched tonight the strongest counterattack so far in his long struggle to survive Watergate. The documents he has decided to release, he conceded, were ambiguous and in some eases damaging. But he asserted they would demonstrate that the President has nothing to hide, and it seemed clear from the atmosphere at the White House that he and his senior aides believed the latest effort would bring him victory. In the hours before Mr.

title: State's Controller Planning Municipal Bond Data Bank
description: In a luncheon talk before the Fiscal School for County Officers at the Hilton Inn in Syracuse yesterday, New York State's Controller, Arthur Levitt, announced yesterday that he was about to establish a state data bank for municipal bonds.

title: Peddle and Business
description: The, freemarket price of gold will probably move still higher, according to Donald McCall, chairman of Consolidated Gold Fields, Ltd., of London.

title: College Senior a Trustee
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 29 (AP)A senior at Western New England College, Jerald J. Silverhardt of. White Plains, has been elected to a oneyear term on the college's board of trustees.

title: CITY FISCAL PLAN GAINS IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, April 29  Tentative agreement has been reached between Mayor Beame and Governor Wilson on some items in the city's fiscal package, including the $520million borrowing authority, with the 1centonthedollar rise in the sales tax to be taken up tomorrow, sources close to the discussions said today.

title: Emergency Rooms Found Misused by City Patients
description: More than a million people here are believed to use the emergency rooms of municipal hospitals each year for nonemergency services that could be performed in a doctor's office, according to a survey by the United Hospital Fund.

title: A City's Curb on Growth Barred by Federal Judge
description: SAN FRANCISCO, April 29 (AP)A Federal District Court judge said today that a city had no right to impose limits on its annual population growth and issued a permanent injunction that was sought by developers.

title: Burglars Here Loot Jewelers Exchange Of Millions in Gems
description: Burglars, managing to bypass alarms, made off with $1million to $3million in diamonds, gold, cash and other valuables during the weekend from the Paramount Jewelers Exchange on the Bowery at Canal Street.

title: Ballet: Martha Graham's Fantasia
description: At a time when so many of our choreographers, lost like uncouth Adams in the forest of nomenclature, are reduced to calling works New Ballet One, or perhaps even New Ballet Two, or, to be adventurous, Concerto, or Symphony in Seven and a Half Movements for Brass Band and Harmonium, Martha Graham continues to enrich literature with the titles of works. Indeed, I would prefer merely to read a list of her repertory to seeing the repertory of many a lesser choreographer. Her genius for her art spills over into related fields. She knows language. It helps.

title: Bacteria Frozen in the Antarctic For 10,000 Years Grow in a Lab
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 Bacteria apparently frozen in the Antarctic ice and soil for at least 10,000 years have grown and reproduced in the laboratory, scientists reported today.

title: A BANK IN INQUIRY IS OFFERING STOCK
description: Officials of the Century National Bank and Trust Company, an institution currently under investigation by state and Federal agencies in connection with alleged bribes and kickbacks, have been quietly offering their stock for sale. The bank officials seeking to sell out include Vincent F. Albano Jr., the Manhattan. Republican leader.

title: Suffolk Check Shows Penicillin Costs Vary
description: HAUPPAGE, L.I., April 29Suffolk County's Consumer Affairs Commissioner disclosed today that his agency had found that the price of 16 tablets of penicillin at pharmacies in the county ranged from 98 cents to $5.70.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: Chicago vs. Toronto April 19Tor. 6, Chi. 4.

title: Dodgers Hold Off Mets, 87
Supreme Court Assailed On Abortion Legislatior
description: CINCINNATI, April 29 (UPI Marjory Mecklenburg, chairman of the National Right to Life Committee, yesterday called the United States Supreme Court Justices arrogant and callous men whose decision legalizing abortions will take more American lives than World War II.

title: Eximbank Approves Loan
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 (Reuter)The United States ExportImport Bank approved today a $31.6million loan to the Ivory Coast to help finance the purchase of American goods and equipment to develop a hydroelectric project on the Bandama River. The entire project, to include an earth and rockfill dam, a powerhouse and transmission facilities, will cost $103.5million dollars.

title: Assembly Votes to Permit Citizens to Sue Polluters
description: TRENTON, April 29The State Assembly passed tonight, after more than two hours of emotional debate, a controversial bill giving New Jersey citizens the right to sue environmental polluters.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ROSE 0.4% IN WEEK
description: Steel production for the week ended Saturday gained by 0.4 per cent to 2,907,000 tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: CITY FISCAL PLAN GAINS IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, April 29Tentative agreement has been reached between Mayor Beame and Governor Wilson on some items in the city's fiscal package, including the $520million borrowing authority, with the 1centonthedollar rise in the sales tax to be taken up tomorrow, sources close to the discussions said today. The mayor and city aides are in the capital to press for more state aid to narrow the city's budget gap.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WESTFIELD, April 29New Jersey will be represented in the 100th Kentucky Derby Saturday by a thoroughbred owner didn't want and by a onehorse stable.

title: NIXON WILL GIVE EDITED TAPE TRANSCRIPTS ON WATERGATE TO HOUSE AND THE PUBLIC; NOTES AMBIGUITIES, INSISTS HE IS INNOCENT
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 President Nixon's offer of massive amounts of edited transcripts of his Watergate tape recordings delighted some Republicans on the House Judiciary Committee tonight, but may not have resolved the panel's demand for copies of the tapes themselves.

title: Amex Is Mixed in Slow Trading; OTC Prices Also Are Irregular
description: Prices rose yesterday on the American Stock Exchange, although trading was the slowest in: more than seven years and declines slightly outnumbered advances: Similar conditions prevailed in the overthecounter market.

title: Olympic Group Drafts Rules To Clarify Status of Amateurs
description: LONDON, April 29 (UPI)Lord Killanin, president of the International Olympic Committee, announced today new draft proposals to redefine rules on amateurism and to provide more definite guidelines.

title: College Chief Inaugurated
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., April 29 (AP)Dr. Robert L. Randolph was inaugurated yesterday as the 13th president of Westfield State College and as the first black president of a fouryear college in New England.

title: NoworNever Railroad
description: Governor Wilson has acted commendably, and just time, to prevent destruction of the muchneeded Adirondack railroad line from Remsen, just north of Utica, to Lake Placid. By directing his Department of Transportation to negotiate with receivers for the bankrupt Penn Central, Governor Wilson has held out hope that a sound facility will not be sacrificed either to the greed of the seller or the parsimoniousness of the state.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: XEROX INTRODUCES 9200 COPYING UNIT
description: The Xerox Corporation introduced a new copying system yesterday  called the Xerox 9200which it said was twice as fast as any of its present products and which a company official predicted would produce more revenue than any two of its products combined.

title: People in Sports
description: Tony Waldrop, whose philosophy of competing is explained across the front of his tee shirtRun for Fun was selected yesterday by the Track Writers Association as the outstanding athlete of the indoor season. The University of North Carolina miler won seven straight miles, all faster than 4 minutes, and set a world indoor record of 3:55. He will receive a pewter bowl named for Jesse Abramson, the long  time track writer for The New York Herald Tribune.

title: Ailing Folk Art Museum Is Under Inquiry by State
description: The Museum of American Folk Art, which began 13 years ago as the first institution in the city devoted to this booming field, is being investigated by Attorney GeneralLouis J. Lefkowitz's office as to its financial condition and the disposition of certain art objects from its collection.

title: Kodak's TV Report: Little Hard News for Investors
description: The Eastman Kodak Company broadcast its third television report to the community last night in Rochester, the city that is home to the company and 46,000 shareholders who hold 15 to 20 per cent of the outstanding stock.

title: Treasury Bills Rose At the Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 Yields on threemonth and six  month United States Treasury bills were sharply higher in the Government's weekly competitive sale to* day of these shortterm securities.

title: New Rules Spark Controversy Over Human Biologic Materials
description: Intense controversy has broken out at ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center here over whether doctors can use blood, sweat, urine and feces as freely as has been the custom, for research and teaching purposes.

title: TREASURY SHOWS HIGHER BILL RATE
description: The Treasury's shortterm borrowing costs registered an extraordinarily sharp increase ysterday, and other shortterm rates continued to climb.

title: Living in a Tepee of Burnished Steel
description: GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass.It has taken John and Carol Hay three years to put together their extraordinary steel and foam home. They've only been able to work on it on weekends and during the summer, but by June they'll move in and find out whether living in their tepee burnished steel is half as satisfying as it was to build it.

title: Nets' Quest FOr Crown Is at Hand
description: After a nineday layoff, the New York Nets embark on the second American Basketball Association championship series of their history tonight, meeting the Utah Stars at the Nassau Coliseum in the opener of a fourofsevengame series.

title: Dave Anderson
description: He's 34 but some of his hair is as white as his goaltender's mask. Eddie Giacomin is the oldest member of the New York: langers and suddenly the most respected. With that, hair, says a Ranger devotee, he doesn't look booable. But in the past he often was booed. Back in 1966 he was pelted with paper cups and crumpled icecream containers that he shoveled into the net in order to finish the game quickly. His name was taken in vain. Now it's taken in admiration. Now the Madison Square Garden loyalists are shouting, Eddie, Eddie, Sports as their battle cry. Whenever be hears it, he smiles. But nobody can see the smile behis mask hides it. When the Rangers resume their Stanley Cup semifinal series with the Flyers in Philadelphia tonight, the Spectrum spectators will be hissing, Eddie, Eddie in derision. Behind his mask, he'll be smiling then, too.

title: Cambodian Economist May Upstage Sihanouk as Head of the Insurgency
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 25A boyishlooking Frenchtrained economist named Khieu Samphan appears to be gently upstaging Prince Norodom Sihanouk as the eventual leader and spokesman of the Cambodian insurgency.

title: Bookmasters Struck
description: District 65 of the Distributive Workers of America has struck Bookmatters Stores, Inc., a 10unit chain of retail book stores here, in an effort to obtain pay increases for 75 members employed at the stores. The union is picketing the stores, but a spokesman for Bookmasters said management officials were continuing to keep them open on a limited schedule.

title: State Criticizes Anker Plan for Rezoning Brooklyn High Schools
description: City School Chancellor Irving Anker's plant to redraw the attendance zones for Brooklyn high schoolswhich, Mr. Anker said, would improve both integration and utilization has been sharply criticized by the State Education Department for not doing enough on both points.

title: FULBRIGHT IN PERIL IN 6TH SENATE BID
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., April 29 Senator J. W. Fulbright is in danger of being defeated for a sixth term by a popular young challenger, Gov. Dale Bumpers.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SAN DIEGO, April 29 (AP)Eugene Klein, owner of the San Diego Chargers, the first National Football League team fined for use of drugs, proposed today that every N.F.L. player be given a urine test after each game. If evidence of drugs is found, my recommendation is immediate suspensionno ifs, ands or buts, Klein said in a speech sports writers and broadcasters.

title: Lisbon Secret Police Symbol of Harsh Rule
description: LISBON, April 29  They have done everything intelligently, a young woman said in a bookstore this morning, speaking of the Portuguese junta. The only thing I blame them for is that they did not tear fingernails out of those men they took from Antnio Maria Cardoso, those men who have been tearing out our fingernails for 40 years.

title: Anger and Despair Close Indian University
description: LUCKNOW, India, April 26 The dormitories at Lucknow University are closed. The students, hauling luggage to rickshas and motor scooters, drift away.

title: 50C FARE SOUGHT FOR RUSH HOURS
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator and masstransit advocate, yesterday recommended a 50pent transit fare during morning and evening peak periods and a 25cent fare at other times.

title: CAR MAKERS SET A RISE IN OUTPUT
description: DETROIT, April 29  The United States auto industry, encouraged by indications of increased demand, especially for fullsized models, has added about 86,000 cars to its secondquarter production schedules, an increase of about 4.2 per cent.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The name and address are the same, but the image is different at Rose Lash International at 58 East 55th Street since Mrs. Lash retired last month and her daughter, Corrinne Travis, took over.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: KANSAS CITY PACT REOPENS SCHOOLS
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo, April 29 (AP)  The city's schools reopened today after a 42day teachers' strike and most of the 60,000 pupils resumed classes.

title: Elderly Getting Retail Discount
description: After nearly two years of virtual storetostore solicitation, a small but growing number of citizens led by a Manhattan housewife have persuaded more than 1,300 small businesses in the city to establish a retail sales discount for elderly persons on fixed incomes.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, April 29The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: 5Day Arts Expo '74 Opens at Dozen Sites
description: Times Square, normally cacophony of traffic noise and human babble, echoed yesterday afternoon to the sounds of Mozart, Berlioz, Franchetti, Schubert, Elliot Carter and Duke Ellington as the city opened a fiveday performing and visualarts exposition. The event is expected to draw 50,000 careerminded students from the tristate area.

title: Washington Ice Age
description: The makers of economic policy in the White House and Congress sit in glacial immobility while prices climb at the steepest rate in a quartercentury, unit labor costs start skyrocketing again, real output plummets and the dollar is back in trouble in world money markets.

title: Two Cited for Guild Awards
description: A listing of Page One awards by the New York Newspaper Guild in last Sunday's New York Times ommitted the names of two recipients. They were Martin Tolchin of The Times, winner of an honorable mention, local reporting, for a series of articles on the South Bronx; and Bill Andrews of The Daily World, winner of an honorable mention, editorial cartoons, for his Day Care cartoon.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: AMEN CORNERS Brooklyn's churches provided schools for the poor before there was a public school system and libraries before there was a library system one of those libraries led to the Brooklyn Museum, Botanic Garden and the Children's Museum.

title: Yale Art Building  Decade of Crises
description: NEW HAVENIt is just slightly more than 10 years since Yale's Art and Architecture. Building opened, Making the front cover of most of the country's architectural journals and setting off alstorm of controversy that has never really subsided.

title: Bonn Cancels a Meeting With East German Official
description: BONN, April 29 (UPI)Chancellor Willy Brandt's Government canceled today a meeting tomorrow with Deputy Foreign Minister Kurt Nier of East Germany a week after the discovery of an East German spy in the Chancellor's office.

title: Lord Robertson, Britain's Chief In Occupied Germany, Is Dead
description: LONDON, April 29  Lord Robertson, who as Gen. Sir Brian H. Robertson was military governor and Commander in Chief of the British Zone of occupied Germany, died today at his home in Gloucestershire. His age was 77.

title: Girl, 3, Dies in Brooklyn Fire
description: A 3yearold girl died of burns and some smoke inhalation in a fire that swept through the first and second floors of a threestory brick building in Brooklyn yesterday morning, authorities reported. The police found the girl, Nellie McDuffy, near the kitchen window of a secondfloor rear apartment at 651 Shepherd Avenue. The girl's mother, Mrs. Allena Curry, and a 1yearold son, Calvert, escaped by a fire escape outside a front room.

title: Giants Sign Tucker to Multiyear Pact
description: The Giants, who have lost five players to the World Football League, saved bne yesterday: Bob Tucker, the tight end, agreed to terms set by Andy Robustelli, the Giants' managing director and spurned a big offer made last week by the Philadelphia Bell of the W.F.L.

title: Tides Around New York
description: For high tide at Asbury Park and Belmar, deduct 34 min. from Sandy Hook time.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 43

title: SOPRANO'S PROGRAM IS A REFRESHING ONE
description: There are some singers who overwhelm an audience with their vocal prowess, others who beguile their listeners by successfully marshalling far more rnodest resources. Edith GordonAinsberg (who made her New York debut in 1948 as Edith Gorden) proved to be an artist in the latter category at Carliegie Recital Hall on Sunday.

title: High Court Agrees To Antitrust Study
description: WASHINGTON, April 29 The Supreme Court agreed today to review an antitrust decision that the Department of Justice charges has seriously undercut the Government's ability to enforce orders barring acquisitions that reduce competition.

title: A 2D TRIAL OPENS IN SHABAZZ DEATH
description: NEWARK, April 29  The prosecution in the murder and conspiracy trial of Albert Chavies charged today that he was the hub of the entire conspiracy to kill Minister James McGregor Shabazz in front of his home last Sept, 4.

title: FULBRIGHT IN PERIL IN 6TH SENATE BID
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., April 29 Senator J. W. Fulbright is in danger of being defeated for a sixth term by a popular young challenger, Gov. Dale Bumpers.

title: Two Howes Pace 94 Aero Victory
description: HOUSTON, April 29. (AP) Mark Howe and Gordle Howe, his father, scored shorthanded goals in less than one minute of the first. period to start the Houston Aeros on the way to a 94 rout of the Minnesota Fighting Saints in their World Hockey Association semifinal playoff tonight.

title: Cincinnati Mayor Designate Leaves City's Government
description: CINCINNATI, April 29  Councilman and Mayordesignate Gerald H, Springer announced today his resignation from the city government, citing family considerations as his reason.
